loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María del Socorro tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el caserío Hualtaco a 10 km del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su domicilio donde ofrece diversas golosinas a sus clientes y vecinos. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida desde hace cuatro años, sobretodo porque se encuentra ubicado en una zona céntrica. Adicionalmente comercializa productos de belleza por catálogo entre los clientes que llegan a su tienda. El negocio le hace sentir bastante activa y con las ganancias que obtiene se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

María del Socorro desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos (golosinas y productos de belleza). Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María del Socorro is 45 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the town of Hualtaco, 10 kilometers from the district of Tambogrande. It is an agricultural region that is located in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

She has a small business in her house where she sells a variety of the sweets to her customers and neighbors. The business has had a good client base for four years because it is located in a central area. She also sells beauty products from catalogs to the customers who come to her store. The business makes her feel very active and with her earnings, she supports her family.

María del Socorro would like to expand her business by buying more products (sweets and beauty products). To do this, she has requested a loan of PEN 1,000.00 from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products and sweets for her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah O. sells provisions in a shop at Abura near Frami. Hannah has received senior high education. She is divorced and has three children. She has been selling provisions for 10 years.  

As a single parent her income goes into school fees and utility bills. She is requesting for a loan to buy extra provisions that are requested by her customers. The additional income realized as a result of the loan will be re-invested back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: She is requesting for a loan to buy extra provisions that are requested by her customers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys nació en la ciudad de Mollepata en la provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 40 años de edad, tiene su pareja con quien tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, Gladys vive en la ciudad del Cusco donde hay hermosos casas, calles históricas donde vivieron antes los Incas, ella es una persona trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia, ella tiene un restaurante donde ofrece desayuno y almuerzo. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En Cusco se encuentra la ciudadela de los Incas Machupicchu (Cusco, Perú).

Gladys en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejempló arroz, azúcar, aceite, carne, verduras y otras cosas más que necesita para preparar la rica comida.  

Gladys es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Puntualito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Gladys was born in the city of Mollepata, Anta Province, Cusco Department.  She’s 40 years old and she and her spouse have four children.  Currently, Gladys lives in the city of Cusco where there are beautiful houses and historic streets where the Inca used to live.  She is a hard working person who supports her family with a restaurant she has where she offers breakfast and lunch.  She’s been in business for four years now and does very well.  The Inca citadel, Machupicchu, is found in Cusco (Cusco, Perú).

On this occasion Gladys needs the loan to buy supplies like: rice, sugar, oil, meat and vegetables and some other things she needs to prepare the delicious food.

Gladys is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Puntualito” (Right on Time) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Esa's Group

texts.en:
Esa P., a resident of Magcamiguing, Calamba, is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. 

Esa, 52 years old, married, and blessed with five grown children, earns a living by snack vending in the local community. Engaged in this business for 10 years, she earns an average of not less than P2,000.00 a month. 

In 2006, Esa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having  repaid her previous loan, she is now requesting a third loan of Php6,000.00 to purchase raw ingredients for her snacks vending.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Lizandro

texts.es:
Lizandro es un padre D. familia  D. 28 años que vive con su esposa y menor hijo, tienen casa propia situada en el distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz.  Este distrito se caracteriza por ser una zona muy comercial (compra y venta D. productos al por mayor y menor).

El trabajo D. Lizandro es L. venta D. toda clase D. jugos D. frutas en el mercado D. ese distrito, es una persona muy conocida por los trabajadores del mercado por los ricos jugos que venD. y el carisma que tiene para vender.  También cuenta con L. ayuda económica D. su esposa, cual se dedica a L. venta D. productos D. belleza, compartiendo los gastos familiares.

Lizandro solicita un préstamo para mejorar su casa (colocar techo), por intermedio D. Edpyme  Alternativa piD. un crédito D. 2500 nuevos soles, con el único fin D. brindarles una vivienda segura a su esposa e hijo.

Lizandro es un padre D. familia responsable y muy trabajador que con ayuda D. su esposa quieren mejorar su vivienda para que se encuentren más seguros y tranquilos.
texts.en:
Lizandro is a 28-year-old father who lives with his wife and young son. They have their own home in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz. This area is known for being a commercial area where products are bought and sold in bulk and in smaller amounts.

Lizandro’s job involves selling all types of fruit juices at the district market. He is well-known among the other market workers for the tasty juices that he sells and the charisma he displays as he is making sales. His wife also supports their family financially and shares in the family expenses by selling beauty products.

Lizandro is requesting a loan to make an improvement to his house (installing a roof). For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 2500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that he will have a safer home for his wife and son.

Lizandro is a responsible father and a hard worker. With the help of his wife, he will be able to improve their home so that they will have safer and more peaceful conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to install a roof on his house.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
El señor Segundo José es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor de 53 años quien desde hace más de 25 años se dedica al comercio de perecederos en sus inicios vendía la fruta o verdura de temporada. En la actualidad vende de todo un poco desde tomate, chayote, chilote, cebolla, chiltoma, ayote, melón, plátano, sandilla, hojas para tamales...etc.

El señor Segundo con el crédito comprará las frutas y verduras para surtir su negocio el cual se encuentra en Tipitapa.
texts.en:
Segundo José is a 53-year-old, hard working, enterprising man who has sold perishables for the last 25 years.  When he started out he only sold seasonal fruit or vegetables.  Currently, he sells a little bit of everything: tomatoes, chayote, garlic, onion, peppers, pumpkin, melons, bananas, watermelon, leaves to wrap tamales, etc.

Segundo will use the loan to buy fruit and vegetables to stock his business which is located in Tipitapa.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is 35 years old. She has 5 children who are between the ages of 2-15 years old. They are all in school, apart form the youngest. Her husband is a farmer and he also does business. Emerthe sells food stuffs such as cassava, cooking oil, beans, rice, etc. She has done this business for 7 years and this business has enabled her improve her standards of living. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs including cassava, beans, cooking oil, and rice. She plans to save some of her profits and to pay her children's school fees with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.en: Maria Cecilia is 25 years old and lives in the city of Cotacachi in northern Ecuador. She is married and lives with her aunt, her husband, and their 2-year-old daughter. She describes herself as an indigenous women with a strong desire to work and progress honorably. Her business is an artisan workshop that makes bags, jackets, and sweaters. She began her business with a loan to buy sewing machines. She is seeking this loan to purchase fleece to make sweaters. Maria Cecilia reports that her business is going well and that she has many orders, especially for upcoming holidays. She hopes that his loan will help her increase her income and improve the quality of life for her and her family. In the future she wants to improve her sewing machines and employ other people in her business.

loans.use: to buy fleece to make sweaters.

loans.name: Upendo Mloganzila Group

texts.en:
Josephine, who is in her late 20s is married with two children who go to school.  She has been running a liquit soap business for one year now.  She works from 8am to 4pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge, which she wants to use to buy the materials needed for making more liquid soap for her sales.  Her dream is to one day start a business selling chicken.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Upendo Mloganzila" which has a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy materials for making more liquid soap.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.en:
Mayra is 19 years old and single. She lives in the city of Ibarra, Ecuador, with her parents. Young, entrepreneurial, peaceful, and calm, Mayra has her own embroidery business. She creates hand-embroidered designs on t-shirts and other clothing. She is seeking this loan to purchase cloth and thread to complete her handiwork. 

Mayra has been embroidering as a business for two years. In the beginning, she had help from her mother. Now she works independently. Mayra’s goals for the future are to finish building her house and to finish her studies. In the photo, Mayra is proudly demonstrating her hand-embroidered design on a souvenir Ecuador t-shirt. Ibarra is located very close to a large market town very popular with travelers and locals alike.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Mrs. Von is now 30 years old, living in Siem Reap province. She has four children who are dependent on her.   She is not only a good housewife but also a good business woman. Currently, she sells dirt, earning three dollar per day net profit and her husband drives a small motor boat.  They work very hard to earn more income to support their life.  They would like to start a new business transporting goods because they see market opportunity in Siem Reap.  However they do not have enough money to purchase a truck. They would like to borrow money from Kiva to purchase a used truck. With this loan and a new car, they can earn more profit.  With their profit from their new business, they would like to improve and widen their house. They also want their children to become well educated people.

loans.use: to purchase a used truck

loans.name: Seidy

texts.es: Seidy, tiene la edad 49 de  años, está casada y vive con su esposo hijos y un nieto. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de materiales para la construcción de un local para poner una costureria. Ella cuenta con maquinas de coser a su poder y lo que pretende es construir un local par tener donde colocar las maquinas para trabajar. Ella quiere tener un local para hacer sus costuras para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y  crecer con le proyecto de costureria. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Seidy is 49 years old, married and she lives with her husband and children, and a grandson. She plans on purchasing construction materials with her loan to build a store space in which to set up a tailoring shop. She owns sewing machines and what she plans to do is to set up a space where she can place her machines to be able to work. She wants to have a store pace to craft her projects to later resell in the market in her locality and to other places. She wants to generate more income for the sake of her well-being and that of her family. She wants to make her tailoring business grow. It is the first loan which she receives from Fudecosur (Kiva Field Partner). She has not had previous loans with other state banks but Fudecosur has provided her with a loan, including greater benefits and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to build a store space in which to set up her tailoring shop.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma who is fifty years of age, has one child and is a resident of Pasay City in the Philippines. She is married to Maximo, a dental technician. Together with her husband and child, she manages the household while operating her business. She works hard to continually provide income for the family’s everyday expenses.

Gemma operates a sari-sari store. In the Philippines, a sari-sari store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP’s-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes an income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and then selling them by the piece. She also sells burgers for snacks.

Gemma’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 750 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP CCT loan. She will be using it to buy groceries, beverages and other products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she does so.

Gemma hopes to give her child a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work in her store.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups comprised of fifteen to thirty members that meet on a weekly basis. Gemma faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans. Gemma draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages and other products to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Madame Astou est une femme de 50 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active depuis 10 ans dans la commerce  et la vente de déjeuner et de perruques. Elle a choisi son activité par opportunité.  Elle est surtout intéressée par l’aspect lucratif de son activité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat et la confection de perruques  qu’elle doit envoyer en France pour la revente par le biais de sa sœur. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses revenus en vue de mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Ms. Astou is a 50-year-old woman who lives in Senegal. She has been active for ten years in selling lunches and wigs. She chose this work by chance. She is especially interested by the lucrative aspect of this work. 

She has been a member of a brand of the micro-finance institution U-IMCEC since April 2011. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for buying and making wigs that she has to send to France to resell via her sister. Her goal is to grow her revenues with the aim of supporting herself better.

loans.use: to buy wigs to resell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man with eight children between 24 and 5 years old living in his own house in Karuguuza, Uganda. He has been dealing in spare parts as well as mechanics for 10 years and he faces a challenge of inadequate tools, which affect the profits of his business. His dream is to own a big spare parts shop plus a garage. Julius needs the loan facility to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Goodluck

texts.en: Goodluck is a 52-year-old married man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. A farmer whose dream is to own a bigger tea plantation, his major challenge is inadequate labor to work on the plantation. Goodluck is requesting this loan to pay labour costs involved in the maintenance of the plantation.

loans.use: to pay labour for tea plantation maintenance.

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz is the leader of this group. She is 33, and together with her husband she runs a private business. She has two daughters and a son. 
All the children study at school.  Nine years ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms, Gulnaz opened a computer saloon. In the beginning, she had six computers.  Now she has increased its number to fifteen. She also purchased a printer and a Xerox. At the moment, she needs additional funds to purchase spare parts to update the computers in the saloon. In the future, Gulnaz plans to repair the saloon, and, with the profits gained from the business, she wishes to purchase a house in Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan).

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo Group in Western Kenya! It's headed by Mary as the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mary is a mother of seven children. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best farm produce achieved as a result of use of fertilizer and hybrid seeds provided by the firm and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a very good maize yield, harvesting 11 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Mary will educate her children and use the same for loan repayment.

In 2012, the members of Upendo group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Mary is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mo'tasem

texts.en: Mo'tasem is 29, married, and has one son.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary, and also runs a carpentry business on the side in order to supplement his income. Mo'tasem wants to improve the quality of his work by purchasing new a carpentry kit, but he hasn't got enough money to buy it, so he needs a loan from FATEN. This new carpentry kit will enable him to improve his work and increase the number of customers he can deal with, which will increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions. Mo'tasem is pictured at work on a carpentry project.

loans.use: to improve the quality of his work by purchasing new a carpentry kit.

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa is a 43-year old married mother of two children. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by making iron doors. She runs a small general store selling food products and household necessities in their community. She has been in this business for over three years. 

Thoa would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Charlito

texts.en:
Mr. Charlito is a businessman making furniture in Digson, Bonifacio. He is 50 years old. He is married to Charles and they have two angels that make their family complete.

He gets his source of living from his business and his wife's business. He was able to maintain his business successfully; it is manageable despite the problems that come. He joined Paglaum MPC this year, 2011, because he is very interested in the program and services that PMPC offered, and because it is the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao.

For his first loan cycle, he was given the privilege to avail himself of the amount of 30,000 PHP to add to his capital for his existing business. The future income from his business will be used for his basic needs, loan repayments and savings for the future of his family.

loans.use: to add additional capital for his business

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel de 33 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su madre. Miguel se dedica al comercio. Hace varios años que logró establecer una pequeña tiendita en la cual vende diversidad de productos tales como: pan dulce, golosinas, bebidas, aceite, huevos, arroz, etc. Miguel es un hombre emprendedor ya que no pierde oportunidad para echar andar sus ideas de negocio. Ha trabajado muy duro para mantener en marcha su pequeña tiendita y gracias a Dios ha logrado estar siempre un paso a delante de la competencia. Posee mucha experiencia en el negocio por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes fijos que cada día lo prefieren más por ser un hombre honesto y dedicado en su trabajo. Ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio ya que su sueño es poder abarcar una mayor demanda de tal forma que pueda mejorar sus ventas así como sus ingresos que le permitan aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar artículos de tienda tales como: arroz, pan dulce, aceite, golosinas, huevos y de más productos que permitan atraer a más clientes de tal manera que pueda lograr su sueño de aumentar  sus ventas e ingresos así como su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Miguel Ángel is 33 years old and lives in his own home with his mother.  Miguel works in sales.  Many years ago he was able to open a small store where he sells a variety of products such as: sweet bread, candy, drinks, oil, eggs, rice, and more.  Miguel is an entrepreneurial man who doesn't miss out on opportunities to try out his ideas for business.  He has worked very hard to keep his small store going and, thanks to God, has been able to stay one step ahead of the competition.  He has a lot of business experience and has a lot of regular customers who grow to prefer his store because he is an honest man and is dedicated to his job.  He has decided to invest in his business because his dream is to be able to provide for greater demand so he can improve his sales and earnings and aspire to a higher quality of life.  For those reasons, he decided to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL, to buy merchandise for his store: rice, sweet bread, oil, candy, eggs, and other products that will allow him to attract more customers.  Then he will be able to achieve his dream of increasing his sales, his earnings, and his quality of life, as well as that of his family.

loans.use: buy rice, sweet bread, oil, candy, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: El señor Emiliano  tiene 43 años, tiene seis hijitos que se encuentran en edad escolar y vive en la zona internacional, hace 14 años que se dedica a la venta de helados y los tres últimos meses del año empieza con la venta de cosas reciclables como ser botellas, latas de cervezas plásticos baterías y otros. Su esposa le colabora con la venta de los helados al igual que unas de sus hijas, el señor vende sus helados por todas las zonas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz de forma ambulante   y también sale a las diferentes provincias  aledañas de Santa Cruz, con el dinero del crédito comprara un motor para su moto y también botella y latas por mayor para poder venderlos como material reciclable, el Sr. Emiliano es una persona responsable y trabajadora con ganas de seguir adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos ya que desea brindarle un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Emiliano, 43, has six little children who are school age and he lives in the International zone.  He’s been selling ice-cream for 14 years and the last three months of the year he sells recyclable items like bottles, beer cans, plastic, batteries and others.  His wife as well as one of his daughters helps him with the ice-cream sales in an itinerant way throughout all parts of the city of Santa Cruz.  He also goes out to various adjacent areas to the city of Santa Cruz.

With money from the loan he will buy an engine for his motorcycle and also bottles and cans at wholesale to resell as recyclable material.  Emiliano is a responsible, hardworking person who wants to continue forward for his children’s wellbeing because he wants to offer them a better future.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his motorcycle and to buy bottles, cans, plastic, etc.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis Antonio tiene 24 años es soltero, vive con los padres,no tiene hijos. Vive en el Recinto Las Blancas en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Ventanilla 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Luis Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul realiza las compras de sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos como urea, insecticidas entre los más usados  para el cuidado de los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia y para invertir en la siembra en semillas e insumos.  Su sueño es comprar un terreno y un carro.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a caminar con la madre.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio, 24, is single living with his parents; he has no children.  He lives in Recinto Las Blancas in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “26 de Noviembre” communal bank is located in Recinto Las Blancas belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farming.

Luis Antonio is a corn, rice and pigeon pea farmer; he buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market.

He asked for the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure like urea and insecticides that are commonly used for crops.  The loan has helped him increase family income and to invest in seeds and supplies.  His dream is to buy a tract of land and a car.  In his free time he enjoys going out on walks with his mother.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Andre

texts.fr:
Client de 54ans, marié, père de 6 enfants dont l’âge est compris entre 16 et 30 ans.
Après sa formation en coupe et couture sur patron, il a ouvert son atelier voila 20 ans avec un capital de 300.000 F.
C’est  son 3em prêt et cela lui permet de renforcer, d’améliorer et de maintenir sa clientèle.
Avec ce prêt, il va acheter les rouleaux de tissus (gabardine, lin, tergals, velours, super 200, doublure, vaseline) file, aiguilles.
La seule difficulté reste le non retrait du vêtement finis et sa stratégie est de faire  une maison de vente des costumes prêt-à-porter.
Quatre de ses enfants sont encore sur le banc de l’école, il se bat pour qu’il s suivent une bonne éducation scolaire  et il se bat pour finir sa  maison en location pour assurer leur bien être.
Il a un sens de l’organisation et respecte  ses engagements vis-à-vis de ses clients.
texts.en:
Andre is a 54 year old client. He is married and father of six children between the ages of 16 and 30. After an apprenticeship in tailoring and dressmaking, he opened his shop 20 years ago with a capital of 300,000 XAF.

This is his third loan and it will allow him to grow, improve, and maintain his clientele. With the loan, he is going to buy rolls of fabric (gabardine, wool, Terylene, velvet, super 200, lining, Vaseline), thread, and needles. The only problem is when people do not show up to pick up their finished clothing. His strategy is to sell ready-made suits.

Four of his children are still in school. He is trying to ensure that they receive a good education, and he is working to complete his rental house in order to ensure their well-being.

He is well-organized and honors his commitments to his clients.

loans.use: to buy rolls of Terylene fabric, wool, super 100, and sewing accessories

loans.name: Ahinadje Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AHINADJE  est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même maison. Elisabeth, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 34  ans est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Lucien. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et à leur charge. Elisabeth vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Elisabeth et son mari. Pour cette raison, Elisabeth vend du charbon de bois, du maïs et du haricot à son domicile depuis quinze ans.  Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Elisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe AHINADJE , un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du charbon de bois, du maïs et du haricot.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 39 years old operating a butcher shop for now three years. He is very hardworking, and he doing well in his business. He desires to have branches of the same business in various areas, but is limited by capital and seasonality changes. At this point, he requesting for a credit facility to buy more cows for slaughtering to sell as meat on Christmas eve.

loans.use: to buy more cows for slaughtering to sell as meat on Christmas eve.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan wants to buy more stock of foodstuff

loans.name: Isack

texts.en:
Isack lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. He is married and has six children. Two of his sons are in secondary school. Isack keeps chickens and cows. Alongside keeping animals, Isack grows vegetables. He uses manures from animals for vegetables growing. He has been in this dual business for five years now. Isack is worried in this coming rain season since animals and vegetables are frequently attacked by deseases during the rains.

He need a sufficient stock of insectcides. He couldn’t managed buy these items by himself because he recently paid school fees for his elder son. Isack is in need of USD 750 to buy enough stock of insecticides to protect his animals and vegetables.

loans.use: Buy insecticide to protect livestock and crops

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
My name is Yolanda A., and I have dedicated myself to selling men's and women's clothing such as T-shirts, blouses, pants, socks and underwear. I've had my business for one year. My goal is to purchase more clothes so I can increase my sales volume, and with the earnings I'll be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Yolanda A. me dedico a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero como ser camisetas, blusas, pantalones, calcetines, ropa interior, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, mi meta es comprar mas ropa para poder tener mayores ventas, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase shirts, T-shirts, blouses, pants, socks, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Qiyas

texts.en: Qiyas M. is 40 years old, married. He was born and lives in the southern Azerbaijani town Imishli. Qiyas owns a store, where he sells bath supplies, laundry powder, soap and shampoos. He started his business in 2000, and, since the business has been going very well, Qiyas decided to expand the variety of products he sells. He has applied for a loan of US$1,200 to make the first bulk purchase of various food products for sale. The estimated total cost of the products he intends to purchase, such as milk, yoghurt, meat products and beverages, is approximatly US$3,500.

loans.use: Expansion of a store for food sales

loans.name: Ni Made Ekarini

texts.id:
Although married at an age that is considered young, Ni Made Ekarini is persistend and hard working. Her husband's incomea as a building laborer is not sufficient to support household needs. Therefore after married 3 years agao, Made Ekarini started to farm pigs. With a capital of Rp600,000 (about US$66) Made Ekarini could buy 3 baby pigs. She gave them very simple food, a mixture of rice shell clippings and pounded banana tree trunks. She fed the pigs 2X/day, and the cost to feed them are about Rp10,000 ($1.10)/day. After 3 months she could sell those 3 piglets for Rp1,900,000 (about $209), and after expenses, she would profit Rp400,000(about $44)/3 months. Besides household needs, that profit is used to buy milk for her 3 year old child. Laon from Dinari for Rp1,300,000 (between $143-150, depending on exchange rate) will be used to expand her business by buying more pig feedstock, so that she would be able to make more profit. Made Ekarini also dreams to expand her other food stall side business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun menikah dalam usia yang tergolong muda namun Ni Made Ekarini sangat tekun dan ulet dalam bekerja . Melihat penghasilan suaminya sebagai buruh bangunan tidak dapat mencukupi keperluan rumah tangga maka sejak menikah 3 tahun yang lalu maka Made Ekarini mulai menekuni usaha beT. B.. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.600.000 Made Ekarini dapat membeli 3 ekor bibit B.. Makanan yang diberikan masih sangat sederhana yaitu campuran dedak padi dengan batang pohon pisang yang sudah ditumbuk. B. ini diberi makan 2 kali dalam satu hari, sehingga biaya yang dikeluarkan untuk pakan B. tersebut sebesar Rp. 10.000,setiap hari. B. ini akan dijual setelah berumur tiga bulan,dengan harga sebesar Rp. 1.900.000 untuk 3 ekor B., dari penjualan tersebut diperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.400.000 selama 3 bulan. Keuntungan ini selain dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga juga untuk membeli susu anaknya yang kini baru berusia 3 tahun. Pinjaman yang diberikan oleh Dinari sebesar Rp.1.300.000 dipakai untuk mengembangkan usahanya yaitu membeli bibit B., agar keuntungan yang diperoleh nantinya lebih banyak dan dari keuntungan itu Made Ekarini berkeinginan untuk mengembangkan usaha warungnya sebagai usaha sampingan yang selama ini ditekuninya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock

Membeli bibit babi

loans.name: Kimiyo

texts.en:
T. Kimiyo is a very lively person. She is 42 years old and has 4 children. Her business is the trade of sportwear for men. Her business is located in the center of the open air clothing market in Ovchikalacha, in Khujand. She buys her goods from the Istaravshan clothing market every week. Her current turnover is fast and she is very satisfied that her business is developing.

When she heard about the Kiva program she said that it is a very great activity which helps thousands of people to make their life better. She will be very happy to be funded by foreign lenders.

All her profits are spent for family needs and she does not have an opportunity to put a roof on her business place. It will cost her about 1000 som ($300). She hopes that Kiva will help her to do this.

loans.use: Put a roof on her clothing stall

loans.name: Terisa

texts.en: Terisa is only 21 years old and has one child. Her husband works for the petrol station in town. Terisa has always loved designing and when she heard of SPBD she was happy to join so she could buy paints and fabrics for printing elei (a traditional Samoan fabric). She makes good prints and she also uses unique designs. Terisa is very happy and thankful for this chance where she can receive loan money to start up something of her own.

loans.use: Terisa would like to buy supplies for her elei printing business.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
I am Rehana S.. I live in a brick house with my family in Multan, a mid size city in Pakistan. I sell embroidered clothes in various nearby cities with my mother. I need to expand my business and thereby, produce more clothes. I need a loan for this purpose.   
My group members are, Ameeran B., Haseena B., and Mussarat B. all of these women sell cloth. Faiz E. is a widow and needs a loan for their fruits shop. I help them so that their families can prosper and they do not have to depend any more on some one for money.

loans.use: Expand embroidered clothes business

loans.name: Griselda

texts.en: Griselda is in her early thirties, and she has three school-going daughters. Griselda owns and operates a grocery store, which she started seven years ago. Every day, people in the neighborhood visit her store to purchase different kinds of products, such as rice, vegetables, milk, beans and other basic foodstuffs. Griselda hopes not only to satisfy her customers with good-quality products, but she also wants to expand her business and add new products to her inventory. That way, she’ll attract new clients to the business. The entrepreneur wants to be one of the most well-established suppliers of these goods in her area.

loans.use: Purchase of products to restock a grocery store

loans.name: Abdurahimov

texts.ru:
A. Abdurahimov is a man of 26 and is currently divorced. He lives with his elderly mother. His main income comes from his profession and he is a known shepherd in his kishlak (village). By his estimates, he herds aproximately a hundred sheep. About half of them are not owned by him, but he is paid well for taking good care of them. This is why Abduchaboor wants to increase his own cattle stock and turned to Microinvest for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдурахимов Абдучаббор мужчина в возросте 26 лет в данное время разведен .Живет с пожелой матерью.Его доход сотоит из его профессии , в своем кишлаке он знаменитый постух.По его подсчетам он посет где-то одну сотню баранов.Хотя половину из них не его собственность , но за хороший уход ему платят хозяева скота.Поэтому Абдучаббор хочет увеличить свой личный скот,для чего и обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: To increase cattle stock

loans.name: Brenda Esperanza

texts.es:
Since 3 years, the Senora Brenda M. sells clothes in small quantities in the district of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega.

She sells the clothes in her house where she shows them either on a rope or wire. This way, they can be seen by people passing by.

As she cannot earn enough money only selling at home, she sells the clothes in the streets of Somotillo as well. She goes from house to house exhausting herself and exposing herself to fatigue due to the sun.

It is important to emphasize that she had to overcome difficult economic circumstances in this business and that she now needs to buy more clothes. She seeks the support of CEPRODEL in order to obtain the credit that will allow her to buy more clothes and in that way to improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Brenda M. se dedica desde hace tres años al negocio de la venta de ropa en pocas cantidades las cuales las vende en su casa al mostrarlas en una cuerda o alambre tendidas a vista de las personas.

Además, al no tener buenos resultados en la venta en su casa, por lo general ella vende la ropa ambulantemente por las calles de Somotillo ofreciéndola de casa en casa exponiéndose al desgaste físico y fatiga provocada por el sol.

Es necesario destacar que ella ha atravesado difíciles circunstancias económicas en el negocio y hoy en día la necesidad es la adquisición de la ropa. Es por dicha razón que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que la permita adquirir la ropa y de esta manera salir adelante mejorando su condición económica.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two kids. This is an average family from Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. However, Natalya is a unique entrepreneur. She has been selling clothing in the central city market for about a year, running her own small venture successfully. The secret of her success is simple: she tries to not only let her customers know the benefits of her products – she also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again.

Presently, Natalya has over $4000 in turnover capital. Her monthly net profit is over $500. However, she doesn’t want to stop where she is at with her venture. Natalya is seeking a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to re-stock the merchandise in her kiosk for the upcoming summer season. We believe that Natalya’s desire to excel in pleasing her customers will determine her further success and encourage new customers to buy from her.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory before summer season

loans.name: Waly

texts.fr:
Mr. Waly S. lives in a village near Thiadiaye. He has already benefited from 6 previous loans (of CFA 100 000, 250 000, 400 000, 600 000, 500 000, and 400 000), all of which he has repaid without problems. He is a serious and hardworking father of a family. With this loan, he intends to buy an ox to fatten up and resell for the religious feasts.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur Waly S. habite dans un village environant de Thiadiaye. Il a dejà bénéficié de 6 crédits (100 000, 250 000, 400 000, 600 000, 500 000, 400 000) qu'il a toujours remboursé sans aucun probleme. c'est un pere de famille sérieux et travailleur. Avec ce nouveau pret, il compte acheter un boeuf pour l'engraisser et le revendre pendant les fetes religieuses.

loans.use: To raise cattle

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
Mrs. Ou S., 31, is a mother of four children, living in Boeng Kok Village, Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig raiser earning around $3 per day, while her husband is a security guard at the market, earning around $3 per day. One of her children is a bricklayer, while another is car washer. Part of their children's income helps to support the family's expenses. Due to increasing transportation expenses, S. would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase a second hand motorcycle for household use. With the remainder of the loan, she plans to purchase more pigs to raise. The loan will allow her family to increase their income.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a second hand motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria inició el negocio por que siempre le ha gustado la repostería y por la necesidad de tener otro ingreso para mejorar su calidad de vida ya que sus hijos estaban estudiando y no le alcanzaba para cubrir todos los gastos tanto de la casa como darles lo necesario para acudir a la escuela. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 6 años vendiendo solamente empanadas y pan de elote hoy en día vende tortillas de harina tamales por pedidos y en ocasiones hace platillos de comidas para fiestas infantiles y le va muy bien ya que tenia muchos clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $750 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir los ingredientes par la elaboración de empanadas y tamales como es harina, manteca, azúcar, gas, carne, hojas y desechables.
texts.en:
Maria started the business because she has always liked food preparation and because of the need to have another income to improve her quality of life since her children were studying and she did not have enough to cover all the many expenses of the house or to give them the necessary things for school. She began approximately 6 years ago selling only empanadas and cornbread. Now she sells flour tortilla tamales to order and from time to time she prepares foods for children's festivals. Sales go very well since she has many clients.

She needs a loan of $750 US, that will be repaid in 6 months, to supply the ingredients for making empanadas and tamales such as flour, lard, sugar, cooking gas, meat, corn husks and disposables.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for making tamales and empanadas

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: I. Gulsara lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs. Gulsara has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and the loan sums are continually increased, which shows the business stability and development. She has a meat and milk production business. She dreams of purchasing a milk cow for sour cream production (to supply it to the local bazaars). The plan is to widen the assortment of milk and sour products, like pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curds, and more. Now Mrs. I. Gulsara asks KIVA for a business development loan of 2200 STJ for 4 months. Mrs. I. Gulsara thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: business development loan

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina S. is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of four kids. Currently, the kids are in school. Amina loves selling goods, the business through which she makes money to support her family. She has been selling onions and beans for ten years to support her family. Onion is one of the popular food spices which add flavor to sauces and soups. Beans are used in the preparation of many local foods like ‘red-red’, beans sauce and kebab. The sale of these commodities has created job opportunities for many women like Amina. She takes delivery of stock from the local farmers who provide her with direct supply, and retails to her customers. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. 

With this loan, she wants to buy bulk of onions and beans to serve her customers. She hopes that the loan will enable her to make more savings to support her kids in school. Amina is a member of a borrowing group called Good Shepherd Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of onions and beans.

loans.name: Dalila Guadalupe

texts.es:
Dalila forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II” del distrito de Pariahuanca, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.

Dalila tiene 36 años de edad y es madre soltera de 2 hijos. Afirma que aún cuando su principal dificultad ha sido que el padre de sus hijos no haya asumido sus responsabilidades, ha seguido adelante junto a sus pequeños a quienes considera sus tesoros. En la actualidad tiene el negocio de venta de alimentos en un pequeño restaurante que inició hace 6 meses en su casa y con el apoyo de su hermano ha podido tener clientes, en especial los turistas en temporada alta. Se abastece de los animales que cría en su casa y las verduras que siembra, así mismo compra los otros productos que necesita en la ciudad de Huaraz. También comenta que su principal dificultad es que la afluencia de turistas sólo es por temporadas y que tendrá que enfrentar la temporada baja con la venta de animales menores. Se encuentra a gusto con este trabajo y desea seguir creciendo.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de gallinas y cuyes.
 
Dalila afirma que le gustaría aprender para mejorar su negocio y criar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dalila belongs to the community bank of Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II from the Pariahuanca district, department of Ancash. Dalila is 36 years old and is a single mother of 2 children. Currently she sells meals on a little restaurant that started 6 months ago at her house with the support of her brother, her biggest clients are tourist during high season. She gets supplies from the animals she raises at home and vegetables she harvest from her garden and some products she buys in the city of Huaraz. Her biggest difficulty is that tourism is a seasonal business so during low season she has to sell smaller animals. She wants to keep on growing her business. With the loan of s/.500 which will be paid in 8 quotes, she will buy chickens and cuyes. She wants to study to improve her business and raise her children.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará gallinas y cuyes.

loans.name: Nsia

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania and SELFINA!  This is 33 year old Nsia I. M.. She is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 8. 

Nsia is quite the entrepreneur as she runs two businesses: a kuku (poultry) business and a tailoring business.  Seems a bit unrelated to the average person, but it makes sense here in Tanzania. A kuku business is a simple, profitable, and popular business here in Tanzania. You simply buy chicks, tend to them for 5 weeks, and then sell them in the market. It does not take all day to tend to the chickens, once in the morning and once in the afternoon, so a go-getter like Nsia also has time to run another business. Her tailoring business is a bit more complicated as she needs to properly measure and sew outfits to her customers' specifications, and customers can be quite demanding!

Her businesses are doing well and her monthly profits are approximately US$600. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional chicks and feed for her kuku business, as well as materials for making clothes for her tailoring business. She thanks you in advance for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks and feed for her kuku business, as well as materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima S. is a thirty year old married woman with four children - two boys and two girls. Three of her children are in the basic school at the moment. The last child is still breast-feeding and she hopes to wean her soon. Alima’s husband farms in the community where they live. He cultivates all kinds of food crops – cassava, plantain, maize, as well as vegetables. She lives with the family at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Offinso are involved in farming activities. 

Alima trades in textiles fabrics and second hand clothes. She buys textile fabrics and all kinds of second hand clothes, especially skirts, from Kumasi, a nearby city, and sells them in the market square in her community. She says she has a small shed in which she sells. Alima has been in business for three years and wants a loan to increase her working capital to be able to procure bales of textiles.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles and fabrics.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla S. est âgé de 51 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants. Il est soudeur à Lomé la capitale du Togo. Afin d’offrir un service plus satisfaisant à ses clients, il souhaite, avec ce crédit aménager son garage et acheter des outils de travail. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komla S., 51, is married and the father of 5 children. He is a welder in Lomé, the capital of Togo. In order to be able to offer more satisfying service to his customers, he is hoping, with the aid of this loan, to be able to refurbish his garage and buy tools. He is counting on this opportunity to change the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: refurbish his garage and buy tools

loans.name: Hum

texts.en: Mrs. Hum I. is a pig breeder in Ampil village in Kandal province. Her husband, Mr. Tom Khan, is a farmer who owns a piece of land for the cultivation of rice. He faces an obstacle in his plantation because he does not have enough money to cultivate rice. Thus, Mrs. Hum I. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides, as well as to hire laborers to work on the field. She is the 59-year-old mother of a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Magna Emperatriz,

texts.es:
Magna tiene cincuenta años pero tiene tanta fuerza y entusiasmo que aparenta tener mucho menos. DesD. muy joven ha trabaja en negocios D. otras personas, poco a poco, conforme pasaba el tiempo ella aprendía como se manejaba un negocio. Es por eso que hace diez años aproximadamente junto con su esposo, quien también ha sido comerciante toda su vida, se animo a iniciar un negocio D. venta D. gas domestico.

Luego D. tres años abrieron una  bodega D. abarrotes, la cual ha crecido en base al esfuerzo no solo D. magna y su esposo sino al trabajo y apoyo constante D. toda su familia. Magna reconoce que la unión familiar da mayores frutos cuando se trabaja en una  microempresa.

Hace poco ha implementado su negocio con la venta D. gaseosas y cervezas. Ya que la venta D. bebidas es rentable. Es así que piensa en un futuro convertirse en distribuidora D. cerveza.
texts.en:
Magna is 50 years old but she is so strong and so enthusiastic that she doesn't look her age. Since she was very young she worked for other people, but slowly as time went one she learned how to manage a business. About ten years ago, together with her husband who has been a businessman all his life, she started up her own business selling domestic natural gas.

Three years later they opened a grocery store, which has been expanding with the great efforts of Mangna and her husband but also with the constant support of their entire family. Magna recognizes that a family effort yields greater products when running a small business.

Only a short while ago she started selling soft drinks and beer in her store. Drink sales has been very profitable. She plans to become a beer distributor in the future.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase drinks and beer for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a salon and to be equpped

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal S. lives with his wife and two children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son is an 8 year old first grader and his new-born daughter is only a year old.

Otgonjargal has a small retail business selling second-hand clothing. He started his business in 2003 by purchasing second-hand clothing from the wholesale market in Ulaanbaatar and reselling the clothes individually for profit at his stall in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. His wife normally helps run his business and is currently staying home to take care of her new born baby. Otgonjargal requests a Kiva loan to purchase more second-hand clothing to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothing to increase his business inventory.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna C. J. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de abarrotes en la ciudad de Managua atendiendo con mucha alegría a sus clientes y ofreciendo los granos básicos como lo son arroz, azúcar y frijoles y otros productos comestibles.

 Ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para dar lugar a la compra de los comestibles y de esta forma salir adelante en el negocio  y satisfacer a sus clientes que a diario le visitan en su localidad.
texts.en:
Señora Reyna C. J. devotes herself with much effort to her grocery business in the city of Managua. She assists her customers with much joy, and offers staples like rice, sugar, beans and other food products.

Reyna understands the need to invest in her business, so she went to Ceprodel to request a loan to help her purchase inventory in order to increase her business, and to satisfy the customers who patronize her shop every day.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple food products

loans.name: Martha Zenobia

texts.es: La señora Martha M. I. es un cliente relativamente nueva, esta es su segunda secuencia, en el tiempo que esta en la institucion demostro responsabilidad, la señora se dedica a la venta de pollos y lechon al horno su puesto esta ubicado en la zon a16 de julio, la señora prepara platos ricos por los cual tiene clientes fieles a su cocina, su esposo es chofer de taxi por lo cual tiene buen tiempo para dedicarle a su familia, la señora es una perona emprendedora e innovadora que cuando ve la oportunidad no la despedicia, en esta ocasion se le presento un terreno de ocasion en un lugar bien ubicado y estrategico para futuros negocios por lo cual quiere invertir en ello.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha M. I. is a relatively new client and is in her second loan sequence. In the time that she has been a part of the institution, she has demonstrated responsibility. She sells chicken and roasted pork, and her stall is located in the area known as the 16th of July district. She prepares delicious food, and therefore she has faithful clients at her kitchen. Her husband is a taxi driver and has good time to dedicate to the family. She is an entrepreneurial and innovative woman, and when she sees an opportunity, she does not let it pass her by; in this instance, she has found a well-situated and strategic location for future business in which she wants to invest.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita es una persona que siempre a buscado el bienestar de su familia en lo económico y en armonía. Ella todas las mañanas sale a trabajar en una casa como empleada domestica; para poder ganar un poco mas después de que termina su turno, se traslada a otra casa para recibir un poco mas de dinero, aunque su esposo labora en un pollo frito y le ayuda con los gastos familiares, ella piensa en darle una buena educación a sus hijos y dejarles un buen  patrimonio. Hace ya tiempo en su vivienda entraron a robar es por ello que opto por venir a esta institución y pedir un préstamo para poner en frente de su casa un portón para que así ni un extraño vuelva intentar meterse y robarle lo que con mucho esfuerzo a obtenido.
texts.en:
Margarita is a person who has always looked out for the economic and harmonious well being of her family. Every morning she goes to work in a house as a domestic employee. When she is done working there she goes to another house to make a little more money. Even though her husband works in a fried chicken establishment and helps with the family expenses, she plans to give her children a good education and leave them a nice inheritance. A while ago people entered her house to rob them. That is why she decided to come to this institution and ask for a loan to put in a gate in front of her house. She wants a gate so that not one stranger will again try to get inside and rob them of what they worked so hard to get.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a gate

loans.name: Rolando Concepcion

texts.es: El señor Rolando Concepción R. O. , tiene la edad de 38 años , habita en el barrio La borgoña en la comunidad de Ticuantepe, el es soltero , habita con sus hermanas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Rolando desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas que afectan al cultivo , él inicio está actividad con sus propios esfuerzos , los planes futuro hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Sr. Rolando Concepción R. O. is 38 years old. He lives in the neighborhood of La Borgoña in the Ticuantepe community. He is single and lives with his sisters. He hopes to improve the living conditions of his family.

Don Rolando has been farming since he was 21 years old. He started this business with own resources. His future plans include diversifying the types of crops grown on his land. With his loan he will purchase farming supplies and fertilizers necessary for him to obtain a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers to increase production

loans.name: Luisa Diliana

texts.es: Luisa Diliana M. tiene 37 años. Esta Señora es muy trabajadora, su espíritu de alegría es envidiable. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella empieza vendiendo ciertos productos como golosinas en general, ya que ella es Madre y Padre para sus 2 hijos, y así proporcionarle lo necesario. Y decide ofrecer los productos de golosinas y refrescos naturales. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pan, jugos, refrescos naturales, golosinas. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos se preparen para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Luisa Diliana M. is 37 years old. This Lady is very hard-working. Her spirit of happiness is enviable. Her economic activity is a store. She has been dedicated to this business for over 5 years. She began selling certain products such as sweets in general, since she is both mother and father for her 2 children, and in this way she could provide them with necessities. Then she decided to offer both sweets and natural refreshments. The financing that she requests is for working capital for the purchase of bread, juices, natural refreshments, and sweets. Her greatest dream is that her children are prepared to become good persons.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, juices, natural refreshments and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucía de 57 años de edad, estaba casada con el sr Anuncio Ruiz, y desde hace 3 años es viuda. Tiene 3 hijos todos mayores y con familia propia, una de sus hijas vive con ella.
Comenta que siempre le gusto el comercio, y que en su domicilio tenía una despensa bien surtida y mucha clientela, su esposo su vez ayudaba con los ingresos ya que se dedicaba a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras por todo los barrios de Lambaré, Asunción, y muchas veces al interior del país, para lo cual contaba con una camioneta para realizar dicho negocio. 
Continúa diciendo que tuvo que cerrar su despensa, a raíz de que su esposo estuvo muy enfermo y tenía que atenderle, ya que estuvo hospitalizado mucho tiempo. 
Actualmente cuenta con el apoyo de uno de sus hijos con quien trabaja en la compra y venta de mercaderías, frutas de estación y verduras,  dice que este trabajo requiere de mucho sacrificio porque  sale muy temprano de su casa para poder realizar sus compras y luego recorrer especialmente la zona del Chaco, ya que en esos lugares normalmente hay pocos proveedores que llegan a los comercios pequeños.
También en su tiempo libre le gusta trabajar en la costura, por eso, trabaja con una empresa que le provee de materia prima para confeccionar distintos tipos de toallas. De esos  tipos de ingresos  le está ayudando y de a poco ella está invirtiendo en la mejora de  la  construcción de su casa. 
Le gusta trabajar con el crédito porque le permite acceder a mejores beneficios a la hora de comprar sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
Fifty-seven-year-old Lucia was married to Mr. Anuncio Ruiz, but she was widowed 3 years ago. She has 3 grown children who have their own families. One of her daughters lives with her.

She stated that she has always liked retail and that she used to have a general store at home that was well-stocked and had many customers. Her husband helped her with the income at the time, buying and selling fruits and vegetables throughout the neighborhoods of Lambaré, Asunción, as well as other places further inland. He had a truck to do this work.

She went on to say that she had to close her general store due to the fact that her husband became very ill and she had to attend to him since he was hospitalized for a long time.

She currently has the support of one of her children who works selling and buying merchandise, and seasonal fruits and vegetables. She states that this line of work requires a lot of sacrifice because she has to leave her house very early in the morning to shop for products, then travel throughout the Chaco zone because there are few suppliers who visit the small businesses there.

She also likes to sew in her free time, which is why she works with a company who provides her with the raw materials needed to make different types of towels. These two sources of income are helping her, and little by little, she is investing in home improvement.

She likes to work with microloans because they allow her access to greater benefits when purchasing merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, cooking oil, milk, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace P. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Mary Grace owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting cassava for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fourteen years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. Mary Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa is married with one child. She sells clothing at the central market. Her monthly income is 4,000 UAH. Larisa has been in this business for 12 years. She enjoys selling clothing and has many repeated clients. Larisa is very active and hard working person. She would like to develop her business further and increase the sales. Larisa would like to borrow 16,400 UAH to purchase more inventories. Large assortment will help Larisa to increase the sales and receive additional income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk for her  business

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
la señora Maria Guadalupe H. tiene 57 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos y se dedica a la venta de ropa, sandalis y los fines de semana vende baleadas desde hace 05 años.
Maria necesita el prestamo para surtir su negocio para navidad ya que esta es una epoca en la cual las ventas se ponen muy buenas y asi poder tener mas ganancias.
Maria los fines de semana pone un puesto de venta de baleadas las cuales las vende todas, este tipo de comida es muy apetecida por los habitantes de esta zona, ya que una baleada con frijolitos fritos, huevo, mantequilla, queso y jamon es una delicia al comersela y es un alimento completo.
su sueño es tener un negocio fuerte en el mercado de San Lorenzo.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Guadalupe H. is 57 years old, unmarried, and has no children. She has been selling clothing and sandals for five years. In addition, she sells baleadas, a Honduran burrito, on the weekends. Maria needs a loan to stock her business in preparation for the Christmas season. In the time leading up to Christmas she makes many sales and can increase her earnings. On the weekends she has a stall where she sells baleadas, which are very popular amongst the people living in her area. They are made with refried beans, eggs, butter, cheese, and ham. They are delicious and a complete meal. Her dream is to have a thriving business in the San Lorenzo market.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bedding, underwear, socks, sandals, and shirts

loans.name: Ynelsa

texts.es:
La señora Ynelsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Ynelsa, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 50.00 y empezó comprando 03 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas.

En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Ynelsa, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ynelsa belongs to the “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda” (Banda Women in Action) Community Bank which is in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, in the San Martín province and administrative district. She is 34 years old, in a common-law relationship and has 2 children who are still dependent on her. Ynelsa is a woman who likes to work and thus decided to start her own business selling soft drinks in well air-conditioned area located in her own home. She manages her business without having a schedule or a boss. She began with 50 Nuevo soles that bought her three cases of sodas. Seeing that she was so well situated she ran out of drinks, little by little she began investing more. Today, she is still in the same business and is well known by her customers, most of whom are her neighbors, family and friends. With this loan of 800 Nuevo soles, she will buy more soft drinks in different flavors, sizes and brands, as well as carbonated and uncarbonated mineral water. Ynelsa has many goals and feels very motivated to make her dreams come true. She is thankful to the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her payments and plans to continue in this way.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: Aracely del Carmen A. de 34 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, junto a su esposo, su madre y tres hijos menores de edad, lo cuales se dedican a estudiar. Aracely, posee su propio negocio en el cual comercializa granos básicos, productos perecederos y de primera necesidad. Ella solicita un préstamo con el fin de surtir su negocio con muchos más productos los cuales se venden mucho en el lugar, y así de esta manera, contribuir junto a su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar y la familia.
texts.en:
Aracely del Carmen A. is 34 years old and lives in the department of Usulután with her husband, mother, and three underage children who are in school. Aracely has her own business where she sells basic grains, perishable products and basic household goods. She needs a loan to stock her business with more products which are sold a lot in her store, so that she can contribute along with her husband in all the household and family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable products and basic household goods.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
The two persons shown in the photo are Mrs. Sak B. and her husband. Sak B., 36, owns a small business, selling various kinds of merchandise in the market for a profit. She sells items such as clothes, seafood, fresh food and some groceries.

Sak B.’s husband is a civil service officer for a ministry, and the couple has three school-aged kids. They live together in Reusey Keo commune, in Phnom Penh City.

Sak B. hopes to improve her commerce but she doesn’t have enough capital yet to make that possible. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$1,000 which will allow her to purchase larger quantities of merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Dul

texts.en:
Mrs. Dul T., 45, is a citizen living in Phnom Penh city. She currently stays at home to take care of the kids and help them do their homework. The family's income is contributed by Dul T.’s husband, who works as a construction foreman. He has a few employees to help him provide this service, and he earns at least $8 a day. This couple has been married for many years and is blessed with two young children. One grown daughter works in the garment industry.

Recently, Dul T.'s husband received an order from his customer to build a new house, but he lacks the building equipment to perform this service. Therefore, Dul T. is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL to purchase more essential equipment.

loans.use: To purchase more essential equipment for her husband's business.

loans.name: Carla Veronica

texts.es:
Carla Veronica A. Monrroy tiene 34 años, actualmente es soltera vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en un barrio al Oeste de la ciudad.
 
Es profesion Psicologa, trabaja en una institucion de niños desde hace dos años, para los cuales debe presentar informes diarios sobre sus trabajos realizados, pero requiere de una herramienta indispensable para presentar dichos informes.

El credito sera destinado a la compra de una computadora portatil, con la cual realizara sus informes y trabajos de manera mas rapida y eficiente. Con la cual obtendra mejores resultados en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carla Veronica A. Monrroy is 34 and single. She lives in the city of Cochabamba in a neighborhood west of the city. She is a psychologist. She has worked in a children’s institution for two years. She needs to present daily reports about her work. However, she needs an indispensable tool in order to make those reports. The loan is to buy a laptop computer. She will use it to make reports and do her work more rapidly and efficiently. She will use it to get better results in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a laptop computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Née le 12 janvier 1972 à Porto Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin, A. Rose réside au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou depuis 18 ans.
