Rose est mariée à GOUSSANGNI Sosthène, un menuisier, et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés.  Rose vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Rose n’a jamais été à l’école.  Pour contribuer  à supporter les charges familiales, Rose vend de l’alcool, l’huile végétale, et boisson « Sodabi » (boisson alcoolisée locale) à son domicile et par le système de distribution.  Rose a 10 ans d’expérience dans ce domaine. Elle a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Rose voudrait renforcer le stock de ses produits et acheter des bidons contenant l’huile et de la boisson « Sodabi ».  C’est pour ça que Rose sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born January 12, 1972 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin, Rose A. has been living in the Zogbo neighborhood of Cotonou for the past 18 years. Rose is married to Sosthène GOUSSANGNI, a carpenter, and is the mother of three children, all attending school. She has never been to school herself. She lives together with her children and husband, with whom she shares family expenses. To assist in meeting expenses, Rose sells alcohol, vegetable oil, and “Sodabi” drink (a local alcoholic beverage), both from her home and as an itinerant vendor. Rose has ten years’ experience doing this. She was granted two previous loans from ALIDé, reimbursed in full. Rose now wants to increase her stock supply and buy containers of vegetable oil and cases of “Sodabi”. This is why she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy containers of vegetable oil and cases of “Sodabi” drink

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum S., age 42, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She operates a business as a recycler and is also a farmer, earning an income of US$2.80 per day.

S.’s husband is employed to transport fish to the market, earning an income of US$3 per day. By doing so, he is able to cover the family expenses, especially the children’s education. He has been with this job since 2008.

S. is requesting a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached to expand her husband’s business of transporting fish for his customers. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached for her husband's business

loans.name: Johana Susana

texts.es:
La señora Johana Susana B. Mendosa Labora en el centro de Insumos para la Salud CIP-MINSA, 
Esta casada con dos hijos a su cargo los cuales se encuentran en el colegio uno y el otro en la universidad.
EL crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y bloque para la construcción de un cuarto para uno de sus hijos

Lleva 2 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en el mejoramiento de la vivienda.
 Johana dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL ahora cuenta con una mejor  casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Johana Susana B. Mendosa works for the CIP-MINSA (Centre for Health Supplies).

She is married with 2 children under her care; one is high school and the other in university.

The loan is to buy construction materials like cement, sand and blocks for the construction of a room for one of her sons.

Mrs. Johana has had 2 loans with CEPRODEL (Kiva’s field partner) for 2 years and she has used it to improve her home.

Johana says that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL she now has a better home.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and make her home bigger.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a skillful lady who lives in a city named Vehari, in Pakistan. She makes embroidered dresses and sells to the cloth shops, generating income for her family. She learned this art from her mother, who conveyed the techniques to her, and this is the result—that she can complete an embroidered dress very easily.

Her husband's name is M. R., and he is an electrician but sells electric supplies as well. He has his own electric shop in the market. For the purpose of diversifying his business, Mumtaz is requesting a loan so he can buy the required items (wires, tube lights, and switches).

loans.use: To purchase electric supplies to sell

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es: El Sr. Jose  Tiene 40 años de edad es soltero  vive en la casa de su madre , el se dedica como operario de construccion y algunas veces como trabajador de campo, el se inicio en esta actividad hace 10 años,  lleba por herencia dicha actividad ya que su padre tambien se dedicaba a  la misma actividad. El como toda persona tine sueños y metas uno de ellos es poder lograr tener un negocio propio, y una casa, con el dinero que solicita invertira en gastos de tramite de la compra de un terreno.
texts.en:
Jose is 40 years old, and he is single. He lives in his mother’s house. He is a construction worker. Sometimes he is a field worker. He started this activity ten years ago. This job is his heritage as his father did the same thing. Like all people, he has dreams and goals. One of them is to be able to have his own business and a house. He will use the money he is requesting to pay for the transactional expenses of buying a piece of land.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Transactional expenses of buying a piece of land

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan M. sells maize flour and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock soya beans to sell. Susan is 31 years old and married to a policeman. They have four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock soya beans to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda T. is from the village of Calaran. She is 40 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Hilda owns and operates a business selling pigs from her own farm. Hilda has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2009,  Hilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase feeds. Hilda is requesting her second loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Tercer Cuartel Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama TERCER CUARTEL porque la comunidad en la cual habitan se divide en cuarteles en Atlacomulco, México. Es un lugar en donde la mayor parte de la población fundamenta su economía en cultivo y venta de verdura, son personas muy trabajadoras. El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes y es la TERCERA vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. 
Esta foto fué tomada en la casa de la Sra. Rosa María D. E., donde se hacen las reuniones semanales. Se ve el trabajo que realiza la Sra. Rosa María D. E. quien es la primera de derecha a izquierda en la foto. Tiene 48 años; en la primaria solo aprendió a leer y a escribir, se dedica a la venta de bolsas de mandado, a la costura y artículos por temporada principalmente, lo comercializa en las plazas (tianguis) de los diferentes municipios, como lo es Atlacomulco, Ixtlahuaca, El oro por mencionar algunos, tiene 22 años dedicándose a estas actividades, menciona que el crédito le ha servido para invertir en su negocio y eso ha permitido darle la oportunidad de estudiar la universidad a 1 de sus 6 hijos por el momento, pero tiene planeado seguir trabajando arduamente como lo ha venido haciendo por años, para darle esas misma oportunidad a los otros 3 hijos más pequeños ya que desafortunadamente a 2 de los mayores no tuvo la oportunidad de darles estudio, siempre busca la diversificación de su producto de acuerdo a lo que los clientes le piden.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de bolsas, ajos, hilos, telas y sombreros. Sus compañeras comentan que la Sra. Rosa María D. E. se ha superado gracias a su negocio y a la dedicación.  
Su principal objetivo en la vida es dejarles una gran herencia a sus hijos que es el estudio para que puedan tener una vida mejor. Eso es lo admirable de las personas principalmente las señoras que integran los diferentes grupos, que a pesar de las dificultades que enfrenten siempre está por encima la educación de sus hijos.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
Carmela López R.       (vta. de plástico), 
Antonia S. L.     (vta. de sombreros), 
Josefina B. S. 
Lourdes D. E.     (vta. De comida), 
Olivia S. D.      
Lisbeth D. D.       (vta. De artículos de temporada), 
Beatriz López S.      (Hojalatería), 
María Inés D. Martínez (Miscelánea)
texts.en:
This group is called “Tercel Cuartel” (3rd Quarter) because Atlacomulco where they live is divided into quarters. Here the majority of the population have an economic base in the cultivation and sale of vegetables. These are very hard working people. The group is composed of 10 members and this is the 3rd time they have solicited a loan from CrediComun. The photo was taken in the house of Mrs. Rosa Maria where their weekly reunions are held. Let's look at the Rosa Maria's work. She is the 1st person right to left in the photo. She is 48 years old and only learned to read and write in primary school. She sells pockets ordered by dressmakers and seasonal articles, primarily in the public markets of different municipalities, like Atlacomulco, Istlahuaca, and El Oro, to mention a few. Rosa Maria has been doing this for 22 years. She mentions that previous loans invested in her business have given 1 of her 6 children the opportunity to study in the university at present, and she plans to continue working assiduously as she has been doing for years, to give this same opportunity to the 3 youngest children, since, unfortunately, the 2 oldest never had the chance to study. She always looks for ways to diversify her products in accord with her customers' demands. Rosa Maria is requesting the loan to purchase sewing materials, cloth, and hats. Her companions comment that she has gotten ahead thanks to her business and her dedication. Her principal objective in life is to provide a heritage to her children, which is an education that will offer them a better life. This is the admirable thing about the women who make up these different groups, that despite the difficulties they face, always, their primary goal is the education of their children. The other members of the group are: Carmela L. R. (sale of plastics) Antonia S. L. (sale of hats) Josefina B. S. Lourdes D. E. (sale of meals) Olivia S. D. Lisbeth D. D. (sale of seasonal articles) Beatriz L. S. (tin-ware) Maria Ines D. M. (miscellany)

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SEWING MATERIALS, THREAD, CLOTH, AND HATS

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma M. lives in Borewala, Pakistan's 'city of shrines'. Her husband is a street hawker and sells the snacks on his bicycle, while her son has rented a shop in the market where he does embroidery works. In order to financially support her husband, Salma started a cloth-selling business a few years ago. She travels to Faisalabad (famous for its textile industry) to buy clothes and sells them to the local market and other people on order. Unfortunately, these days she is out of stock. She has therefore applied for a loan from Asasah which she will use to buy clothes in bulk and of the latest variety.

Note: "Salma is showing her husband's business of snack-selling in this photo".

loans.use: To purchase clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Borann

texts.en:
Mr. Borann Y. (pictured above), is 42 years old and his wife, Mrs. Samet Horng, is 39 years old. They live along National Road Number One, about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1991, and have three children: two sons and one daughters. 

Borann has been a driver for 10 years. He drives for a company in Phnom Penh. His wife is a farmer; she grows vegetables on her farmland in the village. Borann is applying for his first loan of $500 for his wife to purchase bamboo and nets to shelter her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To help his wife grow vegetables.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
Melania Catalina R.  es una señora de 63 años de edad, viuda,  la cual vive con sus 2 hijos  en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace 2 años  doña Melania inició un negocio venta de ropa. Ella tiene un local cerca de casa, ahí tiene su propia tienda de ropa la cual ha podido sacar adelante poco a poco. Sin embargo ella asegura que por falta de financiamiento se ha quedado un poco estancada. 

Es por eso que Doña Melania  necesita un préstamo de ¢300.000 (trescientos     mil colones). Para comprar más ropa y mejorar las condiciones del local. Con esto ella logrará que su local se vea mejor y pueda ofrecerles más opciones a sus clientes que dicen estar muy contentos con la nueva tiendita 

Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo,  y con él espera crecer seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Melania Catalina R. is a 63 year-old widow, who lives with her 2 children in a community called Santa Fe, which is located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is in a mountainous region very close to the northern border of the country. The main economic activities there are livestock and agriculture, particularly the cultivation of staple grains, sugar cane and oranges. Two years ago, Melania started a business selling clothing. She has a place close to her house where she has her own clothing store, which she has gradually developed over time. However, she tells us that the lack of financing has been an obstacle to growth. For this reason, Melania needs a loan of 300,000 Costa Rican colones, to buy more clothing and improve the condition of her shop. With this loan, she will make her store look better and be able to offer more options to her customers, who say that they are very satisfied with the new store. She is a member of the communal bank "Manantial de Santa Fe," one of the 100 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it she hopes to continue growing as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: clothing sales

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol vive en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; está separada del esposo y tiene cuatro hijos todos viven con ella incluyendo su mama, trabaja en Terrasur que es una Institución que vende casas y terrenos.

El crédito que solicita es para operar a su niña de 11 años a quien le descubrieron agua en los riñones, es cliente de Impro con tres créditos ya cancelados y es parte de Kiva por primera vez. Ella acudió a Impro por la tasa de interés y por las pocas garantías que se pide, esta satisfecha con el servicio.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito nuevo.
texts.en:
Marisol lives in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. She is separated from her husband and has four children. They all live with her as well as her mother. She works in Terrasur, which is an institution that sells houses and land. The loan that she is asking for is for an operation on her 11 year old daughter; water was found in her kidneys. She has been an Impro client with three loans that she has already paid off and she is a part of Kiva for the first time. She went to Impro because of the interest rate and because they ask for few sureties. She is satisfied with the service. She can access this new loan because of the social nature of its use.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The cost of her 11 year old daughter's surgery, who was found to have water in her kidney.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma C. lives in Brgy. Talangnan, Madredijos, Cebu City. She is marred to Jershon Alfonso C. III, 35 years old, and they have six children, ages 2- 12. Emma has three businesses: a chicken barbecue business, a dried locust business, and a fishing business. Her husband works in the chicken barbecue field and helps his wife with her business activities. Emma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 cycle loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 30,000, and uplifted the family's standard of living. Emma's 14th cycle loan of PHP 28,000 will be used to buy a new pump boat for her fishing business. With her earnings, she will continue to save for the future, provide good education for her children and to improve their living conditions. Emma C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase a new pump boat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of flour and some cloth

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie C. is from the village of Caraniogan. She is 30 years old. Rosalie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over four  years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Rosalie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sports materials.

loans.name: Joan Kariuki

texts.en:
Joan Kariuki N. is 29 years old and owns a retail shop in Kaloleni. She is a single lady supporting one child. She earns additional income from her secondary business, which is running a salon that she owns. Joan has been in this business for the last four years and has done great.

She has applied for her second loan with KADET, which she wants to use to purchase more inventory of beauty products and cosmetics for her salon. She will use the anticipated profits to restock the salon.

In the future she hopes to sell more in her community and train young ladies who aspire to work in a salon.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of beauty products and cosmetics

loans.name: Josefa Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Josefa, tiene 59 años de edad, esta casada, de oficios domesticos, actualmente tiene un tienda de consumo diario, con el fin de surtir su tienda solicita un prestamos para invertir en este negocio, y asi brindar un mejor servicio, y con ello también tenga un mejor ingreso de ganancia, los cual es muy importante para ella mantener este negocio con olon necesario, por eso se ha acercado a ASDIR para solicitar un prestamo que le servirá como inversión en dicho negocio.
texts.en: Doña Josefa is 59 years old and married.  In addition to being responsible for domestic duties, she currently runs a store that sells goods for daily use.  She is requesting a loan from ASDIR to invest in stocking her store.  This way she can offer better service and also increase her income.  For this reason it is very important for her to stock the necessities.

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba A. is 34-years old, married and supports her family by operating a business buying and selling livestock.  She lives in Purok Lawis 2, Brgy. Alimango, Escalante City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her buying and selling livestock business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average income of PHP 8,000.  Melba is now borrowing PHP 19,000 so that she could continue to fund the operations of her livestock business.   This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Melba aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her livestock business.

loans.name: Manuel Tomas

texts.es:
Manuel elabora zapatillas y las distribuye a diferentes tiendas. Vive con su esposa y dos hijo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo y caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes.
 
Hace años atrás el vivía en la ciudad Esmeraldas del Ecuador donde es muy turístico hacer zapatillas porque es donde quedan la mayorías de las playas. Pero  cuando se mudo a Guayaquil para tener más oportunidades de negocio.  Por esa buena dedición y por recorrer las calles de Guayaquil recorriendo para vender las zapatillas el pudo encontrar tienda para venderle la mercadería al por mayor.  En la actualidad trabaja con ayuda de su hijo confeccionando zapatillas para venderlas a un volumen alto (en la foto aparecen las cajas donde va a repartir las zapatillas). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales, cuero, plantillas, fibra para elaborar zapatillas. En el futuro quiere tener un canal de distribución grande de calzado y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Manuel manufactures sandals that he sells to various stores.  He lives with his wife and two children in an urban area, called Guasmo, notable because most of its residents are merchants.

Years ago he used to live in the city of Esmeraldas del Ecuador which is a beach resort.   Sandal making is very popular there because that’s where most of the beaches are.  He moved to Guayaquil, however, to have more business opportunities.  That was a good decision and while wandering through Guayaquil’s streets he found several stores to sell his sandals to at wholesale.  He currently works with one of his son’s help making sandals to sell at high volume.  (The photo shows the boxes used to distribute the sandals.)

He will use the loan to buy materials and supplies: leather, soles and fiber to make the sandals.  In the future he’d like to have a major distribution channel and to build his house better.

loans.use: For shoe making supplies.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a tailoring business from home, selling to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition she operates a boutique which is her other source of income.  Salma faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business.  She hopes to expand and establish a retail shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more animals and food for them, such as corn and grasses, among other items.

loans.name: Eusebia Del Carmen

texts.es: Eusebia tiene 55 años, a esta edad ella ha luchado por salir adelante en la vida y ha conocido diferentes experiencias de su negocio. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este trabajo como es la venta de granos básicos. Ella siempre ha sido cliente de Fundación León 2000, ella es madre de 1 hijo de que depende de ella, él le ayuda a su Mama en lo que puede. El crédito que realiza es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz, concentrado entre otros. Sueña con proporcionarle ciertas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Eusebia is 55 years old. At this age she has struggled to get ahead in life and has had different experiences in her business. She has been selling basic grains for more than 18 years. She has always been a customer of field partner Fundación León 2000. She has one son who is dependent on her. He helps his mother with what he can. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn and concentrates among other things. She dreams with making certain improvements to her home.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith F. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Edith owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Edith has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Edith joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Edith is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her ninth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy a larger shop to increase his business

loans.name: Ana Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Ana, tiene  30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 8, 4 y 2 años, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por 6 años y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.

Es una gran ama de casa que también se  dedica a la venta productos por catálogos de Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días ya sea en las mañanas o en las tardes cuando tenga tiempo libre ya que sus hijos están pequeños y a veces no hay con quien dejarlos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lleva realizando esta actividad ya hace 11 años y le ha ido muy bien. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos. Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the “Salud y Vida“ communal bank meets in the city of Charapoto. This area is known for its culture and tradition and also for being located only a few minutes from San Jacinto and San Clemente, two of the province’s major beaches.

Here we find Ana 30 year old Ana.  She has three children, ages eight, four, and two.  The oldest attends school.  Her husband has an auto shop.  She has been part of the communal bank for six years and likes it because it helps her get loans.

She is a homemaker who also sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, perfumes, and ladies accessories).  She works daily, whether in the mornings or evenings when she has some free time, since her children are still young and she has no one to leave them with.  She sells door to door and also takes orders.  She grants credit and collects weekly.  She's been doing this for 11 years and things are going well for her.  She sells mostly cosmetics and perfumes.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and other products.  She dreams of having her own home one day because she currently rents.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 19 años; está casada con Edson. Ambos cuidan de sus 2 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos es de su anterior compromiso. Pero según afirma viven en armonía familiar, en su casa propia ubicada en Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica está abnegada mujer es la agricultura, donde siembra café y plátanos en sus 2 hectáreas de  terrenos agrícolas que se sitúa en la parte alta de su comunidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder extraer el plátano cada 15 días, pues se siente gustosa de obtener ganancias. Ya tiene 4 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo logró obtener buenas ganancias anuales en su cosecha de café, que lo comercializa en la ciudad de Villarica. Asimismo pudo obtener un motocarro, que le sirve para trabajar en el trasporte público. El cual le ayuda en los gastos diarios del hogar. Ahora planea incursionar en el negocio de venta de carne y productos lácteos, ya que en la campaña de café tiene gran demanda. Pues se requiere para la preparación de los alimentos del personal que trabaja en las diferentes haciendas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el progreso de Prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está segura podrá lograr sus objetivos. Luz, se está invirtiendo su capital de trabajo en la próxima cosecha de café. Por ello con el crédito comprará varios kilos de pescado de agua dulce, así como también comprará queso proveniente de la sierra para comenzar su negocio de venta de comida para la jornaleros.
texts.en:
Luz is 19 years old and married to Edson.  They both look after their 2 children, of whom one is from an earlier relationship.  Luz tells us that they live together in family harmony, in their own home which is located in Unión Palomar (in the central Peruvian jungle).

This self-sacrificing woman works as a farmer.  She grows coffee and bananas on her 2 hectares of farmland which are located in the elevated part of her community.  What she most enjoys about her work is being able to pick her bananas every two weeks as she feels glad to be making profits.  She has 4 years experience in this business and, over time, she has managed to obtain good annual profits from her coffee crops which she sells in the city of Villarica.  She has also been able to obtain a car that she uses to provide a public transport service.  This helps her with her daily household expenses.  Now Luz is planning to start a business selling meat and dairy products since there is a lot of demand during the coffee season.  These products are needed to prepare meals for the staff who work on all the different ranches.

Luz belongs to the "Desarrollando para el Progreso de Prisma" community bank and this is her first loan from MFP.  She is certain that she will be able to achieve her goals.  Luz is investing her working capital in her next coffee harvest.  For this reason, she will use her loan money to buy several kilos of freshwater fish and cheese from the mountains so that she can start her business selling meals to farm laborers.

loans.use: to buy fish and cheese

loans.name: Paceñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PACEÑITAS” iniciará su decimo quinto  ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Marina.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de relojes, venta de comida.

La señora Marina, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es su cuarto año con  Pro Mujer y que ingreso por que le trajeron sus amigas

En la actualidad la señora Marina tiene un negocio de venta de comida que trabaja hace diez años, nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió sola. El crédito que sacará ahora es para la compra de material de construcción para su casa.

Para la elaboración de la comida compra los ingredientes de la Ceja (zona de comercio de la ciudad de El Alto) y lo comercializa en la zona Ballivian los días jueves y domingo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con sus compañeras y el pago mensual.
texts.en:
The “PACEÑITAS” community bank is about to start its 15th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima regional office.  This group has eight members and its president is Marina.  The businesses that the members of this group carry out are varied and include: selling clothes, selling watches and selling meals.

Marina, the bank's president, tells us that this is her fourth year with Pro Mujer and that she joined through her friends.

Marina currently has a business selling meals which she has owned for ten years.  She tells us that she learned the business herself.  She will use this loan to buy construction supplies for her home.

Marina buys the ingredients for making her meals in La Ceja (a commercial area in the city of El Alto) and she sells her meals in Ballivian neighborhood on Thursdays and Sundays.  This work allows her to make money with which to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When we asked Marina what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she enjoys sharing with her fellow groups members and the monthly payment.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth B. is from the village of MAKAWA, ALORAN, MIS. OCC. She is 42 years old. Lilibeth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a small manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling home-woven mats "NIPA" for house construction and repair in the community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilibeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials for nipa making. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Lilibeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for "NIPA" making

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 49-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have two children, who are both in school.

To earn a living, Elizabeth is in the poultry business. Specifically, she raises ducks in the Philippines. Elizabeth is requesting a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP ($275) through NWTF to buy feed for her ducks. Elizabeth explains that she has been in the duck-raising business for four years now, and that she has borrowed from NWTF on three prior occasions to sustain her business. In the future, Elizabeth would like to expand her duck-raising business to better provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: Aida Francisca

texts.es:
Aida tiene 55 años de edad, ella vive en una casa alquilada junto con su hija, en la ciudad de Chiclayo – Lambayeque.

Aida tiene un negocio de venta de comida, desde hace 2 años. Su negocio esta ubicado en una esquina estratégica de la ciudad de Chiclayo y cuenta con bastante afluencia. Aida esta feliz con esto y es por ello que quiere brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y ofrecerles nuevos productos.

Aida solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar gaseosas, agua mineral e hidratantes. Además, otra parte del crédito será invertida en remodelar un poco su negocio. Con esto Aida busca mantener contenta a su clientela y por lo tanto crecer económicamente.

Aida ha solicitado préstamos a nuestra entidad que ha cancelado con responsabilidad, estos préstamos le ayudaron a desarrollar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aida is 55 years old and she lives in a rented house together with her daughter. It is located in the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque.

Aida has had a food sales business for two years. Her business is strategically located at a corner in the city of Chiclayo and she enjoys a great affluence of customers. Aida is happy because she wants to provide her clients with a better level of service and to provide them new products.

Aida requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva field Partner) a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase soft drinks, mineral water, and juices. A part of her loan will be invested in the remodeling of her business. Through this Aida hopes to keep her clientele happy and to grow financially.

Aida has requested past loans from our organization and she has repaid them responsibly. These loans have helped her develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and to remodel her business.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: Amanda, de 46 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Florentino de 56 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Amanda es una vendedora de Productos de belleza muy solicitada en su barrio, siempre esta muy informada de los nuevos productos que han salido al mercado y no pierde la oportunidad para dar uno que otro consejito de belleza  a su habituales clientes, puesto que disfruta de vender sus productos y más aún cuando acaba su mercadería. Tiene  6 años ejerciendo éste negocio y espera posteriormente poder abrir un salón de belleza, donde pueda vender sus cosméticos, ya que actualmente le es muy difícil ir por todos los lugares donde deja sus productos de belleza y cobrarles uno por uno. Espera de su colaboración para que cumpla sus sueños de tener un salón de belleza. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, se siente en la capacidad de pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, ya que confía en su negocio y en su banco comunal, en donde se siente muy contenta de pertenecer. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza, para incrementar su stock.
texts.en: Amanda is 46 years old; she is a simple and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her 56 year old husband, and 3 loving children to whom she wishes to give a better quality of life. Amanda sells beauty products and she is very sought after in her neighborhood since she is very well informed of the latest products to come to market and doesn’t miss an opportunity to give a beauty tip to her customers. She enjoys selling her products even more when her merchandize sells out. Amanda has worked selling beauty products for 6 years and hopes to be able to open her own beauty salon where she can sell her makeup since it is difficult for her to go around selling her products and collect the payments one by one. Amanda hopes for your cooperation so that she can see her dreams become a reality, mainly having a beauty salon. This is her fourth loan with MFP and feels able to meet her payments on time since she trusts in her business and in her communal bank where is very happy to belong. With the two thousand nuevos soles, she will buy beauty products to increase her supplies.

loans.use: buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Hermano Miguel (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Hermano Miguel está formado por 9 socias quienes en su mayoría son familia, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten ayudar económicamente en sus hogares y salir adelante junto a sus familias. Viven  por el sector de las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad más importante  del País. Su gente, su cultura, sus tradiciones, la variedad de su gastronomía y la belleza de sus paisajes hacen de esta ciudad encantadora y de ensueños. 

La Señora. Gladys vive por el sector de la Orquídeas, se encuentra en el banco comunal  7 años, tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 8 y 1 año y medio de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Gladys es profesora y hace dos años se encuentra ejerciendo su profesión en la escuelita de la ciudad, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Esika, esta labor la realiza hace 3 años.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas y cosméticos para crecer en su negocio.
 
Su meta es  obtener su licenciatura ya que solo le falta un año más de estudios.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una de las socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo. Por esta ocasión nos acompaña en la foto el Señor Danny que es el promotor.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Hermano Miguel" is comprised of 9 members, most of whom are related.  They work in different activities that help them to support their households and get ahead with their families.  They live in the Las Orquideas neighborhood in the city of Cuenca, which is the third largest city in the country.  Its people, its culture, its traditions, the variety of its cuisine and the beauty of the surrounding countryside make this city enchanting and dreamlike.

Gladys lives in the Las Orquideas neighborhood.  She has been in this communal bank for 7 years.  She is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children aged eight and one and a half.  Her oldest daughter studies in a school in the city.  Her husband is an industrial mechanic.  They do not own a home, and so live in a rented dwelling.

Gladys is a teacher.  She has been teaching in a small school in her city for two years.  In her free time she sells Esika brand cosmetics.  She has been selling cosmetics for three years.

She will invest the proceeds of this loan in perfumes, creams and cosmetics to expand her business.

Her goal is to get her degree, since she lacks only one more year of studies.

The small insert photo is of one of the members who could not be present when they took the group photograph.  On this occasion the group photo also includes Danny, who is a loan officer.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Fraternité Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bujiriri, représentante du groupe d’affaire « Fraternité»,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de poissons (frais et fumés). Son mari est un bradeur des monnaies (échangeur de monnaie). Elle étale ses marchandises au marché sectoriel de Ndosho. Il y a 18 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  3 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 paniers de poissons.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Fraternité» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
Bujiriri, representing the group "Fraternité," is a 33-year old entrepreneur. She is married and the mother of 6 children, all of whom are students. She sells fish (fresh and smoked), and her husband is a currency exchanger. 

She displays her merchandise at the Ndosho local market. In business for 18 years, she has had 3 loan cycles with Hekima. With this new loan she will be able to buy 2 baskets of fish. Also, she plans to educate her children and buy a piece of land. This client is grateful to Hekima for helping poor women who are excluded from traditional banks. For the most part, members of the group "Fraternité" are women.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of fish

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La Señora Claudia, es casada, vive en la ciudad D. Villarrica, tiene 3 hijos.
Hace poco más D. tres años con la ayuda D. su cónyuge logro abrir una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro ir mejorando, gracias a que cada día tiene más clientes, con este negocio ella pueD. ayudar a su cónyuge a poder hacer estudiar y alimentar a sus hijos.
Ella manifiesta que su negocio le ha sido D. mucha ayuda y le gustaría poder seguir con el. Sueña con algún día poder ampliar su pequeño negocio y así poder ofrecer mas variedad D. productos a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra D. comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas, lácteos y demás para abastecer el stock D. mercaderías D. su negocio. DesD. ya agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Claudia is married and lives in the city of Villarrica; she has three children.  A little over three years ago with help from her spouse she managed to open a small store in her home.  With much effort and dedication she’s been improving it thanks to her having more customers each day.  She can help her spouse educate and feed their children with this business.

She states that the store has been of much use to her and she’d like to be able to continue with it.  She dreams with some day being able to expand the small store and offer a greater variety of products to her customers.

She is asking for the loan to buy foodstuffs, beverages, vegetables, dairy products and others to stock her store with merchandise.  And as of now she thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it’s giving her.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 42 years old, is married with four children and lives in the Philippines. Arlene has a retail shop that sells candies, breads and snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. Arlene has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business. Arlene is a new member of HSPFI.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai is 58 years old and married with three children. The family lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Hai's husband earns money by raising pigs and chickens. Hai earns an income by running a general store in front of her house, selling a variety of goods and vegetables. She intends to use her loan to restock her store. She hopes her business will continue to run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of goods and vegetables to stock her store

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Carolina tiene su Restaurante en la casa de sus suegros donde vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, elabora todo tipo de almuerzos, atiende de Lunes a Sábado, tiene una experiencia superior a los 5 años en el rubro y es conocida en Quillacollo por su buena comida y por la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes. El crédito lo solicita es para la compra de insumos e ingredientes por mayor ya que se acerca la fiesta mundialmente conocida de la Virgen de Urkupiña donde llegan turistas de todos los lugares del mundo llega mucha gente y como su restaurante es en Quillacollo  la Sra. Carolina tendrá muchos más clientes de lo habitual, y necesita mas capital para aumentar la elaboración de almuerzos y platos típicos de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
texts.en:
Carolina has her restaurant in her in-laws’ house where she lives with her husband and two children.  She makes all types of lunches and is open Monday through Saturday.   She has more than five years’ experience in this line of work and is known in Quillacollo for her good food and the good attention she pays to her customers.

The loan she’s asking for is to buy ingredients and supplies at wholesale because the world renown festival of the Virgin of Urkupiña is approaching and many tourist from all over the world come and since Carolina’s restaurant is in Quillacollo she’ll have quite a few more customers than usual and she needs more capital to prepare the lunches and dishes typical of the city of Cochabamba.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 12 timbers

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with four children; three graduated from school while one still attends school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a food vending business which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to become a main supplier of charcoal in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and food products for her food vending business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and food products for food vending business

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin, 52 years old, is an ice cream seller who, with her husband, earns about $8 per day. They have four children. Two are studying and the other two are working in the factory, each earning $4 per day. Every month, Sin has to spend $100 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy steel and cement for repairing her house, and the rest of the money she will spend for her business of selling ice cream. The couple started doing this business a long time ago, and she plans to extend her career to sell more ice cream and open a small shop so that they don’t have to sell it from the motorbike.

loans.use: To buy steel and cement for repairing her house.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La socia tiene actualmente 41 años de edad; la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de animales menores y ella ha visto el incremento en sus ganancias principalmente con la venta de cuyes, la socia vende a los diferentes restaurantes de la zona turistica y también le contratan para otros eventos, como agazajos en matrimonios, cumpleñaos, bautizos, cargos, y ella abastece a los clientes con la venta de animales menores; la socia ha mejorado la calidad de vida de sus hijos y a invertido las ganancias en arreglos del hogar, ella también desea seguir creciendo y comprar terrenos de cultivo, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el nuevo crédito en la compra de 50 cuyes, los cuales criara y vendera segun la madurez de los mismos, la socia también desea comprar un par de chanchos tiernos para la venta. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de chanchos y de 50 cuyes.
texts.en:
Luisa is currently 41 years old.  She tells us that she has a total of 7 children.  She is engaged in the purchase and sale of small animals and has seen an increase in her earnings, primarily from the sale of guinea pigs.  Luisa sells to different restaurants in the tourist area, and they also purchase from her for special events.

She has improved the quality of life for her children and also has invested earnings in home repairs.  She also wants to continue increasing her earnings and purchase agricultural land.

Luisa wishes to invest the new loan in the purchase of 50 guinea pigs which she is going to raise and sell at maturity.  She also wants to purchase a pair of newborn pigs for sale.  She is applying for the loan in order to invest in the purchase of piglets and 50 guinea pigs.

loans.use: to purchase small animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 44-year-old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Sabah is trading clothes and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more clothes for trading purposes.

Sabah is looking to expand her business scale so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

Due to cultural issues, the man in the photo is Sabah's brother.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Shereen

texts.en:
Shereen is a 23-year-old single lady from Madaba, Jordan.

Shereen is selling clothes from home. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more clothes for trading purposes.

Shereen is looking to improve her family's living conditions and open a licensed shop for selling clothes instead of selling them from home.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Due to unemployment, Precy decided to invest her small capital of PHP 3,000 in buying processed meat products to resell. She was able to enter into college, but unfortunately she got married while studying so her parents did not send her anymore. She is now happily married to Amado and blessed with three children. To earn an income, she buys and sells meat products such as longganisa, tocino (cured and pork sausages), fish balls and other dim-sums to sell in their village. 

She wants to diversify her business but due to insufficient funds, she choose to get a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more longganisa, tocino, and fish balls to sell. 

Precy aims to own a stall in the market where she could sell her products conveniently.

With her patience and determination, she hopes that someday she will provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy more longganisa, tocino, and fish balls to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Eremi

texts.es: Francisco Eremi habita en la colonia los Laureles, junto a su familia que esta conformada por 6 miembros entre ellos 2 hijos mayores que aportan en los quehaceres del hogar. Francisco trabaja como Docente de primaria impartiendo el pan de la enseñanza a los niños de su comunidad, tambien es dueño de su pequeña unidad de produccion y su inventario ganadero lo que le permite maximizar las fuentes de ingreso a nivel familiar, su esposa también labora como docente y en conjunto asumen responsabilidades y gastos del hogar.  Esta solicitando  este financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de materiales  para la construccion de un cuarto que le permitirá mayor comodidad a su familia, y asi mejorar las condiciones en su vivienda desde ya agradece el apoyo para poder realizar y llevar a cabo dicha actividad.
texts.en: Francisco Eremi lives in the Los Laureles neighborhood with his family composed of six members among which are two adult children that help out with household chores.  Francisco works as an elementary school teacher imparting knowledge to children in his community; he also owns a small cattle herd that helps him maximize family income.  His wife also works as a teacher and together they are responsible for household expenses.  He’s asking for the loan to buy building materials and supplies for the construction of a room that will provide more comfort for his family thus improving their living conditions.  He thanks you in advance for your support to carry out this activity.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Marbelly Del Carmen

texts.es: Marbelly es casada, trabaja como coordinadora Administrativa en el Centro Social SOS desde hace 8 años . Esta solicitando  su 4to credito con el objetivo de construir un cuarto en su casa, la cual es muy pequeña y como esta esperando su 2do hijo desea esperarlo con mejor comodidad.  Cabe señalar que ha utilizado sus creditos para mejorar su vivienda, pues ha ido acondicionandola poco a poco para comodidad de su familia.
texts.en: Marbelly is married and has been working for eight years as an administrative coordinator at an SOS social center.  She is requesting her fourth loan with the goal of building a room in her house, which is very small.  Since she is expecting her second child, she hopes to wait for it in greater comfort.  It is worth pointing out that she has used her loans to improve her home, since she has been equipping it little by little for the comfort of her family.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Norma Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora. Norma es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive por la parroquia de Quingeo en Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de naturaleza, tiene grandes paisajes para disfrutar de la paz y tranquilidad, su gente se dedica a agricultura y cría de animales, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Norma tiene 24 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido  4 hijos de 7, 5, 2 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en un escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo se dedica a cortar césped, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Norma se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar ya que sus hijos aun son pequeños y como mayor parte del  tiempo pasa en casa cría cerdos, ganado y cuyes, también se dedica a la  agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para su consumo.

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en materiales de construcción para terminar su casa.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of Nueva Juventud Communal Bank.  She lives in the parish of Quingeo in Cuenca.  This area is surrounded by nature.  It has grand landscapes to enjoy the peace and tranquility.  The people there work in agriculture and raising animals.  They preserve the culture and traditions of their people.

Norma is 24 years old and married, with four children from her marriage, ages 7, 5, 2, and 1.  Her first two children study in a school in the town.  Her husband works cutting grass.  The house in which they live is their property.

Norma works doing the chores in her home since her children are still small.  Since she spends most of her time at home, she raises pigs, cattle, and guinea pigs.  She also works in agriculture, and what she harvests is only for her consumption.

This is her second loan from the communal bank, and she is going to invest it in construction materials to finish her house.

Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Raimunda

texts.es:
Raimunda,por la necesidad de realizar una nueva inversión en el negocio,esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de cerdos para aumentar su granja, ya que esto le permite al futuro disponer de más fuentes de ingreso, porque ofrece los cerdos gordos a buen precio, permitiéndole tener mayores posibilidades de venta y de ganancia.
Las condiciones de ella han mejorado, porque tiene una mayor solvencia económica frente a sus obligaciones en el hogar.
texts.en: Because Raimunda needs to make a new investment in her business, she’s asking for a new loan to buy pigs to increase her herd size because this will let her have more income at her disposal in the future because she sells the pigs at a good price which allows her to have better sales and profits possibilities.  He conditions have improved because she has better economic solvency with respect to her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mery Margot

texts.es: La señora Mery es una cliente antigua, obtuvo crédito antes en la agencia del tejar durante cuatro ciclos pero cancelo sin problemas, actualmente se encuentra en el banco de emprendimiento "Ejecutivos de Eros" se dedica a la venta de ropa  y zapatillas deportivos en las ferias de la localidad de Patacamaya y  zonas mineras de la ciudad de Potosí y en las distintas galerías de ciudad de La Paz. El crédito esta destinado a la compra de ropa por  mayor por los pedidos con los que cuenta. Es soltera no tiene hijos vive en la zona de bajo Sopocachi en la casa de su  mama actualmente su casa esta en construcción y por causa de las lluvias tuvo que parar, con esta actividad ayuda a su familia con los gastos de la construcción y los gastos del hogar, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Mery is an old client. She obtained a loan previous in the agency El Tejar for four loan cycles but she cancelled without problems. Now she is with the communal bank "Ejecutivos de Eors". She makes a living selling clothes and sports shoes in the local fairs of Patacamaya, the mining areas of the city of Potosí and in various galleries of the city of La Paz. 

This loan is for buying clothes wholesale due to the orders that she already has. She is single, with no children, and lives in the area of Lower Sopocachi in her mother's house. At the moment the house in under construction and work had to stop due to the rain. With this activity she contributes towards the costs of construction and the household bills. She is a hard working, responsible person who feels very grateful for this opportunity which has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear wholesale.

loans.name: Kevin Jesus

texts.es:
Kevin es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Kevin no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas que deseaba, ya que tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres, pues son muy humildes, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Kevin trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, él trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana y se encarga del cultivo y empaquetado de los productos, Kevin puede trabajar por un aproximado de 8 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Kevin se encuentra muy agradecido clon los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña cocina, ya que la tiene actualmente es de kerosene y está en malas condiciones; de esta manera Kevin espera poder seguir trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante al lado de su familia y espera poder cumplir su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Kevin is 20 years old. He is single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and brothers. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, Kevin has not been able to study System Engineering as he would have liked, because he had to start working very young to help his parents, as they are very poor. During his free time he enjoys watching TV and occasionally cooking a delicious Rice with Duck dish to share with his family. 

On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Kevin works every day as a field worker on a farm in his city. He works from very early in the morning and is in charge of the crop and packaging the products. Kevin works about 8 hours a day. Kevin enjoys working and believes it is going well because of his good work and the kind treatment he gives the others.

Kevin is very thankful for Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided, he is able to buy a small stove since the one he has currently uses kerosene and is in poor condition. In this way, Kevin hopes to continue working and striving to move forward along with his family. He hopes to one day achieve his dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Joseph Owour

texts.en:
Joseph is the second motorcycle owner to register in the community health support programme. (CHWSP) in Kisumu county Kenya. Joseph is married and is a member of youth group on Kisumu who want to make a difference in their community. He is also the co chair of a group of young people who would like to contribute in the welfare of their community in Kisumu.  Joseph will be providing transport to selected Community Health Workers who will be conducting visitation in their community, and additionally he will participate and support youth training camps where community awareness on health and hygiene will be discussed Kisumu Town. 

By supporting the Community Health Workers in Kisumu, Joseph will be contributing immensely towards easing transportation and coverage of CHWs in Kisumu Town. Lameck will be attached to a CHW in Kisumu County and four times in a month will be providing transport to CHWs on their regular visitation of patients or providing health education to the community. Joseph will also be on standby in his community wherever transport is needed to transport patients in the nearby clinic. The motorcycle will also assist in supporting Joseph direct family and siblings during other days as he will use the bike as taxi transporting people and produce to the market.

Joseph is engaged in recruiting more motorcycle taxi drivers in the CHW support programme in Kisumu County.

loans.use: To buy a Motorcycle to Support Community Health Work and Livelihoods.

loans.name: Yeredon 4 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe YEREDON 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  26 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJIDJENI, commune de FAKOLA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz et l’arachide avec ADJA la 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 1/2 hectare. La production est vendue à FAKOLA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Karkyra

texts.ru: Каркыра успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Ей 33 года, Каркыра по-прежнему в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается разведением скота и полеводством. В хозяйстве у нее есть 3 коровы, на 0,20 Га собственной и 2,0 Га арендованной земли выращивает перец и клевер. Бизнес приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Каркыра обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на строительство и утепление дома. На кредитные средства она приобретет 8 пластиковых окон, 5 дверей, цемент и кирпич и прочее. Утеплив дом, на создаст благоприятные условия для жизни детей. Доходы Каркыра будет вкладывать в улучшение жилищных условий и обучение ее детей.
texts.en:
Zhainagul is 39 and married.  She has a higher education.  She used to work as a teacher but she is now on maternity leave.  For many years, she has also been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute an additional source of income for her family.  Karkyra successfully repaid her first loan and used her money according to its intended purpose.  She now has three cows on her farm and she grows peppers and clover on 0.2 hectares of her own land and two hectares of leased land.  Her business brings her a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).

Karkyra has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum, and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to finish building and insulating her house.  She will use her loan to buy eight vinyl windows, five doors, some cement, bricks, and other materials.  A well-insulated house will create comfortable living conditions for her children.  Karkyra is planning to use her earnings to improve her family's living conditions and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy plastic windows, doors, bricks, cement etc. to properly insulate her house.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Nancy who is a 37-year-old smallholder farmer from Kericho area in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Nancy owns a 3-acre farm. On the farm, she practices mixed farming. The kind mother keeps dairy animals and grows varieties of crops and vegetables. She has 10 years of experience in farming. Nancy is seeking a loan to buy seeds and expand her horticulture farm. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. Loans for smallholder farmers are hard to come by in Kenya. Few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva support farmers like Nancy. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Nancy. Through the loan she will be able to increase her horticulture production and she will be able to sell vegetables to other markets.
Help Nancy today to achieve her dreams with the loan she needs.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his farming business

loans.name: Naana

texts.en: Naana is 40 years old and a single mother with 1 child. She had only basic education. She procures palm fruits from villages and processes them into palm oil in her house. She produces the palm oil with traditional methods of processing for the past 5 years and thinks she loses a lot. She therefore intends to use the KIVA loan to procure some basic tools like a fruit press to reduce the loss and the drudgery that goes with it.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.en:
My name is Etelvina M. and I sell popular consumer products. I have done this for two years and my son helps me to deal with my customers. I want to have a wider variety of products on offer and therefore sell more. I would use the earnings to remodel the business (a room in our house) and, most importantly, to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Etelvina M. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, actividad que realizo hace unos 2 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la atencion de mis clientes, mi deseo es tener una mayor variedad de productos y asi tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio (casa de habitacion) y lo mas importante alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar, salt, chile, bread, butter, oil, margarine, pastries, coffee/Compra de jabon, azucar, sal, chile, pan, manteca, aceite, margarina, pastas, cafe,.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Born in 1945, Mary S. is married to Chi Moses and they have six children and two grand children. Her wish to see all her children educated was shattered, her husband being unemployed and unable to afford their school fees, talk less of providing other basic needs like food and medication for them. The issue worsened when her daughter died and left her with two grand children to take care of. At this juncture, she sought help from GHAPE and she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline, which have been reinforced by bi-monthly meetings. She was also given a first loan of $20 with which she carried out crop cultivation, fed her family and sold some food.

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to sell cow meat in the villages hence reducing the distance to be paid by villagers to go to the town market to buy meat. She intends to raise money to buy a plot of land and construct a workshop for her son. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Mary would like to purchase a cow, rent a shed in the market, buy buckets and a table for her butchery.

loans.name: Shalala

texts.en: Shalala is a mother of two children, and lives in Yenikand village, in the Salyan region. She is 36 years old. She has been in the farming business for 8 years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche C. sells food, drinks and Santana, which is local food made from cassava. She has been in the business since 2004 and is a dedicated LAPO client. Uche C. is  married and has 4 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She wishes to expand her business by buying more food, drinks and Santana to sell.  That is how she will spend the $800 loan.

loans.use: To buy food, drinks and Santana

loans.name: Bakhriddin

texts.en: Bakhriddin E. lives in Mastchokh. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004, and the loan sums are permanently increased, which reveals his business stability and income increase. He describes himself as a serious and experienced client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. He is engaged in the commercial services and trade. He works in the bazaar; his shop is located in the men's and children's shoes section. Bakhriddin E. has a variety of inventory that allows him to work with clients of different income levels and permanent clients, but he wants to import the new models demanded among the population today. He requires a loan of 4100 STJ to widen the existing assortment, and to develop the men's and children's shoes inventory.

loans.use: To expand the existing assortment

loans.name: Kasokoso A(Iv) Group

texts.en:
Dissy is 38 years old and divorced with two children.Esther and Joy have retail shop businesses and intend to use the loan to add in stock. Afuwa has a canteen business while Dissy has a bar.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Avelina M.. She is married with four children (ages 6, 7, 9, and 12 years old). In 1999, Avelina established a seamstress business, and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional materials and sewing accessories in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services.
