SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and sewing accessories in bulk for her seamstress business.

loans.name: Pamfa

texts.en:
Mrs. Pamfa N. lives in Bhatkepati, Lalitpur. Bhatkepati is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. N. lives with her husband, four sons, four daughters-in-law and five grandchildren. All of her grand children are studying at school.

Mrs. N. and all other family members work on their farm. Farming is their traditional work, and they sell their vegetables at the local market every day in the morning and evening. They are totally dependent on their agricultural work because they don’t have other work. Mrs. N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for their work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba has her own home and lives with her husband on Titicaca Street in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. The couple has children, all of whom are married. Elba set up a grocery store in her home, which provides income for daily expenses. She also cooks and has regular customers who pay each month for lunch service. She's asking for a loan to have additional capital to be able to supply her store with the basics (products of basic necessity), which have greatly increased in price lately.

She has a good prior history and qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora tiene domicilio propio, vive en la calle Titicaca de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, la pareja tiene hijos y todos están casados. Elba instaló en su vivienda una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le genera ingresos de subsistencia, también cocina y tiene pensionados (clientes que pagan cada mes por un servicio de almuerzo). Solicita crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo y adquirir productos de primera necesidad, los cuales están subiendo mucho de valor últimamente. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Additional capital for products to supply her business

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr:
Kadidiatou S., 45, is married and has been a member of the Sinthiang Coundara village bank for three years. She wants to expand her business, which involves purchasing cows, fattening them and then killing them and selling the meat. Her income allows her to help take care of her family. Kadidiatou is requesting her seventh loan, which will be repaid in six months in one single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Kadidiatou S., 45 ans, mariée, est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Coundara depuis 3 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter des bœufs, les engraisser puis faire l’abattage et vendre la viande.. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’entretien de sa famille. Kadidiatou sollicite un 7ème prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase cows

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty T. sells rice in sacks. She is single and must fully support herself and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Rim C., 32, and his wife, Sros Mony Kao, live in a village about 10 miles from Phnom Penh, Cambodia's capital city. They were married six years ago and have one son and one daughter.

For the past 11 years, Rim and Sros have earned a living by working in a garment factory. However, they don't make enough to pay for home repairs, which they desperately need. To build a fence and bathroom in their home, Rim is requesting a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars.

loans.use: To build a fence and bathroom in a family home

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, who is 50 years old, has 6 children, all of whom are professionals and are independent. At present, she lives only with her husband Daniel who is a carpenter and supports her wholly. She sells different varieties of food, like French fries with sausage, “juanes,” fish wrapped in leaves, and other regional plates. This activity is carried out outside the house, in a place that is very busy and crowded. She has already spent 7 years in this job. She also the owner of a three-wheeler that her husband drives; he is in charge of its maintenance. She only sells her food at night. She is pleased when people taste her food and tell others about its good flavor. With the money from the loan, she will buy tables and chairs so that her clients are more comfortable. Later, she hopes to buy carp for protection from the rain.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz (50 años) tiene 6 hijos, todos ya profesionales e independientes. En la actualidad solo vive con su esposo Daniel que se dedica a la carpintería y la apoya en todo. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en distintas variedades: salchipapas, juanes, pescado envuelto en hoja y otros platos regionales. Esta actividad la realiza fuera de su casa, en un lugar muy transitable y concurrido, tiene ya 7 años en esta labor. También es propietaria de un motocarro que maneja su esposo y es quien se encarga de su mantenimiento. Ella sólo vende por la noches, le gusta que mucha gente deguste de su comida y difundan a otros de su buena sazón. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará mesas y sillas para dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes, posteriormente, desea comprarse una carpa para protegerse de la lluvia.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs so that her dinner guests are more comfortable

loans.name: Talal

texts.en: Talal K. is a 31-year-old single man who lives in a small village located in Lebanon's Northern Bekaa Valley, close to the town of Baalback. Talal owns a shop for repairing bicycles and motor bicycles. He is a very ambitious business owner and has decided to enlarge his repair operations in his town. Talal has requested a loan of $500 from Al Majmoua in order to renovate his shop and purchase new repair tools.  This will be Talal's first loan with Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To renovate Talal's bicycle shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Invest in products such as wigs, hair dryers and other goods for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Ayeshetu

texts.en:
Ayeshetu A. is 45 years old. She is a wife and the mother of five children who are currently in school. Ayeshetu lives with her family in Ashaiman, a suburb of Tema in the Greater Accra region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and has been selling “waakye” for the past ten years. Waakye is a popular local dish made from cooked rice and beans, enjoyed with pepper sauce, macaroni and fish. It is sold in the mornings as breakfast. It is very tasty and satisfying and many Ghanaians enjoy waakye. 

With the loan, she intends to purchase more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans, and macaroni in bulk to prepare delicious ‘waakye’ for her customers. She believes the loan will enable her to save more money to send her first son to medical school next year. She is a member of a borrowing group called “Marigo” (meaning, diligence) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee social collateral for one another in order to access loans, and they provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase rice, vegetable oil, beans and macaroni in bulk.

loans.name: Julia Bertha

texts.en: Julia is a member of the Covadonga Village Bank. She is 50 years old and is married with six children. She and her husband have a carpentry workshop in their house in the Covadonga neighborhood. They work on special orders and Julia helps her husband to sand and paint. Julia is requesting a loan to buy more wood. She dreams of expanding her business, of working more and that her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava” del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Tiene 59 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 5 hijos.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró zapatillas para venderlos en su puesto de trabajo. Tiene casi 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que ha aumentado su venta de zapatilla y zapatos en este tiempo.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará zapatos, lana e insumos para artesanías. 
Martina desea continuar trabajando para llegar a tener su casa propia y apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Martina is a member of the "Dante Nava" communal bank in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 59-years-old, is single, and has 5 children. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she purchased slippers to sell at the stand where she works. She has worked with the communal bank for almost 5 years. She tells us that she has increased her sales of slippers and shoes in this time. With this loan of 3,000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy shoes, wool, and supplies to make crafts. Martina hopes to continue working so she can have her own home and support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase shoes, wool, and supplies to make crafts.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Mrs. Susan A., 58 years old, married and lives at Olingan, Dipolog City. She has 4 children. Her husband is a fisherman. In order to help her husband, she decided to join Paglaum MPC to avail loan to finance her snack vending  -- kamote (sweet potatoes)  and banana cue. It was a good start for Mrs. A., that she earned income from her micro-business. Due to demand of some of her neighbors, she also try to sell viands. Now, she applies PhP7,000 to Paglaum Cooperative to buy banana, "kamote" (sweet potato) for snacks, meat and fish  for viand-vending. In the future, she wants to own a mini restaurant & snack -inn. She would be happy to see her children lives in a comfortable life with their chosen careers.

loans.use: to buy banana, sweet potatoes, meat, fish for her viand & snack vending

loans.name: Martín Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Martín Alejandro J. vive en una casa prestada junto con su esposa y su hijo. 
Como desea tener su propia vivienda es por eso que está tramitando una casa por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental), pero el valor de la vivienda es superior al crédito que el puede recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo. 
  El trabaja como mecánico automotriz en una compañía y en horario adicional a su trabajo también realiza otros trabajos de mecánica a particulares. Por tal motivo está solicitando un préstamo para completar el crédito Gubernamental y así adquirir su casa. 
Ya que desea tener un patrimonio y al seguro para su familia.
texts.en:
Martin Alejandro Jimenez lives in a borrowed home with his wife and his child. He wants to have his own home which is why he is negotiating the purchase of a house through Infonavit (a government loan). However, the cost of the home is higher than the loan he can receive because his salary is low. Martin works as a car mechanic at a company and he also does additional mechanic jobs on the side. He is requesting a loan so that he can complete the government loan to purchase his home as he wants to have an asset and be able to provide security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Down payment to acquire his home through Infonavit (government loan)

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane D. owns a small parcel of farm land. She grows rice, which she sells to feed and clothe her family. She is 30 years old and has 3 children. She started her business using 1-hectare of land. Now that she has a 2-hectare farm, she continues to plant more rice for the future of her children.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy for fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds. The loan will truly help her increase her yield.

CEVI has always helped Mary Jane expand her rice farm business. She is provided with credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage to help her succeed in her endeavors.

loans.use: To buy for fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Norma Beatriz

texts.es:
Con muchas ganas de hacer empresa, Norma empezó su negocio propio hace quince años. Para entonces ella ya había trabajado en algunas empresas confeccionando especialmente trajes de novios y novias: vestidos, ternos, etc.  En su segundo lugar de trabajo se animo a proponerle a su jefe confeccionar trajes de disfraces para el alquiler o venta de ellos, su jefe aceptó y hoy en día el rubro de la empresa no es mas novios y novias sino disfraces. 

Al darse cuenta de lo rentable que podía ser el negocio de alquiler y venta de trajes de disfraces, Norma decidió independizarse luego de comprar sus maquinas industriales. Hoy con sus más de veinte años de experiencia trabajando para terceros y quince años trabajando para si misma, Norma continúa creciendo en su negocio.

Hoy en día, ofrece eventualmente sus servicios de confección a la última empresa en la que trabajó, lleva adelante su negocio propio con el alquiler y venta de disfraces y como si fuera poco, en los últimos meses esta invirtiendo en el comercio de atún al por mayor. Esto último gracias a la pequeña alianza que tiene con un sobrino suyo, dueño de una fabrica de conservas de atún. 

Una parte de sus ingresos los vuelve a invertir en sus negocios y la otra la destina para la educación de su menor hijo, el único que vive con ella de los tres que tiene.
texts.en:
Eager to do business, Norma started her own business 15 years ago. Prior to that she had already worked in various enterprises making wedding apparel: dresses and suites, et cetera. In her second place of employment she was encouraged to propose to her boss that they make costumes for sell or rent. Her boss liked the idea and today they are no longer in the business of wedding apparel, but the costume business. Realizing how profitable the sale and rental of costumes could be Norma decided to branch out on her own after purchasing their industrial sewing machines. Today, with 20 years of experience working for others and 15 years working for herself, Norma continues to expand her business. Nowadays, she provides sewing services to the previous company for which she worked, pursues her own business renting and selling costumes and, as if that were not enough, in the past few months has invested in the wholesale tuna trade. This latest is thanks to a partnership with her nephew, the owner of a tuna cannery. A portion of her earning are reinvested in her businesses and the remainder goes towards the education of the youngest of her three children, the only son still living at home.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of canned tuna

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Madame  Sitan  C. est âgée de 53 ans,  mariée  et mère de 5 enfants, elle vit  dans une  famille monogamique avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Pour des raisons sociales elle abandonne l’école pour se marier. Depuis étant élève elle menait des activités commerciales auprès de sa mère qui vendait du miel. Après plusieurs années passées à côté de cette dernière, elle acquière une solide expérience  lui permettant de voler de ses propres ailes. Évoluant  seule et menant beaucoup d’activités telle la vente de poissons, de brochettes de viande, de galettes, elle décide finalement de se spécialiser dans  le commerce d’habits. Elle mène ce commerce depuis 22 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle et notoriété au marché de Sébougou et dans son quartier de résidence où les clients viennent acheter à la maison. Ses habits de bonnes  qualités sont très  prisés  par les clients.
Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  elle est en relation depuis 48 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
 Elle compte utiliser ce prêt  pour acheter, 12 complets de bazins riches de différentes colories auprès des teinturières de la capitale Malienne  Bamako.
Madame  Sitan  C. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle constituée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel  de 35 000 FCFA qui lui permettra de payer ses tontines, de participer aux événements sociaux et de supporter certaines charges familiales. 
Son ambition est de faire l’import export  entre le Mali et le Burkina Faso.
texts.en:
Ms. Sitan C., age 53, is married and the mother of five. She lives in a monogamous family with her husband and children in the Bagadadji district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For societal reasons, she dropped out of school to get married. Since being a student, she worked in commerce with her mother, who used to sell honey. After several years at her mother’s side, she acquired solid experience, which enabled her to fly on wings of her own.

Improving by herself and working at many kinds of jobs, such as selling fish, meat kebabs, and galettes, she decided in the end to become specialized in the clothing business. She has been in this business for 22 years and enjoys a large customer base and fame at the Sébougou marketplace and in the district where she lives, there where customers come to buy at her house. Her clothing is of good quality and popular.

To increase her working capital, Sitan has turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for 48 months. After four solidarity loans and two individual loans, all repaid, she is now on her third individual loan.

She plans to use this loan to buy twelve outfits of rich damask fabric of different colors from dye experts in Bamako, the capital of Mali. She makes her sales to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

She hopes to realize a monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay the tontines (community revolving savings and loan groups), to participate in societal events, and to cover certain family expenses. Her ambition is to import and export goods between Mali and Burkina Faso.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Mr. Son S., 37, owns a brick-oven with which he makes charcoal to sell from his home. His wife, Chrep, 34, raises pigs for sale. They have one young child, not yet enrolled in school. Because the family's house is too old and small for them, Mr. S. would like a loan to add to his personal saving to build a new one. The loan will help the family attain a comfortable living. The picture shows Mr. S.'s wife because he was not available.

loans.use: To build a new house.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila is a member of the Virgen de Los Angeles Village Bank, which meets once per month in the town of Huayllacocha, about an hour from the city of Cusco. She is 51 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are adults living independently in Lima and Cusco, while three are children who still live at home. Domitila owns a small farm with her husband and also has a business buying and selling local products such as barley, broad beans and corn. She buys the crops from her neighbors and resells them in the jungle city of Quillabamba, about five hours away, travelling there about once per month.

Domitila is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy wheat, broad beans and corn, pledging to repay this loan on time and in full. She is grateful for the loans offered to her by Asociacion Arariwa since it is the only institution providing financial services in her town.

loans.use: To buy wheat, broad beans and corn.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 29-year-old man living in Al Chiyyah, Mount Lebanon. He has owned a garage since 2007 with a previous 14 year experience in the field. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to improve the state of the garage.

loans.use: To improve the state of the garage.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 31 years old. She is married and has given birth to two kids. Currently they are both in school. She sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or taken with what we called Kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge. With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to raise a good income to support her kids in school. She belongs to the village bank called ‘United we Stand’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Esmeralda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santiago Apóstol”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Paucarcolla, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 01 hijo y tiene estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en la Av. Puno.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, para su tienda de venta de abarrotes.

Su deseo es surtir mejor su tienda y mejorar sus ingresos.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Esmerald belongs to the “Santiago Apóstol” Communal Bank located in the Paucarcolla district, San Román province, Puno department. She is 23 yers old, married with 1 son, and has completed secondary school. She lives on Puno Avenue. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan for S/.300.00 soles was used to buy groceries. Today she needs a loan for S/.500.00 Nuevos Soles to buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles for her grocery store. Her wish is to better stock her store and increase her income. She likes the support she receives from her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles to stock her store

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio M., age 34, grows rice. When he is not busy on his farm, he works as a carpenter. He builds most of the concrete houses in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. He also makes furniture. He has two children. He dream of providing a better life and future for them.

He would like to request a loan of PHP 6,000. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed and chemicals. The loan will really go far in sustaining his livelihood.

He is actively involved in CEVI credit meetings. He has learned many things from bible reflections and sharing. He also received training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, rice seed and chemicals

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel A. G. tiene 43 años de edad, es viudo desde hace 8 años, tiene 1 hijo mayor el cual vive con el padre y ya tiene propia familia formada.
Desde hace 15 años atrás empezó con el negocio de flete, a principio comenzó solo a hacer distribución terceriza para la misma empresa, pero desde hace 10 años esta realizando el flete directo para la empresa.
Con el crédito obtenido de la fundación mando a reparar su Vehículo ya que el mismo tenía problemas técnico.
 Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado ya que es su primer crédito en una entidad financiera.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel A. G. is 43 years old and has been a widower for eight years. He has one grown son who lives with him and has started his own family. He began his trucking business 15 years ago. At the start, he was only a third-party distributor for the same business, but for the last ten years he has been providing his trucking services directly for the business. With the loan he has received from the Foundation he is going to have his vehicle repaired since it is having technical difficulties. He is grateful to the Fundación Parguaya for their support since this is his first loan from a financial entity.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa D. is 62 years old and has been raising pigs and cattle for a business since the time she joined ASHI in 1997. She has been able to have access to credit for business capital. Profits she makes from her livestock raising business augments the sporadic income of her laborer husband. She has been able to send her three children to school and had hoped that all of them would graduate from college. However, her two elder sons chose not to pursue their education. Now, they are laborers and are helping Tomasa in managing her business. 
Tomasa’s determination for growing her business became more intense because she wants to secure the future of her two children despite their low attainment in education. She wants her youngest daughter to finish her course in nursing. Tomasa is requesting a larger loan to be able to purchase more pigs and cattle to be raised in their backyard surrounded by verdant fields of grass and rice.

loans.use: Will be used for an additional capital for growing her livestock raising business.

loans.name: Julia Rosa

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Bancomunal Nuevo Amanecer, es casada, tiene 52 años, dos hijos de 31 y 21 años que trabajan y estudian. 
Julia trabajaba en ventas en una tienda, pero la tienda quebró y ella se quedo sin trabajo, se puso a vender productos de belleza por catálogo, pero desde jovencita ella le gustaba tejer y siempre tejía para ella y su familia, hasta que un día una amiga le dijo que le tejiera un poncho y la animó a tejer para que venda, fue a si como ella empezó a tejer para vender por pedidos, a la semana ella teje 4 ponchos.
En Finca Perú tiene 4 años, aprendió mucho con las capacitaciones que ha recibido, ahora sabe como sacar su ganancia por que antes todo lo mezclaba, aprendió como vender un producto frente a la competencia.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, va arreglar una parte de su casa y le va poner una reja para mayor seguridad para poderlo alquilar.
El sueño de Julia es que su hijo último sea un profesional y cada vez tener mas pedidos de tejido.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Nuevo Amanecer community bank. She is 52 years old, married, and has two children. They are 31 and 21 years old, and work and study.

Julia used to work in sales at a store, but the store went bankrupt and she was left without a job. She began to sell beauty products by catalog, but since she was young, she liked to knit and she would always knit for herself and her family. One day, a friend of hers asked her to knit a poncho and she was inspired to knit to sell. This is how she began to knit to sell by request. She knits 4 ponchos per week.

She has been with Finca Perú for 4 years and she learned a lot with the trainings that she has received. Now she knows how to make earnings because before, she was mixing it. She learned to sell a product when faced with competition.

Julia needs a loan of 3000 PEN to fix a part of her house. She is going to put up a railing to increase security so that she can rent it.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair part of her house

loans.name: Zaki Zakheri Group

texts.en: Zaki Zakheri is the group leader of Zaki Zakheri group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for progress their business and make it larger. So they are requested a group of loan 56000 Afghani. Zaki wants to take a loan for her husband who has gas selling shop. Zakheri wants to take a loan for the business of fruits selling shop. Farzhan wants to take a loan for the business of car part shop. Haji M. wants to take a loan for the business of general store. They admire this process of loan in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For progress business

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza W. is from the village of Tuod, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 20 years old. Riza is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Riza owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas in the local market and to community members as well. Riza has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In September 2009, Riza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Riza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Riza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Yi S., 27, is married with a school-aged child. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband (pictured) and child. To make a living, she and her husband are engaged in a business of buying cows from the local farmers in the province and selling beef at a local market in the town, earning collectively an income of US$15 per day. This primary source of income helps cover the family expenses and support the child’s studies.

This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Sareth and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, Sareth is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more cows to expand her current business.

loans.use: buy more cows

loans.name: Zenia

texts.en:
Zenia is known as “Zeny” in their village in Paitan, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Lejao and they are blessed with two children. Despite their economic status, they have a strong faith and determination to give their children a better future by sending them to school. 

In this regard, she and her husband are striving hard to earn a living and to support their educational needs.  Farming is the main source of living. They cultivate their farm by planting rice and vegetables. Furthermore, Zeny sells vegetables in Bayombong Public Market to earn additional income since the income from their farm is seasonal.  As a result of her sacrifices, she can earn a net income of PHP5,000.00 a month, which they use to acquire their needs and finance the schooling of their children. With her interest to earn more, she wants to borrow additional capital from KIVA lenders of PHP5,000.00 to be used to buy more vegetables for her to sell.  She expects that with this financial assistance, she can able to improve her business and have an increase in income.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Ham

texts.en:
Ham S., 43, has run a taxi service in his community for a long time. He earns $4 a day with his taxi. Before starting his work, he also goes to buy fish for his wife to sell at the market. Ham is a good father who cares for his six dependent children.

Ham S. wishes to apply for a loan to use as additional capital to buy more fish for his wife to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fish for his wife to sell at market.

loans.name: Moises

texts.en:
Moises M. is from the village of Pines. He is 61 years old, is married, and has one infant child.

Moises owns and operates a photo-lamination business, providing photo-lamination services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Moises joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. 

Moises is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata M. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PROMOTION DE LA FEMME depuis deux ans et y a reçu 4 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés. Elle développe une activité de vente de bétail, elle achète ses sujets, les engraisse et les revend au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Aminata M. is a 29-year old woman who is married and has seven children. She has been a member of the "Promotion de la Femme" (Promotion of the Woman) village bank for two years and has received four loans from the bank which she has managed well. She is building up a livestock business; she buys her animals, fattens them up and sells them on after four to five months. She assumes a share of the family's responsibilities.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build up her livestock selling business

loans.name: César De Jesus

texts.es:
Cuando alguien visita la tienda de Cesar Vásquez, no deja de pensar en Antioquia,  Departamento ubicado al Noroccidente de Colombia  que enmarcado por el aislamiento producido por la cordillera Central, hizo que sus habitantes se vieron forzados a trabajar fuertemente para valerse por sí mismos,  razon por la cual el paisa (como llamamos a los colombianos procedentes de los departamentos de Antioquia, Risaralda, Caldas, Quindío, el norte del Valle del Cauca y el noroeste del Tolima) tuvo que buscar su propio alimento en otras tierras  para lograr su sustento con una labor extenuante, que lleva a donde va un pedazo de su tierra en el Corazón; De esta manera, las carreras de caballo, corrida de toros, bailes, danzas, juego de sortija, de dados, de naipes, de ruleta y de bisbís, maroma, riña de gallos, fuegos artificiales y toda clase de diversiones, también han caminado con el paisa donde este se ubica ". Para la muestra, Tormenta, la tienda de César y su esposa, es un sitio donde un paisa encuentra su escencia, pues está ubicada al lado de un club de socios de caballo que con sus familias componen gran parte de su clientela, allí se divierten y consumen alimentos, refrescos y otros productos que puede encontrar a cualquier hora del día y de la noche. En la tienda Tormenta, nombre en honor  a un caballo muy especial,  observa colgadas en las paredes, hermosas  fotografías de estos especimenes  que deleitan la vista de los aficionados y hacen de este lugar el perfecto para  compartir intereses paisas comunes y donde se integran también gran parte de los vecinos soledeños (de Soledad Atlántico) y otros que vienen desde Barranquilla.

Como una persona "echada para adelante" y con amplia capacidad de riesgo, se describe a si mismo César Vásquez, jefe de familia de 30 años y propietario de esta tienda- estadero del barrio Centenario en el municipio de Soledad, donde trabaja hombro a hombro al lado de su esposa,  ambos de origen antioqueño de Granada y de Cáceres respectivamente; tienen dos  hijos de 13 y 4 años, que son el motor que los impulsa  a trabajar continuamente para verlos convertir en profesionales y para que cuenten con todas las herramientas para enfrentar la vida de manera independiente, persistir  y progresar , venciendo los obstáculos que se le presenten.

Cesar lleva grabada la imagen de su padre también paisa, como un excelente trabajador y hombre sabio que sacaba cuentas como un experto; aunque este  siempre impulsó a Cesar al estudio, este último se inclinó desde muy joven por el trabajo,  por eso empezó con su padre su primera labor en  el campo, donde desarrolló la gran capacidad que hoy posee; de él aprendió el manejo de cuentas y ahora lo hace con una habilidad natural, que todos los días potencia con su negocio.

Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; cuando empezó con esta organización solo tenía un estadero, con este crédito compró estanterías y mercancía. Su éxito radica en que la gente de los barrios más pobres compra mas en tienda que en supermercado, a él le gusta la ubicación de su negocio porque obtiene más utilidades. Cesar está solicitando un crédito de $2.000.000 y lo invertirá para ampliar el surtido de abarrotes en su negocio, por ejemplo los fríjoles, papas, granos, arroz y lentejas.

Más allá, su sueño es montar un supermercado como las grandes cadenas y aspira que Dios le dé la oportunidad mediante su trabajo. Usa las utilidades generadas por su negocio para cubrir los gastos de la seguridad  social de él y su familia y para sostener a su familia dignamente. Cesar y su esposa saben que sus esfuerzos no son en vano, porque con su trabajo honrado están construyendo un mejor vivir para el futuro de ellos y de sus hijos.
texts.en:
When visiting the shop of Cesar Vásquez, one does not think of Antioquia, the district located in northwest Colombia that is isolated by the Cordillera Central (one of three main branches of the Andean mountain range). The inhabitants of this area were forced to work hard to fend for themselves. Anyone living in “El Paisa” (which refers to the districts of Antioquia, Risaralda, Caldas, and Quindío located north of Cauca Valley and northwest of Tolima) had to find their own food from other parts of the country in order to survive. Their own culture developed as a result of their drive, perseverance, and backbreaking work before finally settling in an area in the heart of the country. When walking through the region of “El Paisa”, one can see the forms of entertainment that resulted such as horse races, bull fights, dances, ring games, cards, dice, roulette, tightrope walking, cock fights, and fireworks. For example, Tormenta, the name of the store owned by Cesar and his wife, is situated in an area of “El Paisa” where the region finds its identity. The store is located next to a horse riding club where the members and their families come to Cesar’s establishment to have fun and buy food, refreshments, and other products any time of day or night. Tormenta was named after a very special horse. Photographs of this beautiful specimen decorate the walls to the delight of its admirers, which makes Cesar’s store a perfect communal gathering place and an ideal place to visit for those coming from the neighboring region of Soledad Atlántico or from Barranquilla. Cesar Vásquez describes himself as a person prone to succeed and willing to take risks. He is a 30 year old head of household and proprietor of his own store, located in the neighborhood of Centenario in the city of Soledad. He and his wife work together, hand in hand. Both of them are natives of Granada and Cáceres respectively. They have two children, ages 13 and 4, who are the driving force for them to become working professionals and have all the necessary tools to live independently, be persistent, progress in life, and overcome any obstacles. Cesar is a striking image of his father who, like any Paisan, was an excellent worker who made good use of his expertise. He drove Cesar to study. In return, Cesar was inclined to work hard from a young age. He started working with his father in the fields, where he developed many of the skills he uses today. Cesar manages his business every day with what appears to be almost a natural ability. Cesar is receiving his second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. When he started with the organization, it only had one location. With this loan, he plans to purchase shelving and merchandise. His success is attributed to serving the people from the poorest neighborhoods, who shop more at his store than at a supermarket. He likes the location of his business because of its many advantages. Cesar will use his loan of 2,000,000 COP to increase his inventory of groceries such as beans, potatoes, grain, rice, and lentils. Beyond that, his dream is to establish a large supermarket chain and aspires that God will give him such an opportunity in his work. With the profits from his business, he is able to cover his expenses and pay for Social Security for himself and his family so that they can continue to have a decent lifestyle. Cesar and his wife know that their efforts are not in vain because their honest labor will build a better life and future for themselves and their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & shelving

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 37 year old married man and father of 2 young children. Since 2005, he has owned an orange trolley which he uses to travel around his town and its surroundings. He offers all types of orange juice. Today, Ghassan is requesting $1,000 to buy a large number of oranges at a good price in order to expand his business productivity.

loans.use: To buy a large number of oranges.

loans.name: Tharch

texts.en: Tharch S., 31, is married and lives with her children in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She sells groceries and traditional baskets, earning an income of US$7.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and is able to earn an income of US$7.60 per day. S. is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase more baskets for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more baskets for resale

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu A. is from the village of Lagunde, Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old and is married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Marichu owns and operates a specialized retail business selling fish ball, tempura and other street foods in the local community. Marichu has been doing this for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marichu joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marichu from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase additional products for selling foods

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy tiene 26 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus suegros a su esposa Lourdes de 27 años y lo que más desea es brindarle una mejor vida a su hija Kety de 5 años.

Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, trabaja en su chacra, sabe que tiene que poner todo su esfuerzo en hacer más fértil sus tierras para obtener una buena cosecha. Todos sus productos los vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde tiene muchos compradores debido a la buena calidad de sus cultivos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que siempre corre el peligro de que los químicos le causen alguna enfermedad. Con el tiempo, desea alquilar nuevas tierras para aumentar su producción.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Percy con MFP, en sus primeros pagos fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también, es de los pocos varones de su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus chacras estén muy productivas para la temporada de siembra que se acerca.
texts.en:
Percy is 26 years old. He is a very happy and hard-working family man. He lives in the house his in-laws left his 27 year old wife, Lourdes. What he wants most of all is to give his 5 year old daughter, Kety, a better life. He starts working his farm very early every morning. He knows that he has to put forth all of his effort to make his land more fertile in order to get a better harvest. He sells all of his products in the wholesale market in the city. He has a lot of buyers due to the good quality of his crops. What he likes best about his work is planting his land. He does it with a lot of patience. He has been doing this for 16 years. The most difficult part is fumigating his land. He always runs the risk that the chemicals will cause some time of disease. In time, he wants to rent new land to increase his production. This is Percy’s fourth loan with MFP. He was very punctual with his previous payments, and he expects to be able to do the same now. He is one of a few men in his communal bank. Therefore, he is held in high regard by the rest of his colleagues. He will use the requested 3,000 PEN to buy more natural and chemical fertilizers for his land. He wants his fields to be very productive in the planting season that is coming.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito D. Urcos, en la provincia D. Quispicanchis y departamento D. Cusco; situado a 1 hora desD. la ciudad D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 52 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 9 hijos, la socia vive actualmente con sus 2  hijos, Nuestra socia se dedica al cultivo D. papa, y también cría gallinas y cuyes, nuestra socia cría estas aves D. corral y cuyes para incrementar su producción, luego la socia los venD. y algunas veces le sirve D. para elaborar comidas para la venta en su negocio.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “LAS AMISTOSAS” (The Friendly Ones) communal bank; she is from Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department, which is an hour away from the city of Cusco. She is 52 years old, widowed and has 9 children; she currently lives with two of her children. She is a potato farmer but also raises chickens and guinea pigs to increase her production; she sells them sometimes and other times she uses them as ingredients for the meals she sells. Juana is grateful for and values the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is married to a security officer. They have four children and all her children go to school. Sophia owns a restaurant in Makerere Kikoni near Nana Girls hostel. She wants to use this loan of 500,000 UGX partly to buy more foodstuffs like bananas, rice, Irish potatoes, cassava, yams, and beef plus groundnuts, beans and fish and partly to invest in second hand clothes. She wants to do both businesses concurrently. Sophia rents the business premises and mainly sells at retail only. She sells to all categories of people though her clients are mainly students from nearby hostels. Sophia works seven days a week. Business challenges include seasonality and thieves who usually break into her restaurant. She aspires to expand her business by employing three people and to build her own house. Sophia decided to work with MCDT because they were giving out timely loans. She rents her residence and has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and second hand clothes

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
33-year-old Mercy C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Mercy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Mercy from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine G., from the village of Malasin, is 44 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 14000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 12000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. Josephine plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok N. is villager in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province and she is 53 years old. She has three children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is employed in a private company, and the other attends local public school

Mrs. Sok N. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Rum Yorn, is a fisherman who can earn some money from selling fish.

They try to work hard but they earn little income. So, to improve her family’s living conditions Mrs. Sok N. is asking for a loan to buy agricultural machinery. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma J. is from the village of Gubaan in Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Erma operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as biscuits, candies, sugar, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Erma has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Erma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Erma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: trousers, blouses and sandals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa D. is a 55-year-old widow who lives with her two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her two daughters live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest daughter is a teacher while the youngest one is a student. 

Tsetsegmaa operates a clothing business specializing in hats retailing from a rented stall at the local market. She started her business in 2001 and since then has found success in her trade and has used her earnings to support her family and pay her daughter's tuition fees.  In the future, Tsetsegmaa hopes to continue her success and grow her business. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Pravin

texts.en: Pravin is 27 years old and married.  For two years, he has been running a retail shop.  He sells sugar, rice, maize flour, soap and tea leaves in his shop.  He also sells water to earn extra income.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.  He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to increase his stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap and tea leaves.

loans.use: To increase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, soap and tea leaves

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia D. is from the village of Bagacay, Sibutad. She is 47 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Delia plants assorted crops to sell. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Delia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Delia from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. +

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Aiymnisa's Group

texts.en: Aiymnisa M. is the leader of the group. She is 44 and married. Her husband is temporarily unemployed. The couple has four children: The eldest daughter is married; one of the sons works in the capital at a building site; and the rest are still school pupils. Eleven years ago, before marriage, Aiymnisa’s husband used to run his own business. He bred cattle and cultivated corn. By now, the family is preparing for crop cutting (they have planted corn on an area of 0.4 hectares) and they have sent the cattle to grazing land for some period. Soon they'll be back. Out of business profits, they have managed to make house repairs. The family is planning to purchase a horse (25000 soms) and for this purpose, they hope to get a loan. In the future, Aiymnisa wants to arrange her son’s wedding and to build a small house on the grazing land. Saitmurat T., 57, is married. Together with his wife, who keeps house, he has two daughters. Two years ago, he started to run his own business: cultivating plants on his own allotment. By now, the main source of income comes from selling corn, potatoes, carrots and onions. Out of the profits, he has managed to purchase two goats, three sheep and one calf. The loan purpose is to buy 5 tons of onions (5 soms for 1 kg). In the future, Saitmurat is planning to obtain a flat in the center of the city and also to build a shop in the village. Baargul M., 36, is married. She has two children and both of them are school pupils. The family business consists of cattle breeding (now two cows are fattening). Besides that, the head of the family earns additional income by working in the local factory. Their total earnings made it possible to change their house's roof and to purchase two bulls. In order to increase cattle stock, the family is planning to buy a cow. For this purpose, they need to get a loan. In the future, Baargul wants to give a proper education to her children and to develop her family’s business. Halinisa M., 40, is married. Her spouse temporarily works in Russia. She brings up four sons; the eldest is also in Russia, while the rest, except for the youngest one, are schoolboys. The family make its bread by selling vegetables: peppers, tomatoes, garlic, onions and potatoes. Out of the business profits, they have managed to install gates. In order to enlarge their budget, Halinisa wants to purchase four sheep for fattening and breeding. For this purpose, she hopes to get a loan. In the nearer future, she is planning to increase commodity circulation, to develop the business and to give a university education to her children. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a horse

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, age 37, is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. He has been farming for 17 years and employs two farmhands. His farm produces vegetables, maize, and milk, all of which he sells locally. He is mainly a horticultural farmer and depends on the income from his horticultural farm to cater to the basic needs of his family. His biggest challenges have been fluctuations in the market as well as diseases which are too costly to treat.

Patrick recently repaid his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 91,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow and expand his poultry project. The increased income from the sale of milk and eggs will enable him to provide for the needs of his family and pay school fees for his children. In future, he would like to acquire a high-quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production because milk prices are now favorable for farmers.

Patrick and his wife have five children between the ages of 2 and 14. The four older children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and expand his poultry project

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
The young woman in the photograph is Mrs. Phat T., age 27, who lives in the province of Siem Reap, which is the best territory for tourists.  Mrs. Phat T. is a married woman who is devoted to her two young children, one of whom is enrolled in school and the other one is depending on her care.

Mrs. Phat T. and her husband are rattan cupboard sellers and they have been operating their business for a few years in front of their house. This couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and then takes it to retail in their community and other provinces.  Mrs. Phat T. is now running her business very well because she sells her items at a reasonable price.

In order to better satisfy the needs of the customers, Mrs. Phat T. seeks a loan to buy a larger amount of rattan cupboards to sell. She proposes to use the remainder of loan to purchase a trailer for the transportation of her product.

loans.use: To buy a larger amount of rattan cupboards to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita F. is from the town of Surallah. She is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. Her eldest child is 16 while the youngest is only 2. Anita owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Anita works hard for her children's future.

Anita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca tiene la edad de 46 años, es una madre muy dedicada a su familia como a su trabajo. Casada, siendo su esposo capitán.
Hoy en día trabaja en una empresa privada en el área de contabilidad, en donde lleva varios años laborando, en donde cuida su trabajo ya que hay muchas personas hoy en día que no cuentan con esta bendición.
Atreves de este financiamiento hará posible la construcción de un muro, logrando reguardar mas su vivienda. Comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar.
Contenta ya que esta mejora la está logrando por medio de los financiamientos que es de gran beneficio a los sectores de pocos recursos, el cual estos se pagan a través de plazos.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 46, is a mother who is very dedicated to both her family and her work. She is married and her husband is a captain. Today Blanca works for a private company in the accounting department. She has been working for several years and takes great care in her job since many people today are not as fortunate.

This loan will be used for the construction of a wall that will provide additional protection for her home. Blanca will purchase building materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron needed to begin the work. She is pleased that this improvement is possible with the help of loans, which are a great benefit in low-income areas and can be repaid in installments.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Saida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Saida; ella tiene 19 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia es ama de casa se dedica al cuidado de su bebe siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento, la socia tiene muchas ganas de estudiar una carrera profesional solo espera que su hijo sea más grande para poder empezar a estudiar.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche entre otras cosas mas y tambien para prestar a su hermano que necesita.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This woman is a member of the "Siempre Adelante" ("Always Moving Forward") communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district in Cusco province, department of Cusco.

The name of this bank member is Saida. She is 19 years old, lives with her partner, and has one son. She is a housewife who stays home to take care of her baby. While this is her only occupation right now, she would love to study for a professional career. She is waiting for her son to get a bit older so that she can begin her studies.

This bank member has requested the loan in order to buy basic food products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among other things. She will also use the loan to lend her brother the money that he needs.

This bank member is happy about this loan and has committed herself to paying it back.

loans.use: This bank member has requested the loan in order to buy basic food products such as rice, sugar, and milk, among other things. She will also use the loan to lend her brother the money that he needs.

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Mr. Ty P. (pictured) and his wife, Mrs. Ny Son, live in a small village in the suburbs of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  They have been married since 2001 and Ny just got pregnant.  

Mr. Ty P. is a motor taxi driver and assists his wife in their joint business when he is free.  The couple has supplemented their income with a new business of raising chickens. They are now requesting another loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase additional chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. José es nacido en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la sierra el 21 de mayo el Sr. José se dedica al  Transporte y Venta de Material De Construcción tiene como responsabilidad llevar adelante su hogar ya que es el único que mantiene a su familia, su conyugue es la señora Ivana se dedica a labores de casa y al cuidado de su hijo de 1 año y 3 meses su nombres, el señor José Antonio lleva trabajando en este rubro de lo que es la venta de material de construcción hace  4 años. Solicito el crédito en Emprender lo cual se la esta brindando tiene como destino comprarse un juego de llantas para su camión ya que con este transporta el material de construcción vende ya que entrega en la obra, es una persona joven y trabajadora que esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. José was born in the city of Santa Cruz in the mountain range on May 21st. José transports and sells construction materials. He maintains his family since it is his responsibility.  His wife, Mrs. Ivana, is a housewife and takes care of their one year and three month old son. José Antonio has been selling construction material for 4 years. He requested the loan from Emprender who offered it. He has planned to buy a set of wheels for his truck since he uses it to transport the materials he sells. He is a young and hardworking person who is thankful for the institution's help.

loans.use: To buy a set of wheels.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is 45 years old and comes from Arifwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its dairy industry.  She lives there in the area of Muzafarabad in a 3-room brick house with her family. She came here 24 years ago. 

She is involved in selling clothing. She purchases clothes from the city of Lahore and sells to her community clients on order. She offers her clients a good variety of clothes at their doorsteps and makes good sales every month. Her husband’s name is M. M. and he sells used clothes in the bazaar. A person who can’t afford to buy new and costly clothes prefers shopping with him. 

Rani is the mother of three sons and two daughters. Her daughters work in private organizations while one of her son is enrolled in a local school and getting his education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who will utilize the loan money in buying used clothes in bulk. This will help him offer more variety to his clients and make more sales. 

He has been operating his business for the past 21 years and Rani is hopeful that after the loan investment, his business will start bringing him better profit. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Jecebel

texts.en:
Jecebel A. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 37 years old. Jecebel is married and has seven children. To make a living, Jecebel plants and harvests rice for sale. Jecebel also runs a sari-sari store where she sells various products. Jecebel works hard to provide her family's needs.

Jecebel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jecebel has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jecebel is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Cholpon's Group

texts.en:
The most absorbing part of the “woman’s question” in the present time is the remedy for the varied sufferings of women who are without means of support. As yet, few are aware of how many sources of enterprise and industry lie open to women in areas directly connected with the family estate. 

Cholpon S., 37, is the leader of this group. She, like many other women in the country, was sure that there were very few employment opportunities for an uneducated women like her. The loan from Kiva helped her understand that she can invest needed funds in cattle breeding and qualify herself to superintend a dairy farm. Cholpon has small assets of cattle, but believes she is well trained for this business. She believes that the capital provided by Kiva lenders will be an investment that will become profitable with good management. She purchased some cattle two years ago for 3,000 soms because she knew it is the closest of all within reach for a woman with the proper abilities and training. She is also very interested in studying the care of domestic animals. She learned that cattle require great care especially when young, good food, warm and dry quarters, particularly in harsh wet winters. Cholpon is the mother of four children and satisfies their basic needs. Cholpon gathered and leads this group of like-minded fellows in order to request the loan for purchasing additional heads of livestock. 

       --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to grow her business

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es: La señora P. A. Islaida tiene 29 años D. edad es casada y tiene un hijo, vive en  Villa Juanita en Comas-Lima –PERU  ella se dedica a la venta D. anticuchos  afuera D. su casa, empezó el negocio porque deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos D. la casa pero a la vez sin tener que dejar a su  pequeño hijo con otra persona  en casa. No fue tan difícil empezar con el negocio pues una vecina que vendía  en su barrio se trasladaba a otra zona y le dejo el negocio a  la señora Islaida. DesD. entonces y por casi ya más D. un año sale todos los fines D. semana a vender sus anticuchos.  Su deseo es poder comprar un carro y ponerlo a trabajar  para que haya un mayor ingreso en el hogar.
texts.en:
P. A. Islaida is 29, married, and has one child.  She lives in Villa Juanita en Comas-Lima –PERU.  She sells kebobs outsiD. of her house.  She started this business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses.  At the same time, she did not want to leave her small child with someone else at home.

It was not so difficult to start the business.  A neighbor who sold in her neighborhood moved to another area, and she left the business to Islaido.  From then on, and for almost more than one year, she leaves every week-end to sell her kebobs.  Her wish is to be able to buy a cart and put it to work in order to have greater income at home.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her kebob sales

loans.name: Gina Lucia

texts.es:
Gina de 40 años es una mujer trabajadora que empezó su  negocio de cyber por medio su hijo que él está estudiando informática y un día ella del compro una computadora a su hijo y le instalo internet  y por medio de él le alquilaba  a sus vecinos ya que por su sector no había ese tipo de negocio.

Ella labora desde las 7:30 am a 10:00 pm en su cyber. Lo que le afecta en su trabajo es la delincuencia por el sector. Su esposo trabaja como guardián de seguridad en una empresa tiene tres hijo cada uno estudian. Con el préstamo quiere mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda para poder tener seguridad. En un futuro arreglar su casa de cemento y tener más computadora para que su negocio crezca e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gina, 40, is a hard working woman who started an Internet Access business through her son who is studying Information Technology.  She bought him a computer one day and he installed Internet and then they rented out the service to their neighbors because there was no business of this kind in their area.

She works from 7:30am until 10pm in her business.  What affects her work is the delinquency that’s common in her sector.  Her husband works as a Security Guard in a firm and she has three children who are all studying.

She wants to use the loan to improve the infrastructure of her house to have better security.  In the future she’d like to fix her cement house and have more computers so that the business will grow and profits will rise.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Merlinda B. is 35 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She lives with her husband in the Barangay (village) of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Merlinda operates a mini-boutique with goods from Zamboanga City as her main products. Together with her husband, she opened up a stall in one of the malls of the city. She has been in this kind of business for the past four years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. 

Merlinda joined PMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. Merlinda is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to be buy more clothes for her mini-boutique business. 

Merlinda plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family and better meet their basic needs. She also would like to save for the future and pay for her child’s education as well as repay loans, purchase insurance and, possibly, expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Delia Ochagabia is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old and still single. She is a dealer of Avon products like perfume, lotion, beauty products and other cosmetics supplies. She sells to her neighbors and friends. She has been engaged in this business for

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her mini-boutique

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach P. (pictured here) sells jackfruits. Her husband, Mr. Boran Kheav, is a motor taxi driver. She has asked for a Kiva loan two times already. She now hopes to continue expanding her business. So, she is requesting another loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase more jackfruits for resale. 
The couple lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. They have four children: two sons and two daughters.

loans.use: To purchase more jackfruits for resale.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 51 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa  en el distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. En una comunidad que tiene muchos deseos de superación.

Jorge se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino que luego comercializa en el mercado local. Además,  trabaja como obrero en una  empresa de su localidad.
