Su esposa se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral  y lo apoya en las actividades que realiza. Existe una buena relación familiar. 

El esfuerzo de Jorge y su esposa ha logrado que vayan obteniendo algunas comodidades y es por eso que Jorge desea seguir produciendo para mejorar  totalmente su calidad de vida.

Jorge solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en el alimento balanceado de sus ovinos, esto le permitirá tener mejores crías que podrá vender  a mejores precios en el mercado.
texts.en:
Jorge is 51 years old and lives in his own home, together with his wife, in Tambogrande district - Piura.  This is a community that is keen to develop.

Jorge raises sheep which he then sells in the local market.  He also works as a manual worker for a company in his town.

Jorge's wife raises poultry and supports him in his business activities.  They have a good family relationship.

Jorge and his wife's efforts have enabled them to obtain some comforts in life and, for this reason, Jorge would like to continue working so that he can totally improve his quality of life.

Jorge is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will invest in balanced feed for his sheep.  This will mean that they will have better litters which he will then be able to sell for better prices in the market.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for sheep

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 21 años, es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro, con el único fin de mejorar su calidad de vida. Manejando su motocarro Jorge obtiene el dinero necesario para solventar sus gastos, sabe que depende mucho de este trabajo y es por eso que se esfuerza mucho en realizarlo lo mejor que puede. Es una persona muy alegre y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios, lo cual ha hecho que las personas que lo conocen prefieran subir a su motocarro que al de la competencia. Tiene 2 años ejerciendo esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros, ya que así hace más amenos sus largos viajes, sin embargo el trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche es muy riesgoso. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más motocarros, ya que sueña con tener una empresa de transporte, por ello pide la colaboración de todos ustedes para que cumpla con ese sueño. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere crearle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual participa activamente y es un socio muy querido. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará un nuevo motocarro.
texts.en: Jorge is 21 years old; he is a nice and hardworking young man. He lives in his own home and is willing to work very hard with the sole purpose of improving his quality of life. Driving his three-wheeler taxi he gets enough money to meet his expenses and knows that he depends a lot on this job and that is why he works very hard to do it the best way he can. Jorge is a very happy person and always greets his customers with a smile; this has made people who know him to prefer his services rather than the competition. He was worked in this field for 2 years and what he enjoys most is talking to his passengers since that makes his travel shorter but working late at night is very dangerous. With time, Jorge hopes to buy more three-wheelers since he dreams of having a transportation company which is why he is asking for your support to be able to see his dreams come to fruition. This is Jorge’s third loan with MFP; he has always been punctual with his payments since he doesn’t want to create any problems to his communal bank where he is an active and well-liked member. With the fifteen hundred nuevos soles he will buy a new three-wheeler.

loans.use: buy a new three-wheeler.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 37 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Jocelyn works as a fishe woman and she catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years with the monthly income of 2,800.00. Jocelyn wanted to have additional income to support her family needs and her children's education. But her wooden fishing boat is very old and it's been damaged. She needs to replace it with another brand new fishing boat. So Jocelyn requested a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to purchase a brand new fishing boat.

Jocelyn has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In  the future, Jocelyn prays that someday she will have 5 to 10 fishing boats to continue and improve their living and for the education of her children.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase a brand new fishing boat.

loans.name: Jemah

texts.en:
Jemah is 49 years old and lives in the West Point area.  She’s married and her husband is a teacher.  They have 4 children between 18 and 35 years old, all of whom live at home. For the past 10 years she has been preparing and selling cooked food.  She started the business with help from her daughter.
Her main challenge is earning enough in the school holidays when her husband does not get paid. What she likes about this business is selling to customers. Jemah has requested this loan. In the future she would like to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también el socio trabaja en el área de seguridad en la región D. cusco y el negocio de tienda de abarrotes trabaja su esposa y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y también quiere mejorar en su trabajo .El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz,azúcar,aceite,fideos y golosinas para la tienda de abarrotes.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Nueva Generación III” (New Generation III) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.  

This member is 33 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  The member divides his time between his daily activities and managing his grocery store business.  He also works in security for the Cusco region, so his wife helps with attending to their grocery business.  Together they are able to help their children get ahead.  The member wants to expand and improve his grocery business, as well as improve in his job.  He is requesting a loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and candy for his grocery store.  

The member is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and candy.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Soeurm is a fish seller in a market near her village, earning about $3 per day, while her husband catches fish from ponds, lakes and rivers. Soeurm is a mother of five, one of whom works in local construction, earning a good monthly salary. Now requesting a loan of $300, Soeurn wishes to purchase fishing materials.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 35 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Gulu region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. Two of his children are currently in school.  

Francis has a business of selling produce, like maize flour. He has run this business for five years. He does farming as his second business.  

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase produce like maize for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Francis hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  

In the future, Francis hopes to expand his business. Francis is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program (SEP), which has helped his prospects for the future by providing a loan that has helped him improve his capital.

loans.use: to purchase produce like maize for resale.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila, 54 years old, is married and has 9 children. She lives in San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Leonila has a sari-sari (variety) store and sells snacks. She has had this business for 10 years, earning approximately PHP 2,000 monthly. Leonila has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more stock for her grocery store. Leonila has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

location.town: Liloy-San Isidro, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: El señor Néstor se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en taxi hace ya mas de diez años en la línea de radio taxi muy solicitado de la zona norte de la ciudad de Cochabamba, solicita el crédito debido  que sufrió un accidente tiene gastos fuertes en la reparación de su vehículo y se quedaron sin capital para la actividad del comercio que realiza su esposa , don Néstor esta casado con la señora María con quien tiene dos niños que se encuentran en edad escolar, el señor es conocedor de la actividad y asegura que cumplirá con sus respectivas cuotas, además que agradece por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Nestor has been transporting passengers by taxi for over ten years.  The radio taxi line has been in great demand in the northern city of Cochabamba.  

He is requesting the loan due to an accident that he suffered and he has expenditures for major repair for his vehicle.  They were left without capital for his wife's business.  Nestor is married to Maria and they have two children who are school age.  He is aware of the activity and ensures that he will meet his respective repayments.  In addition, he is thankful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and get working capital.

loans.name: Famines

texts.en:
Famines is 35 years old, a single lady  with four children aged 22, 20, 18 and 14. She operates a grocery and cereals store in Surungai trading center and has been in the business for a period of nine years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

This is her third loan and she will use the loan  to finance her business. She plans to purchase five bags of dry maize, one sack of rice, and two bags of dried beans.  The anticipated profits will be used to ploughed back into the business and educate her children.

She hopes to be a successful lady in her business.

loans.use: To purchase five bags of dry maize, one sack of rice, and two bags of dry beans.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman with five children, four of whom are in the school.

She has a business of selling clothes in Hai Gwafa Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes for sale. The extra income from this loan she will use for building a shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is a hardworking business woman aged 42. She is married and blessed with three children who are still in school. For the last two years, she has been selling soft drinks to earn a living. She has grown her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  Previously, she was running a green grocer. Her desire is to expand her business into wholesale in five years. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy juice and soda for resale.

loans.use: To buy juice and soda

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos y autopartes de carros, la socia también trabaja como contadora, por medio de este negocio y este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de autopartes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar autopartes y repuestos para carros al por mayor.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Señor de los Temblores-Poroy Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco.

This member is 32 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with a business selling auto parts, and she also works as an accountant.  Through this business and her work this member is able to get her children ahead.  She wants to expand and improve the auto parts business.  She is asking for this loan to buy auto parts in bulk.

This member is very happy thanks to the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy auto parts in bulk

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Fallou est créé le 27 août 2009, il est composé de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier, elles sont amies, parentes et sont en parfaite entente.


Madame Penda la responsable est âgée de 36 ans, c'est une femme divorcée mère d'un enfant; elle s'active dans le micro-jardinage et l'embouche; elle fait parallèlement du commerce de chaussures et perles.Elle est debout tout à fait à droite habillée en tee shirt et pagne jaune.


Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter du matériel agricole( des intrants entre autres.....) et des moutons pour l'embouche.


La scolarité de son fils et la santé de sa famille sont au centre de ses préoccupations, c'est pour cela qu'elle compte utiliser ses bénéfices pour eux.
texts.en:
Solidarity group Sop Serigne Fallou was created on August 27, 2009. It is composed of twelve women who reside in the same district. They are friends and relatives and they all get along perfectly.

The leader Mrs. Penda is 36 years old; she is divorced and a mother of one. She is active in micro-gardening and cattle fattening. In parallel, she also retails pearls and shoes. She is standing all the way to the right, dressed in a yellow tee-shirt and wrap.

With her loan, she would like to purchase farming material (among others, agricultural intrants) and sheep to fatten.

She is mostly preoccupied with her son going to school and with the health of her family; this is why she is planning on using her profit for them.

loans.use: to buy farming material and sheep.

loans.name: Amartuvshin

texts.en:
Amartuvshin is 23-years-old and lives alone in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He started his business in 2008 with his own car. 

He is an experienced young man who says"I love my job however due to my car condition, it is hard to maintain the car and my customers are not satisfied with my service."  

He has saving of 2,000,000 MNT however, it is not enough to renew his car. He is a sharp and hardworking young man who is requesting 1,500,000 to purchase a new car in order to run his business successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is a 40-year-old married woman with 9 children. Adelyn is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. 

Adelyn is operating a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. Adelyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and she earns 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Adelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Adelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Denis Evenor

texts.es:
El joven Denis tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el caserio asacualpa, Denis es un hombre muy trabajador y  dedicado a su negocio propio que es una pulperia, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, ahi vende todo tipo de productos de consumo diario, Denis se levanta a las 6 de la mañana todos los dias para atender  a sus clientes, Denis es padre de 1 hijo, el cual tiene un año de edad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio, en esta espoca es cuando mas vende y desea tener surtido su negocio, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de hogar.          
Su tiempos libres lo dedica para visitar la iglesia.
texts.en: Denis, 29, lives in the hamlet of Asacualpa.  He is a very hardworking man who is dedicated to his own business which is a grocery store.  His store is home-based; he sells all types of daily consumption items.  Denis rises at 6am every day to tend to his customers.  Denis is the father of a one-year-old son.  He will use the loan to buy stock merchandise for his store.  This is the season when he sells the most and he wants to have his store well-stocked.  He needs the profits to cover household expenses.  He uses his free time to go to church.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Adriana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Adriana, de 53 años de edad, es comerciante vende comida y frescos en Granada de donde es originaria, tiene 3 hijos de 20,18 y 13 años de edad respectivamente todos ellos están estudiando. Ella inicio con este negocio al dejar de trabajar como domestica  viendo que la situación estaba difícil para continuar buscando trabajo emprendió con su negocio de venta de comida con refrescos fue difícil al principio pero lo que la hace diferentes es que el sabor de su comida es casera y no comercial esto le ha permitido ganar clientela, salir adelante con su familia en donde su hija mayor le ayuda en sus ratos libres después de la escuela. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para compra de materia prima tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, repollo, tomate pues son parte de los ingredientes que utiliza para realizar sus platillos y refrescos. Uno de sus planes futuros es poner un kiosko donde pueda vender fijo ya que ella vende en su casa de habitación y sale a repartir su comida pero le gustaría expandirse un poco mas por medio del kiosko.
texts.en:
Adriana, 53, is a merchant selling food and refreshments in Granada which is where she’s from.  She has three children who are 20, 18 and 13 years old respectively and all are studying.

She started her business when she stopped working as a domestic employee and seeing that the situation was difficult regarding finding another job she started her business selling food and refreshments.  It was difficult at first but what differentiates her is that her food tastes home-made and not commercially produced and this has created a large clientele for her and has allowed her to get ahead with her family; her oldest daughter helps her in her free time from school.

She needs the loan to buy raw materials like rice, beans, sugar, milk, cabbage and tomatoes because they are part of the ingredients she uses for her dishes and her refreshments. 

One of her plans for the future is to set up a kiosk where she can sell in a fixed place since she currently sells form home and goes out to sell her food but she’d like to expand a little bit more with a kiosk.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her meal preparation.

loans.name: Marina Asuncion

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

La señora Marina  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos del grupo y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco  hijos de 21, 17, 15, 10 y 6 años de edad, los tres menores estudian uno en colegio y dos en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un bus de transporte.

Ella es artesana, se dedica a realizar eventos y  decoraciones para fiestas infantiles, bautizos, quinceañeras y todo compromiso social, todos  estos trabajos los elabora bajo pedidos de personas que solicitan de sus servicios. Además de esto en su casa tiene una pequeña heladería en la cual pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo ya que allí mismo elabora sus artesanías. Lleva más de 5 años que se dedica a esta labor y nunca le ha faltado trabajo. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar helados, y materiales para elaborar sus obras, como globos, cintas, serpentinas, etc.
 
Sus sueños son tener una gran heladería y un gran salón de eventos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mi Banquito' community bank meet in Los Bajos, in Montecristi.  This city is known for its wide variety of traditional products such as, for example, the Panama hat.  Its products are known both at home and abroad.

Marina is a founding member of the community bank.  She is the group's rule enforcer and she likes the bank because of the facilities they have for obtaining loans.  She is 36 years old, married, and has five children aged 21, 17, 15, 10 and 6.  Her three youngest are in school.  One is in high school and the other two are in elementary school.  Her husband works on a bus.

Marina is a craftswoman.  She organizes events and decorations for children's parties, christenings, fifteenth birthday celebrations and all social engagements.  She does these jobs to order for people who request her services. In addition, she has a small ice-cream parlor in her home where she spends most of her time as that is where she makes her handicrafts.  She has been in this business for more than five years and has never been short of work.

Marina will use this loan to buy ice cream and materials for making her works such as balloons, ribbons, streamers, etc.  Her dreams are to have a large ice-cream parlor and a large events hall.

loans.use: to buy ice cream, balloons, ribbons, streamers, etc.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis,46 años de edad habitante de la ciudad de Granada, es carpintero, tiene dos hijos de 16 y 15 años respectivamente, el es padre y madre para sus hijos ya que su esposa murió. 
Este oficio lo aprendió de su padre ya que trabajo con el a la edad de 8 años  quien era un artesano desde hace varios años viene trabajando con varios clientes de la ciudad de Granada, se dio a conocer por su experiencia y la calidad de producto que elaboraba en su propio taller . Su padre lo ponía a que lo ayudara en trabajos pequeños el fue adquiriendo experiencia y conociendo el negocio. Al morir su padre el se hizo cargo del negocio además de quedar con la recomendación de la calidad de trabajos para que seguir atendiendo a los clientes y hacer nuevos   para sacar adelante el negocio. El elabora puertas y ventanas de madera. 
El solicita el crédito para compra de madera para elaboración de puertas. El espera que con la ganancia que le quede después de cumplir con el pedido que tiene quiere pagara su crédito y pagar la universidad de su  hija para que se prepare y sea alguien en la vida. Uno de sus planes futuros es diversificar su negocio haciendo nuevos productos tales como estantes para almacenar platos y vasos de vidrios, gaveteros para cocinas.
texts.en:
Luis, age 46, is a resident of the city of Granada. He is a carpenter and has two children, ages 16 and 15 respectively. Luis must be both father and mother since his wife has already passed away.

He learned this trade from his father when he was eight years old. Luis has been a craftsman for many years and has worked for several clients in the city of Granada. He is known for his expertise and the quality of the products he makes in his own workshop. His father allowed him to help with small jobs until he gained the experience and knowledge to function in this type of business. After his father’s death, Luis took over the business and stayed true to the quality of work so that he can continue to serve his customers and attract new ones to help the business move forward. He makes doors and window frames out of wood.

Luis is requesting a loan to buy wood for making doors. He hopes that the profit he earns after completing this order will be sufficient to repay the loan and pay for his daughter’s university studies so that she can be prepared and make something out of her life. One of the future plans for his business is to diversify by making new products, such as shelves for storing dishes and glasses, and kitchen storage cabinets.

loans.use: to buy wood for making doors.

loans.name: Blanca Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Blanca es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive por la comunidad de Santa Ana en Cuenca, este  lugar es de clima frió, se encuentra rodeado de exuberante naturaleza, desde el centro de la parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es amable, gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.
 
La Señora. Blanca tiene 45 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 25, 23 y 21 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados, de los cuales uno vive independiente y la otra vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos de su hogar, su hijo soltero trabaja y ayuda económicamente. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Blanca labora prestando sus servicios como empleada domestica, esta actividad la desempeña hace 15 años y labora 2 veces a la semana. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cerdos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en alimento para los mismos.

Su meta es tener un criadero grande de animales.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the communal bank Unión Progresista. She lives in the community of Santa Ana in Cuenca. This place has a cold climate and is surrounded by abundant nature. From the center of the parish one can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca. The people are friendly, gentle, and keep the culture of their parents.

Blanca is 45 years old. She is a widow and through her marriage she has had three children who are 25, 23, and 21 years old. Her first two children are married, and one lives independently, and the other lives with her and shares the household expenses. Her single son works and helps financially. The house she lives in is her own property.

Blanca works as a domestic employee. She has been doing this work for 15 years and works two times a week. At home she works raising pigs. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for six years and her new loan is to invest in the purchase of pigs and animal feed for them.

Her goal is to have a pigsty for her animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and  animal feed for them

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives at Assakai. She is 32 years old and is a mother of two. She is currently expecting another child. She is married to a driver. Her husband supports her and her children. She usually goes to the city to buy some items and resell them in her store.

Judith is requesting a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as soaps, toiletries, rice, drinks etc. This loan will help her increase her income as well as expand her business.

loans.use: To buy soap, toiletries, rice, beans, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah started farming seven years ago on a small inherited piece of land in Omorembe, a remote village in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. Today, this mother of three children sells milk, eggs, vegetables, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and it protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions. 

Milkah believes that, through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Milkah patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Jeanine Aimée

texts.fr:
Jeanine a 44 ans, elle est mariée. Le mari travaille comme chauffeur.  Le nombre d’enfants est de quatre dont deux  suivent encore leurs études. Les deux autres sont en période de stage. C’est le fruit son activité qui lui a permis de prendre en charge les  dépenses liées à l’éducation de ses enfants. 
Actuellement, elle prévoit de préparer les papiers administratifs liés à l’acquisition d’un terrain avant de définir le projet à réaliser.
L’activité de Jeannine est la vente des ustensiles de cuisine. Cette activité exige la connaissance des besoins des clients.  Elle a déjà beaucoup d'années d’expérience dans cette activité.

loans.use: acheter des ustensiles de cuisine: cocottes minute, faitouts en série, hot-pot etc

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Mr. Daniel G. is a married father of five (5) children. His wife helps cover their numerous household expenses through the sale of fruit juices. Mr. G. is a woodworker by profession. He is in high demand by his clientele and offers a level of quality that enchants everyone. His dream now is to purchase high-quality wood in large quantities for building and selling furniture. He is asking for a loan of $700 which will allow him to change his financial situation and adequately meet his family's needs, particularly with regard to health, clothing, nourishment and education.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur G. Daniel est un homme marié et père de cinq (5) enfants. Sa femme contribue aux nombreuses charges du ménage à partir de la vente du jus de fruit. La profession de Monsieur G. est la menuiserie. Très sollicité par sa clientèle, il fait une prestation de qualité qui séduit tout le monde. Aujourd’hui son rêve est de payer du bois en qualité et en quantité très élevée afin de confectionner des meubles et les vendre. Il sollicite un crédit de $700 qui va lui permettre de changer sa situation économique et bien subvenir aux besoins de la famille notamment en matière de santé, habillement, nourriture et scolarité

loans.use: Purchase wood for the construction and sale of furniture

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is 45 years old and a single mother with 6 children. Without any formal education, she has been in fishmongering for over 10 years. As a single mother she has gone through a lot to educate some of her children through the basic level. She seeks to use the KIVA loan to procure a smoking oven made of wire net which can smoke 3 to 5 tiers of fish at a time. She hopes to increase her profit margin and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Nery Guadalupe

texts.en:
Nery is 19 years old, is married, and has one son. Her husband works in the fields cultivating corn, which is a typical activity for men in the area where they live. Nery sells fruit door-to-door to people in nearby communities, and sometimes in the city of San Cristobal. She is part of the “Mezte Group 4”, along with Manuela Vasquez Pérez, who embroiders cotton blouses, which she sells on the street in the nearest city. With the loan, both want to invest in their businesses. Nery would like to have a fruit stall next to the highway, where there is a lot of traffic, and in this way increase her income. Manuela wishes to buy thread and cloth to make the blouses, which she currently has to buy in order to embroider them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

NERY TIENE 19 AÑOS . CASADA CON UN HIJO. SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ ACTIVIDAD TIPICA DE LOS HOMBRES DE LA ZONA DONDE ELLA HABITA. NERY SALE A VENDER FRUTAS PUERTA A PUERTA ENTRE LAS PERSONAS DE LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS Y A VECES A LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL.FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO MEZTE 4 JUNTO CON MANUELA VASQUEZ PEREZ QUIEN TRABAJA BORDANDO BLUSAS DE MANTA LAS CUALES SALE A VENDER EN LAS CALLES DE LA CIUDAD MAS CERCANA. CON EL PRESTAMO LAS DOS QUIEREN INVERTIR EN SUS NEGOCIOS NERY DESEA PODER INSTALAR UN PUESTO DE FRUTAS EN LA CARRETERA DONDE CIRCULAN MUCHOS VEHICULOS Y ASI AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS , EN CAMBIO MANUELA DESEA INVERTIR EN HILOS Y MANTA PARA EMPEZAR A CONFECCIONAR TAMBIEN LAS BLUSAS QUE ELLA ACTUALMENTE DEBE COMPRAR PARA BORDAR.

loans.use: To set up a fruit stall; To buy thread and cloth for making blouses

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Born in 1946, S. Magdalene is a widow with six children.  She has suffered from ill health, particularly pain in her legs.  As a widow, she has a lot of difficulty providing for the basic needs of her children and buying medication for herself.  This motivated her to became a member of GHAPE in 1999.  She was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since 1999, she has been able to apply for and repay all her loans.  She used the money to pay for school and apprentice fees for her children and to buy food.

Given a loan of $1200, she plans to invest it in fattening and selling pigs, motorbike transportation and the cultivation of crops. Her profits will be used to increase the size of her business, repair her house and cater to her family's needs.  She plans to repay her loan in 24 months. Her first repayment installment will be made four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, pig feed, seeds, and a motor bike

loans.name: Gusbinda

texts.es:
Gusbinda is mother of two young children who are still in their early stages of childhood. She lives with her husband who is dedicated to providing classes in a center for primary education. Due to a lack of budget to cover personal expenses, it occurred to Gusbinda to provide her neighbors with portable water from installing networks of tubes outside of her house. Since the majority of the residences in her neighborhood lack this portable water, she decided to provide it. This activity has provided a significant income every month with which she can help her husband and improve the quality of life for her family. With the daily demand, she has plans to continue expanding her distribution network to provide faster and better service to each of her clients. She is seeking a $675 loan to purchase more tubes and will return the loan in 6 months. The loan will fulfill Gusbinda’s wishes so that more families can have access to this important and vital service.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.<.p> Gusbinda es madre de dos pequeños que aún se encuentran en etapa escolar, vive con su esposo que se dedica a brindar clases en un centro de educación primaria; por falta de presupuesto para cubrir los gastos familiares a la reina de la casa se le ocurrió proveer a sus vecinos de agua potable por medio de redes de tuberías que instaló en las afueras de su hogar; debido a que en el lugar de su residencia la mayoría de los moradores carecen de este liquido elemento.Esta actividad le viene generando importantes sumas de dinero mensualmente con el que apoya a su esposo e incrementa la calidad de vida de su familia.A raíz de la demanda diaria tiene planes de seguir ampliando su red de distribución con el propósito de otorgarles un rápido y mejor servicio a cada uno de sus clientes.Para este fin hace una solicitud de 675 dólares para comprar más tubos, así mismo el importe solicitado les será devuelto en 6 meses. Ayudemos a realizar el anhelo de Gusbinda para que más familias de su localidad puedan acceder a este importante y vital servicio

loans.use: To acquire tubes.

loans.name: Esmeralda Oriely

texts.es:
Esmeralda is a hard-working mother, working as a nurse every day in a hospital with the sole goal of supporting her two daughters. She also works selling beauty products for the international brand, Avon; visiting her clients in their homes, leaving them the products and charging them afterwards. She has already experienced how strong she can be, when her husband abandoned her 5 years ago, walking out on her and unburdening himself of the worry of the support of his daughters. This is why she now carries out the functions of both father and mother in their home. Her wish is to open a sales center of cosmetics in which she can use all of the experience she has aquired, in order to be able to completely support her daughters, whom she loves very much. For this reason, she is requesting a loan. Let's help with this noble goal.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Esmeralda, es una diligente madre, técnica en enfermería que a diario trabaja con el único fin de apoyar a sus dos hijas, también se dedica a comercializar algunos productos de belleza de la marca internacional, Avon, que expende visitando a sus clientas en sus domicilios, dejándoles los productos y cobrando posteriormente.Ella realiza su máximo esfuerzo ya que su esposo la abandonó hace cinco años, marchándose de casa y despreocupándose del mantenimiento de sus hijas, motivo por el que ella desempeña las funciones de padre y madre en su hogar.Su deseo es abrir un centro de ventas de cosméticos, en el cual pueda vertir toda la experiencia adquirida a fin de poder apoyar enteramente a sus hijas, a las que ama mucho y para ello desea un préstamo.Colaboremos con este noble propósito.

loans.use: To have an increase in captial to open a place to sell cosmetics.

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang C. L., 42, is a widow and lives only with her son in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.

She works selling vegetables at an open-air market, making around $5 per day of profit.

Her son is married and works as a carpenter making cabinets, tables, chairs and closets and sells them to wholesalers, earning around $100 per month in revenue.

Mrs. Eang C. L. hopes to use this loan to purchase more wood so her son can expand his business and increase the family's income. ( Mrs. Eang C. L. is pictured with her two grandchildren)

loans.use: To purchase more wood so her son can increase the family's income.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.en: Abdullo K. lives in Nau, Tajikistan. He is married and has 2 children.  Abdullo K. has been a client of the MicroInvest since 2004. He joined MicroInvest after hearing so many successful stories from friends who began their businesses with MicroInvest loans. He is engaged in the home business of raising and selling livestock. He has been in business for 5 years. He has a large flock and he dreams of purchasing one more pedigree bull. Mr. Abdullo K.  requests a loan of 4100 STJ for the pedigree bull purchase.

loans.use: For the purchase of a pedigree bull

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
Mrs. Françoise A. was born June 16, 1950 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a widow who takes care of four children, who all go to school. She is retired from her position at the Centre National Hospitalier et Universitaire Hubert Maga, the largest hospital in Benin. To keep up her previous standard of living, Mrs. Françoise A. began selling various foodstuffs, including bags of corn, beans and others. She is requesting her fourth loan to develop her business and meet her customers’ demand.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame Françoise A. est née le 16 juin 1950 à COTONOU, ville capitale économique du BENIN. Veuve elle a sa charge 4 enfants qui sont scolarisés. Elle est retraitée du Centre National Hospitalier et Universitaire Hubert MAGA, le plus grand centre hospitalier du BENIN. Pour être en harmonie avec son niveau de vie d’alors, dame Françoise A. s’est lancée dans la vente des produits vivriers divers et notamment des sacs de maïs, du haricots et autres. Elle sollicite ce quatrième crédit pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire la demande de la clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 bags of corn and various foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals and yams for resale.

loans.name: Gilda Maritza

texts.es:
Ms. C. sells general merchandise, including clothing, footwear, cosmetics and other items.  She has been working with the Fundación Leon 2000 institution for eight years.


Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora C. se deica a la venta de mercaderia en general vende ropa, calzado, cosmeticos y otros ella trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace ocho años.

loans.use: Clothing and Cosmetic Sales

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.en:
Arnaldo is 62 years old and married with 2 children and 7 grandchildren. He studied until 4th grade and then stopped due to his family’s difficult financial situation. Originally from the Inhambane province in Mozambique, he moved in 1973 to Boane, 30km away from the capital city Maputo, to look for work and stayed thereafter. During the Mozambican civil war, Arnaldo’s whole family moved from Inhambane to Maputo to stay with him, as it was safer to be closer to the capital. His oldest son also lives in Boane while the youngest lives in Namaacha, a village bordering Swaziland.

In 1985, Arnaldo built a barbershop while he soon expanded to incorporate a hair salon. The shop is strategically located in Boane’s central market street, in the corner with the road that connects to Maputo, so it has always benefited from a good number of walk-in clients. Arnaldo and 1 employee work at the barbershop and his daughter-in-law and another employee work at the hair salon. Arnaldo sees around 15 clients at the barbershop and 20 clients at the hair salon per week. A man’s haircut is MTn 15 (approximately US$0.61). Arnaldo goes to Maputo every week to buy all the products necessary for his business, using public transportation. Arnaldo makes around MTn 1,500 per week.

This will be Arnaldo’s second loan with Hluvuku. The first loan he used to buy products for his businesses and also buy a television and an iron. This time Arnaldo plans to use the MTn 18,000 loan to buy products for his business, such as shampoos, conditioners, sprays and so on, as well as replace some materials that have become worn with use, such as hairdryers and scissors.

In the future, Arnaldo would like to ask for a new loan to repair his house and the barbershop.

loans.use: Buy products for his barbershop-hair salon

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. C. Thi Nguyen is 47 years old and has 3 children, one of which is still in school. Before joining the Fund her family worked as manufacturing technicians, both she and her husband had strong professional experience. However, due to a lack of capital to buy raw materials for manufacturing, the family’s income was not very good. In 2006, she joined the Fund and borrowed 300,000 VND in the first round of funding. With this money, the family bought equipment and invested in the factory, resulting in an income of 3,000,000 VND per month. Besides the income from the factory, her two grown children also work and help their parents. Therefore, the family’s finances are improving day by day. In the coming round of funding, she is requesting 9,000,000 VND to invest in buying more iron and other raw materials for use in the manufacturing activities by the family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Cảnh năm nay 47 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 1 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương gia đình chị đã có nghề cơ khí, hai vợ chồng chị đều là những người thợ có tay nghề cao. Nhưng vì thiếu vốn để đầu tư mua nguyên liệu phục vụ sản xuất nên thu nhập cảu gia đình chị cũng không cao vì thế năm 2006 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ và vay vòng vốn đầu tiên là 3.000.000đ. Với mức vốn này, gia đình chị đã mua máy móc đầu tư vào xưởng sản xuất sẵn có cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài thu nhập từ xưởng cơ khí hai con của chị đã lớn đều có công ăn việc làm và có thu nhập để phụ giúp bố mẹ. Vì thế kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng đi lên. Vòng vốn tiếp theo chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm sắt và các nguyên vật liệu để phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất của gia đình

loans.use: Buy iron and other raw materials

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married. She is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye where she sells clothing in the busy Yubileinyi market. She has been in this business for 10 years. Currently, Oksana has about $2400. Her gross income is about $2400.

Oksana is requesting a 5000 Grivna loan to purchase seasonal clothing in bulk. She is achievement-oriented and has confidence in her abilities and powers. We believe these crucial characteristics that Oksana possesses will secure further growth of her trade and prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase sales stock

loans.name: Llane

texts.es:
Llane, is 37 years old and has 4 children who are studying and are her happiness. She lives with her husband Leopoldo, who works at a sawmill.
Llane provides very good attention to her clients on her small grocery store where she sells first necessity products, but she not just works on this, she also rents rooms and creates art on clothes, all this helps her very much on her daily expenses. She has been working at her grocery store for the past 4 years and works at it almost all day.
Llane wants to improve the environment of her business, extent it and stock it, later on fix some of the rooms she rents and provide better attention to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Llane, (37 años) tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando y son su mayor alegría. Ella vive con su esposo Leopoldo, quien trabaja como empleado en un aserradero. Dar una buena atención es la actividad diaria que tiene Llane, tiene una pequeña bodega de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, pero no solo se dedica a esto, sino también al alquiler de habitaciones y al arte textil, lo que le ayuda mucho en sus gastos diarios. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 4 años y atiende casi todo el día en su bodega. Llane tiene el deseo de mejorar los ambientes de su negocio, ampliarlo e implementarlo, posteriormente mandar a refaccionar algunos pormenores las habitaciones que alquila y desde luego brindar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.

loans.use: Extent and improve her grocery store / Ampliación y mejora del espacio de su bodega.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a daughter. She is an enterprising business owner who works in the sphere of clothing sales. Svetlana runs a small business selling men's and women's clothing items in one of the most popular markets in Novomoskovsk. She has been in this trade for 11 years. Her income amounts to $1600 a month. Some of the strong characteristics of her business are its stability and the quality of merchandise offered.

Svetlana wants to get a loan of 2500 Grivnas ($US550) to purchase a wide range of clothing items which will help her improve the quality of her inventory and get more customers. Svetlana is willing to take her business one step further. She is ready to face business risks because she has weighed all her decisions before committing to anything. Moreover, she is very devoted to the success of her business and has proven that she will be able to repay this loan without a problem.

Note: This is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
M. Dilorom is 44 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. 

Dilorom is a woman who likes to fight for her dreams. One of her dreams is to see her children go to college and have a better quality of life than she did. This is why Dilorom sells clothing. Little by little, she has assembled a clientele who seeks her out to buy clothing from her. 

However, Dilorom does not have enough merchandise for the cold season to offer to her customers, so she is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni ($1025 USD), which she is willing to pay in a period of 7 months. With this money, Dilorom will be able to buy clothing for the season to be able to offer it to her customers. With your help. she will be able to succeed with her children.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothing to sell

loans.name: Jamira

texts.en:
For the past two years, Jamira I. M. has been trading in the local market of Tema in Ghana. She is twenty seven years old, married and has a child who is currently in school. She is a food vendor who sells porridge and at the same time, is a busy petty trader who sells beans, groundnuts, millet, wheat, and soy beans. 

Jamira is convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital. She wants to use the loan to buy more of the products she trades and thus increase her inventory. She also hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her child's education. She belongs to the community group called Saamu *Receiving* Trust Group. In this group, members assist one another by providing support in handling their loan repayments. Her picture was taken when she was visited during her group meeting.

loans.use: Increase inventory of beans, groundnuts, millet etc.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A. is a 30-year-old married woman with one child, who is currently in school. For the past five years, she has been supporting her husband to pay for their child's education by operating a seamstress shop. She sews all types and styles of female clothes, including kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She trains 2 young ladies in sewing as future carrier.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more sewing materials such as linens, threads, and thimbles to enable her meet her customers demands. She hopes to increase her savings to continue to support her child in school. She is a member of a loan group known as the "Abrabopa" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She was in attendance during her group meeting when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To purchase additional sewing materials like linens, threads, thimbles, etc.)

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La señora Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” del distrito, provincia y departamento. Tiene 57 años de edad, es separada y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad. 
Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 compró mercadería para vender en su puesto de trabajo en el puerto. Tiene 18 ciclos trabajando con el banco comunal y nos cuenta que vive con su hija, su nieto y su yerno. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará panetones y demás mercadería para ser vendida en las fiestas de navidad.
Valentina desea continuar trabajando para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the community bank “Mujeres Unidas al Triunfo” in the district, province, and department. She is 57 years old, separated, and has 5 adult children. With her first 300 soles loan, she bought merchandise to sell in her stall in the port. She has been working for 18 cycles with the community bank and says that she lives with her daughter, her grandson, and her son-in-law. With this 1,200 soles loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy panettones and more merchandise to sell during the Christmas holiday. Valentine wants to keep working in order to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy panettones and other merchandise.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah E. is 35 years old, married with 4 children. Deborah sells ice blocks, and she has a deep freezer designed for making ice blocks. As her customers increase, she plans to purchase an additional freezer. She needs the loan to purchase an additional freezer. She says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional freezer

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila tiene 44 años de edad, es casada hace 23 años con el padre de su tres hijos, viven en su casa propia. Desde que se casó, junto a su esposo ha sembrado, plátanos, paltas y café. El año pasado se propusieron incrementar sus cultivos de café en aras de buscar mejores ingresos económicos,  pero no tuvieron buenos resultados debido al alza desmesurada de los fertilizantes, solo logró comprar lo suficiente para el abonado de sus plantas frutales. Este año han bajado los precios, por lo que su meta es sembrar nuevas chacras de café, porque el mercado del café en ciertas épocas es muy rentable, mientras que con sus chacras frutales obtiene ingresos para el sostenimiento de la familia y casi siempre mantienen el mismo precio. A pesar de los buenos y malos momentos Lucila se siente muy contenta con sus sembríos y sigue con la mirada en un futuro mejor. Pese a 9 Km. de distancia desde su pueblo hasta donde realizan las reuniones su banco comunal es muy puntual, en este nuevo ciclo acaba de juramentar como presidenta, donde se compromete a responder con responsabilidad en la confianza depositada. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita es para realizar una limpieza de sus campos de cultivo, asimismo comprará plantas de café y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Lucila is 44 years old and has been married to the father of her three children for 23 years. They live in their own home. She has grown bananas, avocados, and coffee with her husband since they were married. Last year they decided to increase the size of the coffee farm in the hopes of increasing their income, but they did not have good results because of the excessive rise in fertilizer prices. She was only able to buy enough to fertilize their fruit trees. This year the prices have come down, so her goal is to plant new coffee fields because the coffee market is very profitable at certain times. Her fruit trees bring in the income that sustains the family, and they almost always earn the same price. Despite the good and bad moments, Lucila is very pleased with her farm and she continues to look toward the future. Even though it is 9 km from her village to where the communal bank holds its meetings, she is very punctual. For this new season she has been sworn in as the president, and she is committed to fulfilling the role responsibly because of the confidence shown in her. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is requesting money to clean up her fields and to buy coffee plants and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Chhoam

texts.en: Mrs. Chhoam S., 45, is married and lives with her husband in Battambang province, Cambodia. She sells soup and grocery products from her home and is able to make US$3 every day. Her husband, Soeun Rin, 53, is a motor-taxi driver. On average, he makes US$3 per day as well. This couple has three children; two of whom are students and one who is in security. Chhoam S. is asking for a loan to purchase beverages for sale.

loans.use: To purchase beverages for sale.

loans.name: Pedro Ismael

texts.es: El señor Pedro Ismael Velásquez tiene la edad de 67 años, habita en el barrio las Enramadas, junto a su esposa , ella es ama de casa el apoyo que recibe don Pedro es por parte de sus hijos ya que estos están casado y viven cada uno es sus vivienda , los planes hacia un futuro es comprar mas terreno para poder heredar partes iguales a sus hijos , desde hace treinta años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor afectación es la baja de producción por falta de fertilizantes y cuidos del mismo , el inicio por sus propios esfuerzos para lograr darles a sus hijos un techo y comida , el solicita el financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos y obtener una buena producción y vender a un buen precio en el mercado, este es su noveno ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por las oportunidades y beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro Ismael Velásquez is 67 years old and lives with his wife in the neighbourhood of Las Enramadas. She is a housewife. Sr. Pedro receives help from his children who are married and live in their own homes. His plan for the future consists of buying more land so that he can leave equal parts to his children. For the last thirty years he has been a farmer, with his main concerns being falling production caused by the lack of fertilizer and caring for his crops. When he started out, he worked really hard so he could provide his children with food and shelter. He is now asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and other needed items, in order to increase production and sell his crops for a good price in the market. This is his first loan with Kiva partner Afodenic, and he wishes to express his gratitude for this opportunity and help for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other needed items in order to increase the harvest

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.es:
Perfecta es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino.
Perfecta es conviviente tiene 55 años,  dos hijos de 17 y 15 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Hace nueve años empezó a vender golosinas en una canastita, alentada por sus vecinas, junto sus ahorros y se pudo comprar un kiosco, ella vende golosinas en al puerta de sus casa. 
Perfecta necesita un préstamo de 800 soles para la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, frugos, galletas.  
Desde que esta en Finca, puede invertir mejor gracias a los préstamos que recibe, su economía ha mejorado. 
El sueño de perfecta es tener más capital para comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Perfecta is a member of the Niño Divino community bank. Perfecta is 55, and has a common law husband. She has two children, 17 and 15, who attend the state school. Nine years ago she started to sell sweets from a little basket. Encouraged by her neighbors, she gathered her savings and bought a kiosk. She sells sweets from the door of her house. Perfecta needs a loan of 800 PEN to buy sweets, soft drinks, fruit drinks, and cookies. Since she has been with Finca she has been able to invest more. Thanks to the loans she has received, her economic situation has improved. Her dream is to have more capital to be able to buy some land.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets, soft drinks, fruit drinks, and cookies.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 44 years old and mother to 2 children. Esther makes photocopies, computer designs and she also has a computer school in Lagos state, Nigeria. Esther is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN120, 000 ($825 US) to purchase a computer and a photocopier. This, she says, will enable her to satisfy the growing demands of her numerous customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and a photocopier for her business.

loans.name: Rother

texts.en:
Rother F. is from the town of Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and widowed with four school-aged children. To make a living, Rother makes and sells food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling dried goods in the local community. Rother has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rother joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rother has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rother is requesting a new loan of 28000 PHP which will be used to again purchase raw ingredients. This loan will be the sixth taken out by Rother from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To transport sand and gravel

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is a businesswoman at Sefwi. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She is 47 years old, married and lives with her husband. She has one child (girl) who is currently in school. Charlotte is very supportive to her family through her trading business. She has been selling for the past four years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a more viable profit. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. It is her desire\ to rent a store in the community market. She would be grateful for your support. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Aver Maria’.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is a businesswoman. She trades in kente clothes, linen and lace materials. Kente is a traditional-design cloth; it is purchased by the rich because of its value. Georgina has rented a store from which she trades.

Georgina is 48 years old and a married mother with six children. Three are schooling and three are working. She is very supportive to her family through her trading business.

Georgina has been selling for the past seven months but progress has persistently been slow due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive her business and make a more viable profit. She wants to purchase kente clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase kente clothes in bulk to increase her inventory

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas S., 36, is married and lives with her husband in Sa-ang approximately 40 minutes from the city. To make a living, she has been selling porridge since 2001 with an income around US $3 per day. Her husband is a butcher who typically is able to make an income of US $3 per day. In light of the country's economic difficulties because of the financial crisis, S. is seeking to increase her income. S. is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase pigs for her husband's business, and with the remainder, she wants to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to transport his products to sell at the markets. She believes that this will help raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and a motorbike.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two twins who are just one year old. She sells clothing at Zhidachev town. She has been in this business for 7 years. Oksana is very creative in her business and has many new ideas as to business improvement and development. She talks a lot with her clients and helps them not only to with their purchases but gives them encouragement and hope in the midst of crises.
Oksana would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to increase the inventories. She is in the process of building her own house. She hopes to use additional income to build the house sooner and move there early even before the winter.

loans.use: to increase the inventories

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom C., 38, is widow with one young son. She lives in a small village along national road number four about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhom has been renting a space of her house to garment factory workers sine 1991. Because her house located near garment factory, so it’s good for her to run the business. But, some room is breaks thus she is applying for her first loan of $500 in order to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair her rooms to rent.

loans.name: Elia Maria

texts.es: La señora Elia Maria A., realiza la actividad de venta de tortilla en su casa de habitación desde. Hace mas 31 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecer a sus clientes tortillas de calidad en su cuadra es conocida como marillita, por lo que es una persona muy reconocida. Ella siempre ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo ya que es siempre le gusto trabajar de manera humilde. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de maíz, comal, cal entre otras cosas. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elia Maria A. sells tortillas from her house. For more than 31 years she has made a living in this business and has always been characterized as offering quality tortillas to her clients. On her block she is known as Marillita (Little Maria) and is a very well-recognized person. She has always moved forward with a lot of effort and has always liked to work in a humble manner. Currently she is requesting this financing for capital that will be used for the purchase of corn, hotplates, and lime, among other things. Her greatest dream is to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business.

loans.name: Chiquito

texts.en: Chiquito C. is from the village of Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Chiquito owns and operates a business selling seafood to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Chiquito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC. Chiquito is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for his seafood business. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for his business

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria L. is from the village of Barangay, Santiago, Iligan City. She is 51 years old. Macaria is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Macaria owns & operates a business venture selling scrap metal & other used-products in the local community. Macaria has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Macaria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Macaria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Macaria is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP. These funds will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Macaria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run S., 38, is married and lives with her four children in Siem Reap province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$ 6 each day, while her husband works as a construction worker. Her husband makes about US$ 5 each day.

Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also been a factor in making the price of rice very high.

Run S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 to make a new investment. She wants to open a wash moto garage. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Open wash moto garage.

loans.name: Farzana Samim Group

texts.en:
This is the Farzana Samim group. It has three members; Farhzana, Rosh Gul and Khalada. They all live in Kabul, Afghanistan.

Farzana is the group leader. She is 50 years old and lives in a family of six members. She wants to take a loan for her husband who has a video selling shop. Farzana’s husband wants to buy all the needed materials for his business and wants to support all of his family members. 

Rosh Gul, the second member of this group, works with her husband. She cleans fruits and packages them, and her husband sells them in his cart in the market. This the only business through which they support a family of five members. 

Khalada’s brother has a tailoring business. He works in order to pay for all the expenses of his family and wants to buy the necessary material for his business.

They all have requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani to expand their businesses. They would like to say lots of thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for their family businesses

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam sells clothes, shoes and bags in her stall at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own an international boutique in the future. This is the high season for sales, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She has been in this business for two years. She is a focused and hard worker. She is a single lady without children. 

Mariam is 26 years old and she lives in Badagry, Lagos State. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organisation) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Mariam hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more shoes, bags and clothes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth C. is from the village of Capellan. She is 36 years old. Janeth is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Janeth owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Janeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Janeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Wilma trabaja como artesana; confecciona mantas de vicuña y alpaca que  comercializa en la ciudad de El Alto, siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la zona Villa Tahuantinsuyo de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de materia prima (lana) para poder incrementar su producción y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Kiva, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Wilma works as a craftsperson; she makes blankets from vicuña and alpaca wool that she sells in the city of El Alto. This activity is her main source of income and it covers the support of her small son who is 2 years old. She lives in her parents house, which is located in the Villa Tahuantinsuyo neighborhood of the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to buy raw materials (wool) so that she can increase her production and thus increase her income. This is her first loan with Kiva; the evaluation carried out by IMPRO approved her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vicuña and alpaca wool for her business making blankets

loans.name: Ariana

texts.es:
Ariana S. C., tiene la edad de 22 años, es soltera, y tiene 1 hijo, que es su mayor prioridad. El hijo tiene 2 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para Compra de inventario para el negocio de abarrotes.Ella desea darle el mantenimiento adecuado para que sus ventas aumenten y por ende aumentar sus ingresos económicos, su negocio es una pulpería que lo creó unos años. Además de pulpería su familia tiene una pequeñas cabinas para alquilar.
No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre.
Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Ariana S. C. is 22 years old, single and has 1 son, who is her major priority. Her son is 2 years old. She wants the loan to buy inventory for her grocery business. She wishes to give her business adequate maintenance to increase her sales and therefore increase her income; her business is a small grocery store that she established a few years ago. In addition to the store, her family has small cabins for rent. This is not the first time she works on a loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with all the support they have always provided. In the future, she hopes to provide for her son a better quality of life and better financial stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Shokirdjon

texts.en:
Shokirdjon is a responsible family man and father who cares for his family with great attention. He comes from an agricultural family and today it is these activities which provide a major source of income which allows him to support his 5 children. Shokirdjon has a friendly family who always try to help each other. His dream is to see his sons succeed, and it is in order to achieve this that his efforts know no limit. In this case, his wish is to improve his seeding and to care for his animals, for which Shokirdjon needs a loan. Your help is very important for this hard-working and humble worker.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma S. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 70 years old. Lerma is separated from her spouse and has seven adult children. To make a living, Lerma owns and operates a business in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lerma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.
