In 2009, Lerma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lerma has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lerma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lerma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more goods to expand her business

loans.name: Marling

texts.es:
La señora Marling I. es maestra de educación de primaria.
Marling va usar este crédito para pagar un curso de estudio universitario de su hijo para optar al titulo de profesionalización. Ella espera que con el crédito su hijo pueda pagar los gasto del curso y por ende obtener el titulo.
Marling es casada y tiene dos hijos ambos en edad escolar. Este es su segundo crédito con Ceprodel y tiene dos años de trabajar con crédito con Ceprodel ella expresa que los crédito le han ayudado mucho por que ha podido ayudar a su hijo en los estudios.
texts.en:
Marling I. is a primary school teacher. She will use this loan to pay for a university course of study for her son, who is working toward his professional certification. Marling is married and has two school-aged children. This is her second loan with Ceprodel. She has been working with Ceprodel for two years, and says that the loans they have provided have helped her greatly. They have helped her son advance in his studies.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for a university course for professional certification

loans.name: Nelson Ramiro

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	El Sr. Nelson G. M. es un Agricultor con 15 años de experiencia y vive en la comarca de Palo Alto municipio del Viejo.

El va a utilizar el crédito para comprar dos vacas paridas ya que ellas son las que le proporcionan el alimento diario porque vende de 15 a 20lts  de    leche diario.

Este es el tercer crédito que tiene con la Institución  y hasta la fecha todos los créditos los ha pagado muy bien y espera seguir trabajando con la Institución.
texts.en:
Nelson G. M. has 15 years of experience working in agriculture. He lives in the Palo Alto region in the municipality of Viejo. He will use this loan to buy 2 dairy cows because these will provide 15-20 liters of milk daily that he will sell. This is the 3rd loan that he has taken with the Institution and up to this date he has paid off his loans very well; he hopes to continue to work with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 2 dairy cows

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para compra de 3 vacas paridas, y de esta manera mejorar su hato ganadero
texts.en:
Este cliente es originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para compra de 3 vacas paridas, y de esta manera mejorar su hato ganadero

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de vacas paridas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more roofing accessories to sell

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz L. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 49 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. She is involved in rice farming and hog-raising. Her husband does the major farming duties while she focuses her time on her hogs. She said that before joining CEVI, she had a sari-sari store and she used her income to buy piglets. Now, she just focuses on the farm and the pigs.

Paz joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Paz is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also to purchase additional piglets and feeds. This will be her seventh loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the farm, piglets and feed for them

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda P. is from the village of Santa Rita. She is 46 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Erlinda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a single mother of two children, aged 10 and 6 years. She is the head of her family with the responsibility of the family welfare resting entirely on her. 

Juliet lives in Fort Portal, Uganda in a rented home and operates a clothing shop, a business she has been into for the last 10 years, having started in a very small kiosk then moved to a container. She has been progressing and now she has her shop in more permanent structures along one of the up and coming streets of the town. 

Juliet confides that theft, high rent, and the ever increasing taxes are her major challenges in her clothing business. She would like to transform her shop into a very big one and even have branches around town and in other neighboring towns. She intends to use the loan funds to purchase clothes in cartons, rolls, or boxes for selling in her shop.

loans.use: purchasing clothes in cartons, rolls, or boxes for resale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia B. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 43 years old. Lydia is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising fish for sale. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair  equipment used in her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lydia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair equipment used in the business

loans.name: Francisco De Jesús

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco De Jesús M. C.. Es un pequeño agricultor dedicado a labores agrícolas en la siembra de maíz, trigo y frijoles, los créditos solicitados han sido para gastos agrícolas y pago de mano de obra este crédito y los  anteriores los ha pagado de los ingresos de una pulpería y remesa del extranjero.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco De Jesús M. C. is a small farmer engaging in agriculture sowing maize, wheat and beans.The previous loans he has been granted have been used to pay for farming expenses and the salary or his workers; he has repayed the previous loans, and will be repaying the new one he is requesting, with the incomes of a corner shop and from a remittance from abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare his lands, to buy supplies (urea, insecticides) and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Assana

texts.fr: F. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagne, elle a une ancienneté de plus de 10 ans dans ce commerce. plus tard elle a associé à cette activité le commerce de bijoux, elle s'approvisionne en pagnes au grand marché de Lomé et en bijoux au ghana voisin. la demande actuel de sa clientèle est élevée, pour les satisfaire elle a besoin d'un prêt pour s'approvisionner avec une vingtaine de pagnes de différentes qualités et quelques bijoux.
texts.en:
To generate income, Assana sells "pagnes" [traditional brightly-colored fabric]. She has been in this business for over 10 years. Later on, she combined this activity with the commerce of jewelry. She gets her supplies of pagnes at the general market in Lomé and her supplies of jewelry in neighboring Ghana. The current demand from her customers is high. In order to satisfy them, she needs a loan to stock up with twenty pagnes of various qualities and some jewelry.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pagnes

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo C. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 57 years old. Alfredo is married and has three grown children. 

To make a living, Alfredo owns and operates a business providing waste management services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating boat-ride services. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alfredo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his boat engine. 

This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alfredo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his boat engine.

loans.name: Esperanza Asegurada 1 Group

texts.en:
Berta is the coordinator of her group, Esperanza Asegurada 1 (Assured Hope). She makes her home in a simple structure with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to build her house and to get her children educated.

Berta is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two years, starting with selling girls underwear after she received her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing like shirts, pants, underwear and mens t-shirts. She will use the profits to buy a better stove for her home and also to save to reach her dream come true, in which she has her own home built with a good structure.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she has more facilities and, with them, she can maintain her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).  Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry.  The main economic activities are free trade and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and beer

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en:
Enhtur O. lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in Suhbaatar province in Mongolia. Both of his two children attend the local high school while his wife operates a block imprinting business outside of their home. 

Enhtur and his wife began their own business in 2003 by operating a meat trading business, which is currently stalled due to insufficient working capital. Instead, he has been driving a taxi since 2009 after purchasing a new Excel car, and has built a stable operation. They are planning to imprint more blocks in order to build a new garage for his car. Moreover, he hopes to build his own house for his family by 2011. 

Enhtur is a modest, diligent and hardworking man and says, "I am planning to build and move in a new house before my children start attending universities." He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary parts for his car and also to produce ceramic blocks that will be used in the construction of his new garage.

loans.use: To purchase necessary parts for his taxi

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen H. lives in Lchashen village, Sevan area, with his parents, his wife and two children. 

For about 15 years Armen has engaged in land cultivation and animal husbandry. In his farm he has cows, sheep, pigs, and chickens. Armen’s wife helps him in farming, so they support their family, develop their farm and pay for their children's education at university. 

Armen asks for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedlings, which he will plant next spring.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Linaflor

texts.en:
Linaflor A. is from the village of Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Linaflor is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Linaflor owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal products such as shoes and watches in the local community. Linaflor has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Linaflor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linaflor is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Linaflor from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Lamo,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto, de 18 años, es un joven soltero y trabajador, que vive con su mamá María, de 37 años, y su papá Jesús, de 40 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. El trabajo al que se dedica Humberto, es la venta de tapices, gorras y chompas, ya tiene 2 años, dedicándose a la venta al por mayor de estos tejidos, los que constantemente vende en el país de Ecuador, a donde viaja una ves al mes, ahí vende los lindos tejidos de los pobladores de esa localidad. Por otro lado Humberto también ayuda a su mamá, en la tienda de venta de lana, donde quiere no solo vender lana natural, sino también, lana sintética de diferentes colores y diseños, los que últimamente son más solicitados y generan buen ingreso. Este es el segundo un crédito con MFP, y espera salir adelante con el apoyo que le brinda su banco comunal, que está integrado por personas honestas y trabajadoras. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará lanas de diferentes colores para surtir su tienda, asimismo comprará más tapices para comercializarlos.
texts.en: Humberto is an 18 year old single young man who is hardworking and lives with his mom, Maria who is 37 years old and his father, Jesus who is 40 years old.  They live together in their own home which is located in San Pedro de Cajas.  Humberto has been selling carpets, hats, and sweaters in bulk for 2 years.  He constantly sells to the country of Ecuador, a place he travels to once a month, once there he sells the cute fabrics of the local inhabitants in the area.  Humberto also helps his mom at the store selling wool, there he not only wants to sell natural wool but also synthetic wool of different colors and designs.  These are generally more sought after and generate bigger revenue.  This is the 2nd loan with MFP, and he hopes to get ahead with the help his communal bank offers which is made up of honest and hard-working people.  With this loan he will purchase different colored wool to stock his store and at the same time also purchase more carpets to sell.

loans.use: Purchase different colored wool and carpets to sell.

loans.name: Tubiburukundo Group

texts.en:
Joselyne is 38 years old and married to a soldier.  They have two children who do not attend school yet.  Joselyne is a group leader of a borrowing group called Tubiburukundo in Kinyarwanda which means “Sow love” in English.  Each group member does a different business but all of them know about the functionality of the loan and are willing to pay back the loan because they are confident of their businesses. 

Joselyne sells different items in her shop such as sugar, maize flour, and other retail items that are constantly demanded by her customers.  It’s from this point that Joselyne and her group decided to request a loan particularly for increasing the volume of items in her shop.  She plans on using the profits to pay school fees because her children by will be enrolled in school next year.  She also plans on saving the remaining balance.  She would like to see her business booming by as much as 70% in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items for sale.

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
The man shown in this picture is Mr. Cheam S..  He is 40 years old. He is a worker responsible for the provision of clean water in the city of Phnom Penh.  He has been working in this job since 1996 and earns approximately $2.50 a day. His wife’s name is Kunthea.  She is 38 years old and works as a seamstress. The couple is blessed with two children, one is a student in public school, and the other is a garment worker. 

Mr. Cheam S. requested a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. He will rent out this land to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase land to rent to farmers

loans.name: Juan Raul

texts.es:
Juan Raul pertenece al banco comunal “Kukuli” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 13 ciclos de funcionamiento (Cada ciclo son 4 meses) y el banco comunal está bien administrado por la junta directiva. 
Juan Raul, tiene 39 años y es separado, él nació en el departamento de Cusco provincia de Cusco, Perú. 

Actualmente, el socio Juan Raul vive en el distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco.  Juan Raul se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanía en el centro artesanal “Inka” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Juan Raul espera recibir S/. 2000 nuevos soles de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar artesanía.
texts.en:
Juan Raul belongs to the “Kukuli” Communal Bank of the UMF Arariwa Association. The Communal Bank has received 13 loans (each cycle is 4 months) and the Communal Bank is well managed by its governing board.

Juan Raul is 39 years old and is separated, he was born in the department of Cusco, province of Cusco, Perú.

At present, Juan Raul lives in the district of Santiago in the city of Cusco. Juan Raul makes and sells crafts in the craft center “Inka” in the city of Cusco. It has been a few years since he has had this business and is doing very well thanks all of his hard work. Juan Raul hopes to receive a loan of S/. 2000 nuevos soles that will be used to buy crafts.

loans.use: To buy crafts.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 34 years old, married and has two children. For the last seven years, he has made a living by running a barber shop and a salon. He now has three employees, and supplements his income by selling hides and skins on the side. He hopes to expand his business into a full-service beauty parlor in the next five years. As a member of the Hanan group, which is affiliated with Faulu Kenya, he can easily access capital because people in his loan group pledge to guarantee each other's loans.  He also uses his group as a tool for saving money. He is applying for this loan for 40,000 Kes to buy a sink, sterilizing equipment and an electric shaver.

loans.use: To buy a sink, sterilizing equipment and a shaver

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is the mother of six children and runs a goat farm. Manal works with her older sons and daughters on the farm taking care of the goats they raise and breed for sale and selling milk. Manal wants to increase the milk quantities produced and the number of goats. She took out a loan from FATEN for this purpose. Manal's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee.

Manal, who is in the picture here, and her family live in Kofor Raie village near Jenin city.

loans.use: To purchase goats to raise and breed for sale

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Félix realiza trabajos como prensista en una empresa grafica y su esposa tiene un pequeño taller de costura; el crédito lo necesita para la compra de una computadora para el taller de costura, para cargar programas de costura a la misma. Vive  en casa propia ubicada en la zona 16 de Febrero de la ciudad de El Alto, es casado  tiene dos hijos.
texts.en: Félix works as a press operator in a graphics company.  His wife owns a small sewing workshop.  Félix needs this loan to buy a computer for his wife's sewing workshop, to load sewing programs onto.  He lives in his own home which is located in 16 de Febrero neighborhood, in the city of El Alto.  He is married and has two children.

loans.use: To buy a computer for his wife's sewing workshop

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las Emprendedoras se denomina el grupo conformado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa el 11 de Junio de 2008, gracias a Angela O., ella contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía, una vez asesorada acerca del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras logró juntar a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 9° ciclo.
La sra. Angela tiene una despensa en su casa desde hace 2 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, ella solicitó el crédito para poder comprar más comestibles para su tienda, pues tiene muchos clientes y no puede complacerlos bien porque su capital es limitado, por eso necesita esta ayuda financiera para impulsar su negocio y así poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
'Las Emprendedoras' (The Enterprising Women) is the name of this group which was formed in the city of Villa Elisa on June 11th, 2008.  Angela O. contacted an advisor during a weekly meeting.  Once she had been advised about how the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) program works, she managed to get together 16 women who are now working very happily on their 9th loan cycle.

Angela has had a grocery store in her home for 2 years.  She is married and has 4 children.  She requested this loan so that she could buy more groceries for her store since she has a lot of customers and cannot keep them all happy because she has limited capital.  This is why she needs this financial help, so that she can drive her business forward and better satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Yoshelin

texts.es:
Yoshelin es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual es mas conocido como la novia del sol, ya que ademas de ser una region ganadera es uno de los lugares dnde hace mas calor del estado de Veracruz. Yose(como la llaman sus hermanos y amigos) tiene la edad de 19 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria ya que sus padres no pudieron darle mas estudios.

ella nos platica que desde que asistira a la secundaria le enseñaron a trabajar con manualidades y al salir de la preparatoria decidio hacer su propio negocio de venta de manualidades (flores de papel y fomy, servilletas bordadas y recuerdos para fiestas) tiempo despues a una señora le gusto su trabaj y la contrato para que trabajara con ella en su negocio. ahora trabaja por la mañanas y se ha asociado con su hermana para poner una pequeña papeleria.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de lapiz, lapiceros, hojas blancas y de colores, resistol, tijeras, cartilinas, papel bond, plastilina, unicel, fomy, cuadernos, libretas, laminas y biografias.

ella piensa en poner su papeleria en su casa y nos dice que tendra exito ya que sera la unica papeleria en su comunidad.

ella espera que sus ganancias sean buenas ya que espera en un futuro contruir un local para instalarla mejor.
texts.en:
Yoshelin lives in a place called Tierra Blanca, which is better known as la novia del sol (the girlfriend of the sun), since, in addition to being a ranching region, it is one of the places with the hottest weather in Veracruz.  Yose (as her siblings and friends call her) is 19 years old.  She studied through high school, since her parents were not able to afford more education for her.

She tells us that since she went to high school, they taught her to work with handcrafts.  Upon leaving the school, she decided to start her own business selling handcrafts (paper and craft foam flowers, embroidered napkins, and party favors).  Some time after, a woman liked her work, and hired Yose to work with her in her business.  Now she works in the mornings, and she has joined with her sister to start a small paper shop.  

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of pencils, automatic pencils, white and colored paper, school glue, scissors, card stock, bond paper, Plasticine, polystyrene, craft foam, notebooks, sheets of paper, and biographies.

She is thinking about putting her paper store in her house.  She tells us that it will be successful because it will be the only paper store in her community.

She hopes that her earnings will be good, since in the future she hopes to build business premises in order to better establish the store.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her paper store

loans.name: Buyanbat

texts.en:
Buyanbat is 64 years old and lives with her husband and only son in a ger (a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent) in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her son is a driver who has operated a transportation service for 10 years in his town.

Buyanbat manages a food cafe with the help of her husband. They started their business in 1999 and are planning to continue their business in the future. They offer a variety of Mongolian traditional dishes including buuz, huushuur, lapsha and tsuivan, etc. Their meals are well-known amongst their customers for quality and freshness.

With years of business operation, they gained much experience and have been able to build a house where they can prepare meals for their customers. Buyanbat is an honest and polite woman who says, "I am doing my best in order to provide better living conditions for my family."

She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to renew her son's truck in order to support her son's transportation business.

loans.use: to renew her son's truck

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokun C. (pictured here) is a weaver. Her husband is a fisherman and farmer. She is requesting another loan of US $600 to help with her husband’s farming by purchase a water pumping machine and to pay for plowing fees.

The couple has five sons and two daughters. Two are married, one lives in separated home and another one stays in the family home. Two are construction workers, one weaves silk at home, one is a garment factory worker and the other one is in school. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To help with her husband’s farming by purchase a water pumping machine and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Concepcion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Concepción está conformado por María Concepción, Rosalía, Degsy Scarleth mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras originarias de Managua. Este grupo tiene ocho ciclos de trabajar con Adim y han tenido tres préstamos en kiva en los cuales sus negocios han ido creciendo.
La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Concepción de 64 años se dedica a la decoración y las artes manuales actividad que realiza desde joven y con el tiempo ha perfeccionado. Ella por más de 32 años tiene un pequeño negocio de costura y decoración en los cuales los últimos dos años emprendió un nuevo reto que es la realización de piñatas en la cual invertirá el crédito con la compra de materiales como hoya de barro, papel de periódico, pegamento blanco, palillo, papel crepe, palos…etc.
Mientras Rosalía de 30 años se dedica al comercio de ropa usada y nueva y cosméticos, y Degsy de 29 años también comercializa ropa y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The members of the Concepción group are María Concepción, Rosalía and Degsy Scarleth who are hard-working, entrepreneurial women from Managua.  This group has been working with Adim for eight loan cycles and they have had three Kiva loans which they have used to grow their businesses.

The group's coordinator is 64 year-old Concepción who decorates and makes handicrafts.  She has been doing this since she was young and, over time, she has perfected her skills.  For more than 32 years, she has owned a small sewing and decorations business.  Over the last two years, she has taken on a new challenge, making piñatas.  She will invest her loan money in this business, buying materials such as clay pots, newspaper, white glue, crepe paper, piñata sticks, etc.

30 year-old Rosalía sells new and used clothes and cosmetics and 29 year-old Degsy also sells clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to make piñatas

loans.name: Jose Felipe

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 31 años  de edad, vive con su espos e hijos en su casa propia y no cuenta con  servicios básicos, la cual está ubicada en el distrito Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola, ganadera y artesanía.

José se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace algún tiempo, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra limón y una vez que se da la cosecha lo vende en los mercados de la zona, tambien cría ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, sus corrales están en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con pastos y granos naturales,una vez que lleguen a su desarrollo óptimo los ofrece a sus clientes en elmercado.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de limón y para la compra de alimentos para sus animales para poder pedir un poco más de precio del que existe en el mercado y poder pagar el préstamo brindado como incrementar sus ingresos y solventar su gastos personales.  José es una persona  trabajadora que lo único que quiere es darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José es un padre de familia de 31 años  de edad, vive con su espos e hijos en su casa propia y no cuenta con  servicios básicos, la cual está ubicada en el distrito Tambogrande a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agricola, ganadera y artesanía.

José se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace algún tiempo, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra limón y una vez que se da la cosecha lo vende en los mercados de la zona, tambien cría ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, sus corrales están en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con pastos y granos naturales,una vez que lleguen a su desarrollo óptimo los ofrece a sus clientes en elmercado.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de limón y para la compra de alimentos para sus animales para poder pedir un poco más de precio del que existe en el mercado y poder pagar el préstamo brindado como incrementar sus ingresos y solventar su gastos personales.  José es una persona  trabajadora que lo único que quiere es darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y alimentos balanceados para sus animales

loans.name: Babet

texts.en:
Babet is 41 years old.  She is married and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Babet requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Babet has been with the organization for three years now and has had two loans in the past from NWTF.

In the future, Babet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa est revendeuse de cartes de recharges et divers. Elle est à son premier prêt et veut renforcer son activité. Elle a démarré en 2008 et achète chez les distributeurs agréés.
texts.en: Adjowa retails phone recharge cards and various other items. She is on her first loan and wants to grow her business. She began it in 2008 and she buys from licensed distributors.

loans.use: to buy telephone recharge cards.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en:
Dorris is 44 years old and lives in the Kakata area. She is married with six children aged between 5 and 29, all of whom live at home and have attended school.
Since 1992, Dorris has run her own tailoring business. She makes a wide range of clothing including traditional African clothing, school uniforms and shirts. Dorris has requested this loan to purchase more cloth in other to increase the range of styles she makes. The main problem she faces is the need to repair and maintain her sewing machines. Dorris wants to open another tailor’s shop and will use the profits to send her children to university.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth in order to increase the range of styles she makes.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a resident of Kitale town in western Kenya. He has a family with four children between nine and 14 years old. For the past eight years, Daniel has been a farmer, producing eggs, vegetables, and tomatoes to sell at the local market. His business helps to provide food and education for his children.

Daniel is requesting a 30,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more birds for his poultry business.  His greatest business challenge is poultry diseases. Daniel is glad Juhudi is providing small farmers with loans. In the future, Daniel hopes to generate more income to be able to buy a motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Rocio Maribel

texts.en:
Rocio Maribel is a hard-working single mother of 21 years. She lives with her 42-year-old mother Amanda and her two-year-old child. In her spare time, Rocio Maribel likes to listen to music, read, and just think.

Rocio Maribel lives and works in the Santo Domingo canton of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is one of the largest cities in Ecuador, with 500,000 inhabitants, but you'd never guess the size of the city from the tranquil pace of life and the easy-going inhabitants. Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is in a tropical, humid area of Ecuador, renowned for its natural beauty, its huge markets, and its trade in livestock--the largest in the country.

This is Rocio's second loan with Fundación Alternativa and her first loan with Kiva. She will use her loan to buy more cattle to sell. Rocio works twelve hours a day. She learned this business from her parents. Rocio hopes one day to be an engineer or work in business administration. She hopes this loan will her her increase her income and provide for a bright future for her and her child.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell later on.

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.en:
Eudosia is sixty-three years old. She is married and she lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She has two children. Eudosia has a small sari-sari (variety) store. She has been doing this job since she got married. She requested a loan of 40,000 to purchase materials for the renovation of their house.

Eudosia has been a member of PMPC for more than one year.

loans.use: To purchase for the materials for house construction.

loans.name: Julio Venjamin

texts.es: Julio Venjamin tiene 39 años, su actividad es la venta de cerdos. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este medio de vida. Él ha sido una persona responsable, tiene 7 hijos y todos están bajo su cargo, Julio ha sabido manejar este negocio ya que es por medio de él que ha podido brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de cerdos, ya que además tiene que pagar para el traslado de los cerdos. Además Julio les enseña a sus hijos este negocio para que ellos puedan continuar con esta actividad.
texts.en: Julio Venjamin is 39 and sells pigs for a living.  For over five years this has been his main source of income.  He is a responsible person with seven children in his care.  Julio knows how to manage this type of business which has allowed him to provide for his family.  The loan he is requesting is to buy pigs and also pay for their transportation.  Julio is teaching the business to his children so they can continue it in the future.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Esther Kambe

texts.en: Esther is fifty-two years old. She is widowed and has three grown up children. She runs a clothing store which is located at the busy Mwembe Tayari market in Mombasa. She has been doing this business for ten years. She says that this business is profitable, and the only major challenge she has is the rising cost of clothes as a result of current inflation. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more clothes to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business and even build her own house. She describes herself as Godfearing, humble and customer friendly.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 48 years old and married with 5 children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Emma runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store. Emma has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent, and other groceries. In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mulimani Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mulimani Group in Western Kenya! Winnie is the facilitator of the Mulimani group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Winnie takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Winnie had a very good maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,Winnie was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Winnie and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Winnie will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mulimani group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the picture the field officer is pictured standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 40 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has four children aged 18 to 5 years old; all of her children are presently in school and live at home. For the past  seven years, she has been selling charcoal in her community. She makes lots of profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plans is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal  for her business.

loans.name: Florinda Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Florinda Agustina es casada, tiene 36 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de delantales, inició gracias al apoyo de un familiar, lleva 15 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

Solicita un prestamos para la compra de telas típicas para elabora delantales y también la compra de hilos de diferente colores.
texts.en:
Floridna Agustina is married, is 36 years old, and finished primary school. She has 3 children, all of whom are studying. She makes dress aprons, which she started doing thanks to the support of a family member. She has 15 years of experience and has the support of her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to buy typical fabrics for making the dress aprons and also to buy threads of different colors.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads

loans.name: Abdurashit

texts.ru: Абдурашит житель района Кубодиён. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его жена занимается торговлей. Сам он тоже занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, который он арендует. Абдурашит занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров. В этой области он три года. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара с целью привлечения новых клиентов.
texts.en: Abdurashit is a resident of the Quabadiyon district.  He is 46 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is involved in sales and so is Abdurashit.  He leases a store, where he sells household goods.  He has been in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan to expand merchandise selection in order to attract new customers.

loans.use: to expand merchandise selection in order to attract new customers

loans.name: Yudith Cirila

texts.es: La socia Yudith sigue con su negocio de compra y venta de ropa, tanto para damas como para caballeros, la socia compra todo tipo de prendas de vestir como carteras.  pantalones, camisas, blusas, chompas y polos, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a  diferentes instituciones y a sus diferentes amistades. La socia desea a futuro cercano implementar su negocio y ampliar su mercadería y hasta poner una tienda de venta de ropa para exhibirla y en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de ropa al por mayor porque tiene muchos pedidos y desea viajar a traer la mercadería. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ropa y viajar.
texts.en: Yudith continues with her business of buying and selling clothes for women and men.  She buys all types of items such as purses, trousers, shirts, blouses, sweaters, and polo shirts.  Yudith works independently and sells to different institutions and to her various friends.  In the near future, Yudith wants to establish her business and expand her inventory of merchandise.  She hopes to have a clothing store where she can display her products.  On this occasion, she wants a loan so that she can purchase clothing in bulk because she has many orders and must travel to acquire the merchandise.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to invest in clothing and pay for her travel expenses.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and pay for her travel expenses.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills. 

For the past three years, Titus has operated a cloth materials business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. He dreams of establishing another business in the future.

Titus decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With 15000 KES, he wants to purchase cloth materials to sell.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials to sell.

loans.name: Savai

texts.en:
Savai, 22, is single and lives in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district where crop farming is common. He is a farmer and also plants cassava to earn a living. He has been with this business for more than two years. Sometimes he works for others for a fee. He earns around five U.S. dollars per day and saves around four U.S. dollars daily for the future. 

Savai has been with VisionFund since 2009. The previous loans have made his living better and have helped him have regular income. 

Now requesting another loan, he wants to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his income and savings so he can afford a decent house for living.

loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and fertilizer for his farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pedals, lights, brakes, chains, transfer stickers.

loans.name: Laumata

texts.en:
Laumata is 23 years of age.  She is married and has no children.

Laumata owns and operates a business venture, selling dried goods in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Laumata needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase additional utensils such as frying pan, an oven, and storage cotainers.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand her business.

In 2009, Laumata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Laumata's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase addititonal utensils such as frying pan, an oven, storage containers

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam 1 de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et mère d’au moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels le bois de chauffe, des produits cosmétiques,  des pagnes  de l’encens,  etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres décident d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt de groupe. 
Barakissa est un membre du groupe Benkadi, assise à l’extrême bout avec ses bouteilles d’encens.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des ingrédients pour la fabrication de l’encens.  Elle se procure de ces produits dans les magasins de vente de cosmétiques de Koutiala. Elle vend son encens fabriqué en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle exclusivement féminine elle est très sollicitée car elle a du talent. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkadi comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.500CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Barakissa compte réaliser 95.500FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fond de commerce.

loans.use: Achat  d’ingrédients pour la fabrication d’encens

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Solidarias está en su ciclo número noveno del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, y están trabajando el doble por ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teresa quien es Costurera, comenta que por medio de su esfuerzo y de su trabajo ayuda a su familia. Es una mujer muy emprendedora, y que lucha por ir creciendo y mejorando la vida de su familia para darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, lo que le ayudará a seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Solidarias group is in its ninth loan cycle with the women's communal bank programme. The woman are doing the elimination of poverty survey, whereby two of the members find themselves below the poverty line, and are working twice as hard to improve. 

One of the members is Teresa who is a seamstress. She says that through her effort and work she helps her family. She is a very enterprising woman, and she fights to grow and improve her family's life to give them everything she couldn't have. 

She is applying for this loan to invest in buying fabric and thread, which will help her to continue filling her customers' orders. She is thankful for this opportunity she is receiving which will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is forty-four years old; she is married and has one child. Her husband runs a small business. She hopes for a better life for her family, wants her grandchildren to get an education, dreams of improving her house structure and getting a full time job selling stoves and biomass pellets. She is very committed to her work and is very honest.
She has been doing business for four years. Her main line of business right now is selling stoves and pellets and this is her second loan with KIVA. Selling gets her to interact with a lot of people and this is what she enjoys the most about her business even if the process of teaching how to use the new products can be a challenge.
She feels replacing charcoal with biomass pellets for cooking is important because it is a solution to saving forests. It is also an easier fuel to use and she is able to make an income from this business. She also feels empowered.

loans.use: to buy improved cookstoves and biomass pellets to sell

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo con 61 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica al comercio cuenta con una bodega, ubicada en su propio domicilio, cuenta con más de 8 años de experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de mercadería para el negocio como arroz,azúcar,leche,aceite,etc. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Pedro Pablo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: para invertir en la compra de mercadería para el negocio como arroz,azúcar,leche,aceite,etc.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.en:
A married mother of five children, Ms. Ayoko A. has also taken in her two younger sisters as apprentices. Having not gone to school, she earns her living through the production and sale of “gari” (cassava flour). As someone who appreciates a job well done, she takes great care in the fabrication of gari, which endows her product with a high level of quality. And her gari, which is highly esteemed, sells very well at the market. The demand has become great, as wealthy women come all the way from Lomé to buy it. Today, she no longer has the means to meet the high demand for her product. She is requesting a loan of $650 to buy cassava in large quantity and produce gari.

Despite the fact that she is illiterate, she is gifted with an understanding and a mastery of managing credit. She anticipates increasing her production capacity of gari and selling it at the markets in the region, which will give her the ability to better meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants, Madame A. Ayoko prend aujourd’hui en charge ses deux (2) petites sœurs en apprentissage. N’ayant pas été à l’école, elle fait comme activité la production et la vente du gari (farine de manioc). Aimant le travail bien fait, elle entoure la fabrication du gari de beaucoup de soins. Ce qui confère d’énormes qualités au produit. Du coup, son gari, bien apprécié, est très bien vendu sur le marché. La demande est devenue grande car les bonnes femmes viennent de Lomé pour s’en procurer. Aujourd’hui, elle n’a plus assez de moyens pour satisfaire la forte demande à laquelle elle fait face. Elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour l’achat en grande quantité de manioc et la production de gari.

Malgré qu’elle soit analphabète, elle est dotée d’une compréhension et d’une maîtrise de gestion de crédit. Elle estime augmenter sa capacité de production du gari afin de le vendre sur les marchés des villes de la sous région, ce qui lui la capacité de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy cassava to produce “gari”

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She only has a basic eduction but has gone through KRABAN'S 'TEACH' learning sessions.She thus has the skills in managing such a facility if accorded one. With her shop at strategic location, she hopes to increase the range of products on her shelves.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 17 years old and is single. She and her parents have a small bakery in their home. With the loan, she wants to invest in more kitchen equipment, which will help improve production and sales of bread. She wants to use a part of the loan to finance her studies. She belongs to the “María del Carmen Group 3”, along with Zoila Esperanza Pérez Gutierrez, who sells cosmetics to women in the community. With the loan, she wants build a small business in her home where she can sell cosmetics and creams.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

IRMA TIENE 17 AÑOS ES SOLTERA Y JUNTO CON SUS PADRES TIENEN UNA PEQUEÑA PANADERIA CASERA EN SU HOGAR CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIR EN MAS INSTRUMENTALES DE COCINA Y ASI AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION Y VENTA DE PAN Y ADEMAS COSTEARSE SUS ESTUDIOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARIA DEL CARMEN 3 JUNTO CON ZOILA ESPERANZA P. GUTIERREZ QUIEN VENDE COSMETICOS ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE LA COMUNIDAD , ELLA ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO INSTALAR UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO EN SU CASA EN LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS Y CREMAS .

loans.use: To buy kitchen equipment for a small bakery; To add a small store on to a house for the purpose of selling cosmetics

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo owns his home in the Pasankeri neighborhood of La Paz, where he lives with his wife and two children. He is 38 years old and has worked as a printer for the past six years, making agendas, posters and notebooks. His wife helps him manufacture, bind and sell these products in local markets.

Guillermo's wish is to work side by side with his wife in their own well-equiped print shop, to create additional employment opportunities and increase their income. He is requesting this loan to purchase paper and supplies to manufacture calendar year 2008 agendas. He faces stiff competition for contracts and wants to be able to enter bids reflecting quality materials.

His credit history with IMPRO identifies him as an excellent client who qualifies for a new business loan. To date, IMPRO has made three loans to Guillermo: US $200 in June 2004, US $300 in August 2005 and US $350 in August 2006. All previous loans have been repaid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermo vive en casa propia en la calle 5 de agosto de la zona de pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus dos hijos; tiene 38 años de edad y desde hace mas de 6 años trabaja como grafico elaborando agendas, afiches y cuadernillos. Cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa quien colabora tanto en la elaboración, compaginación etc. además de vender en las ferias.

El deseo de Guillermo es trabajar junto con su esposa y tener un buen taller y poder generar empleo y también mejorar sus ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de papel y material para elaborar agendas 2008 y como hay mucha competencia entrar a las licitaciones con un buen material (licitaciones son los bids en ingles).

Su antecedente histórico con Impro lo califica como un muy buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Hasta la fecha IMPRO ha concedido a Guillermo tres créditos: en Junio 2004 $200, en Agosto 2005 $300 y en Agosto 2006 $350. Todos los créditos han sido pagados en su totalidad.

loans.use: To purchase printing supplies and raw materials

loans.name: Jesús Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz is a hard-working woman, mother of three, two of whom are studying and the youngest of whom is still at home with her. This fills her with satisfaction and gives her the strength to move ahead with her work. She has a vehicle which for 10 years has covered a long route on a daily basis, from her location in Hualhuas to Huancayo and then on to San Jeronimo. Thanks to this she along with her husband can support the household, after years of failure during which none of the activities they attempted gave them the wellbeing and satisfaction as the one to which they now dedicate themselves full-time. Now this vehicle needs some parts so that it along with its four wheels can continue to carry the dreams of an entire family, for which she requests a loan of 100 dollars in order to stay on the course to her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Holmes, Kiva volunteer.

Emperatriz es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre de tres niños, dos de ellos están estudiando y el más pequeño aún permanece con ella en casa; esto la llena de satisfacción y fuerzas para poder seguir adelante con el trabajo que realiza. Ella tiene un vehículo de transporte desde hace 10 años que diariamente cubre una ruta larga. Se desplaza desde su localidad Hualhuas hasta Huancayo y de allí a San Jerónimo.Gracias a esta movilidad de transporte puede sostener al lado de su esposo la economía de su hogar tras pasados años de fracaso en el que ninguna de las actividades que lograron realizar les otorgó bienestar y satisfacción como éste al cual se dedican ahora por completo.Hoy esta unidad de transporte requiere la compra de algunos repuestos para poder seguir llevando con ayuda de sus 4 ruedas los sueños de toda una familia, por ello solicita un préstamo de 100 dólares para realizar su propósito en corto tiempo y seguir la ruta de sus sueños.

loans.use: To purchase parts for a vehicle used to generate income for a family.

loans.name: Marlube Jacoba

texts.en:
Marlube opened and runs her own small grocery store in the hills just outside the city center of Ayacucho, Perú. There, she sells basic food products in bulk such as sugar, rice, and flour. She also sells firewood, cleaning products, and kitchen items. Marlube explains that she makes sure to provide the largest variety of products in her small space in order to attract the largest number of clients, and her strategy is working. Just a short year-and-a-half after she opened her doors, Marlube caters to her whole neighborhood and is always busy helping clients.

Before she opened her grocery store, Marlube was working in the hotel business as a housecleaner. When she became pregnant and her baby was born, there was nobody at home to care for her newborn because her husband also works very hard. Facing this problem, Marlube decided to take the initiative and start her own small business. This way, she says, she is more independent and is able to spend all day caring for her daughter.

Marlube’s dream has always been to move her family out of the room she rents from her father and into their very own house. As far as her professional aspirations are concerned, Marlube would love to one day open a second grocery store. With the profits she is saving from her current business, she will soon be able to realize her goals, she says excitedly. Being a part of her village bank has been a major component in her ability to open a business and accumulate capital. She is very happy to be involved and receive loans from her bank. With the $300 loan, she is requesting, Marlube will increase the quantity and variety of the products she sells.

loans.use: Increase the quantity and variety of goods she sells.

loans.name: Ziyadkhan

texts.en: Ziyadkhan was born in 1977. He is married and has 2 children. This man lives with his family in the Salyan region in Khaladj village. He has been breeding sheep and goats for 3 years. Now  he needs a loan of $1200 to buy baling presses (for hay) for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy baling presses

loans.name: Kireku D Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for six monhs. Resty is 32 years and divorced with four children. Resty and Aidah both sell used clothes. Resty wants to use the extra business profits to buy a piece of land. Flavia has a salon business. Jesca offers tailoring services while Mariam has a soda depot.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in their businesses

loans.name: Agustín

texts.en:
Agustin H. Correa is a successful father of four healthy school age children. He works very hard to give them a good life and keep them in school. Seven years ago he opened a small grocery store from the house, which he owns. His wife Adelaida runs the store on a daily basis now.

Every day Agustin works on his plantation of manioc and sesame seeds. This is another way in which he can make addtitional earnings for his family. This pair of hardworking parents has sacrificed much to give their children the best quality of life they can. Today, Agustin is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise for his store, such as sugar, milk, rice, fruits, and juice, and seeds to plant.

loans.use: To increase stock for sale and seeds for farming

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia P. D. runs a business selling homemade meals typical of the tropical region in Pucallpa, Ucayali.  She serves cakes, sandwiches, tamales, and more from her home for breakfast and dinner.  Dalia owns a stand where she also serves delicious evening meals to the people of her neighborhood and others passing through.  
	
Dalia is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children.  Education is very important in her family so she makes sure all of her children get the opportunity to study.  She is proud of her business, happy to have a second income, and loves to cook.  
	
A member of the community bank Juan Zaplana Belliza, Dalia is requesting a loan of s/2000 (US$725) to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her meals such as sugar, milk, eggs, and butter.

loans.use: To buy ingredients of foods for sale

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.en: Alba Marina defines herself as “an experienced woman” in spite of the fact that she just is eighteen years old.  Actually, two years ago, her parents allowed her get married, but shortly afterward she had to come back to her parents’ home as she broke up with her husband. Now, Alba runs a small cafeteria that she just started last month. She sells sandwiches, hamburgers, spaghetti, natural juices and the like. Alba explains that after making the first investment, she doesn’t have enough capital to keep running her café suitably. So, she’s requesting a loan to buy raw materials and other goods for her cafeteria. Alba hopes that her business can generate sufficient money so that she can put aside some money for her upcoming university studies.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of goods for her small cafeteria.

loans.name: Fetoai

texts.en:
Fetoai S., 33, is married with 4 children. She has 3 years of experience in the taro plantation business and she sells to the villagers 2 days per week.

Fetoai has had 2 previous loans with SPBD. She now expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (about $US100). SPBD loans are Fetoai’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use part of her loan to purchase equipment and materials (cement, roofing materials, etc) to improve her home.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides, chemicals and weed killer

loans.name: Aknazar

texts.ru:
Aknazar T. lives in the J. Rumy region. He has a higher education and works as a doctor in the central hospital. He is married and has 4 children. In addition to his profession he has 7 years of experience in agriculture.

Aknazar rents land and plants watermelons and melons. Right now he needs to purchase fertilizer, which is why he is applying for a loan. By fertilizing plantings on time he will be able to get a quality harvest. Aknazar plans to pay back the loan over a 3 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тошматов Акназар житель района Джалолиддини Руми. Имеет высшее образование и работает врачом в центральной больнице района. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Кроме профессии он уже семь лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Арендует землю , которую засеивает арбузами и дынями. Сейчас необходимо закупить минеральные удобрения . Но для этого он планирует получить кредит. Обработав рассаду вовремя он сможет получить качественный урожай. Погасить кредит Акназар сможет в течении 3 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María has been a widow for 13 years. After getting over the pain of losing her life companion, María gained strength and educated and took care of her children by herself. She is dedicated to working the land and after the death of her husband, she had to redouble efforts to take care of living costs. Times have changed; for María, who sees rising prices and costs each day, the loan that she seeks will be used to buy fertilizer for her land. She wishes that her next harvest will be more productive than the previous one, so she can make large profits in the market. She goes through lots of trouble for this endeavor.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 13 años María quedó viuda, tras sobreponerse de la pena de perder a su compañero de toda la vida, María sacó fuerza y sola supo educar y cuidar de sus 6 hijos. Ella se dedica a los trabajos en el campo, y tuvo que redoblar esfuerzos para suplir los gastos en su casa, luego de la muerte de su esposo, es un trabajo duro, pero tuvo que hacerlo. Los tiempos han cambiado, y también para María que ve como los precios de lo que ella necesita a diario suben cada día, el préstamo que solicita hoy es para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes, ella desea que su próxima cosecha sea más productiva que la anterior, para obtener mayores ganancias en el mercado, y eso se puede lograr con esmero.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to cultivate her land

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, 47, is the mother of six, five of whom are independent, and her family remains her responsibility. She lives with her husband, a fisherman, who agrees with what Nelly has decided to do. She has been selling fish and plantains around her neighborhood for six years, and it has gone very well due to the very convenient and busy location. Nelly works from 6 to 10 A.M. What she likes about her store is that it generates a good income that is gradually increasing. What is difficult about the business is not having a booth to provide a better presentation of her products. Nelly works to pay for daily expenses and the education of her son. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to build her booth and stock it with select fish to give special attention to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly, de 47 años de edad es madre de 6 hijos, siendo 5 de ellos independientes y de familia, quedando el último a su cargo. Vive con su esposo Ignacio (pescador) quien está de acuerdo con lo que se propone Nelly. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y plátano en las fueras de su domicilio, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 6 años y le va muy bien ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitable y concurrida. Nelly atiende desde las 6 hasta las 10 de la mañana. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que le genera buenos ingresos y crece poco a poco. Lo más difícil es no tener un kiosco adecuado para dar una mejor presentación a sus productos. Nelly trabaja para los gastos diarios y la educación de su hijo. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir su kiosco e implementarse con pescado selectos y así dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Construction of a booth for better convenience and product sales.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva  vive en la calle Unión Fátima  de la zona villa cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su madre y sus hermanos. 

Se dedica al la venta ambulante de productos de belleza por lo cual recibe un porcentaje.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Eva lives on Unión Fátima street in the Villa Cooperative area of El Alto city. She lives with her mother and siblings. She is a traveling vendor who sells beauty products, and she receives a percentage of her sales. The loan will be used to buy merchandise. This is her second loan with Impro, and the evaluation qualifies her favorably for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to buy beauty products to resell

loans.name: Elza

texts.es: Elza tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, se dedica a la venta de comida y también de diversos objetos y adornos en un ambiente que acondicionó en su casa, se decidió por este negocio a razón de encontrarse ubicada en un lugar muy transitado. También brinda pensión (menú diario) a los trabajadores de una empresa. En la actualidad, su deseo es implementar su mercadería y adornos diversos, para aumentar sus ventas. Su esposo Eugenio la apoya en sus actividades y en las metas que propuestas. Elza muestra su esmero por mejorar, y que todo este esfuerzo es por bienestar del último de sus hijos, ya que los demás son profesionales e independientes. Tiene muchas ganas de surgir y ampliar su negocio,  por el que se muestra entusiasta y con confianza,  para que todo esto lo realice necesariamente requiere de un capital, el mismo que la hará cumplir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Elza is 38 years old and has 4 children. She sells food and a variety of objects and adornments from a space at her home, located at a very busy spot of the town. She also provides a set menu for factory workers. At the moment it is her wish to buy more merchandise and adornments to increase sales. Her husband Eugenio supports her with her activities and to reach her goals. Elza tries very hard to improve and the effort is for the benefit of the youngest of her children, they others are professionals and independent. She wishes her business to grow and improve and she feels very enthusiastic and confident about it. In order to achieve this she needs capital which will be spend on reaching her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business in food sale as well as sale of adornments.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es: Valeria A. A. es un miembro del banco comunal las gaviotas, que significa “seagulls” en español. Valeria se dedica a la venta de zapatos para niños, pero también venda zapatos para mayores.  Ella trabaja diario en uno de los mercados más visitados en la area. Utilizará su préstamo de 1000 soles para invertir en su negocio con la compra de zapatos. Actualmente ella estå ahorrando para comprar para comprar tierra para construir una casa propia. Ella quiere apoyar a sus hijos para que siguen adelante con sus estudios y desea seguir trabajando con su negocio,
texts.en:
Valeria A. A. is a member of the Las Gaviotas Community Bank, whose name means “the seagulls” in Spanish. Valeria sells shoes, mostly for children, but also various types for adults. She works daily at one of the busiest local markets in the area. She will use her loan of 1000 soles to invest in more shoes. She is currently saving to purchase her own land to build a house. She also hopes to ensure that her children continue studying and that she will be able to continue working on her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will use her loan of 1000 soles to invest in her business by purchasing more shoes

loans.name: Hermelinda Juana

texts.es:
Hermelinda forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II”, del distrito de Pariahuanca, provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.

Hermelinda tiene 28 años de edad y junto a su conviviente tienen un hijo y una hija. Su más grande dificultad ha sido enfrentar las carencias económicas, afirma que apoya a su conviviente, el cual vende abarrotes y los distribuye. Ha establecido en su casa un locutorio público el cual administra, pero le va regular porque en Pariahuanca no hay mucha población y no hay mucha cobertura en las líneas celulares, pero aún así ella asegura que se encuentra tranquila.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en el pago de las tarifas de las líneas del locutorio.
 
Hermelinda asevera que es necesario aprender para poder administrar mejor un negocio.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the “Mujeres Pariahuanquinas II” community bank, located in the district of Pariahuanca, Carhuaz province, department of Ancash. Hermelinda is 28 years old, and she lives with the father of her son and daughter. Her greatest challenge has been an economic shortage. She has the support of her common law husband who sells and delivers groceries. She has established in her home a public telephone which she runs, though her success has been limited, due to the small population in Pariahuanca and the limited cellular coverage. Even so, she says that she is doing well. With this 300 sol loan, which she will repay in 4 payments, she will invest in the payment of the bills for her telephone lines. Hermalinda asserts that it is necessary to learn in order to better administer a business.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in the payment of public telephone bills

loans.name: Maria Imelda

texts.es:
Imelda inició el negocio porqué el padre de sus hijos los abandonó y tenía que sostener a sus hijos y como quería darles lo mejor, fue por eso que decidió iniciar su negocio, ya que aunque era empleada en un Motel, el sueldo no le alcanzaba para darles todo. Comenzó  en 1982 vendiendo productos cosméticos entre sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos, en las noches también vendía cenas para completar para los gastos de la casa pues hijos estaban muy pequeños. Posteriormente, también empecé a vender productos de otra marca que es en la actualidad a lo que mas se dedica, además  también esta vendiendo billetes de lotería y ropa nueva.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $8,000 que pagara en 12 catorcenas  para comprar cosméticos y tener un surtido extenso para esta época de fin de año en donde los clientes demandan más productos.
texts.en:
Imelda started her business because the father of her children abandoned them and she had to support her children. She wanted to give her children the best life she could and although she was employed by a motel, she felt that she did not earn enough to provide her children with everything she wanted for them. In 1982 she began selling cosmetic products to her coworkers and neighbors. She also sold dinners at night in order to help pay for the household expenses since her children were very young. Later, she began selling products of a different brand and now spends the majority of her time selling these products. In addition, she sells lottery tickets and new clothes.

Imelda needs a loan for $8,000 MXN, which she will repay in 12 payments. The loan will be used to buy cosmetics so that she will have an extensive assortment of products to sell during the end of the year season, when her customers have a higher demand for her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rubén Cesar

texts.es:
