El señor Rubén Cesar H. y P. es soltero, el tiene un negocio propio de servicio de lavado de tractocamiones llamado “Servicio H.” el cual lleva 19 años de estar en operación, es atendido por él y un empleado, este negocio representa la principal fuente de ingresos de el señor Rubén Cesar.
El señor Rubén Cesar está solicitando un préstamo para comprar una maquina de presión para el lavado de tractocamiones, para que de esta manera el señor Rubén les pueda ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio y que sus ingresos se puedan incrementar.
texts.en:
Ruben Cesar H. y P. is single and he has his own car wash business called "Servicio H." (H. Services). He has been running this business for the past 19 years. He has one employee and this business represents the primary source of income for Ruben Cesar.

Ruben Cesar is requesting a loan to purchase a high pressure washer to use in his car wash business. This way Ruben will be able to offer his clients a better service and his earnings will be able to increase.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a high pressure washer for his car wash business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida Y. is a young entrepreneur. She is the owner of a business dedicated to the sale and activation of cell phones. Aida was able to obtain the necessary startup capital for her business from her parents who still advise her on her enterprise.  

The business is located in the center of the city of Tobatí, and Aida manages its affairs personally. She comments that in the cell phone market there is a lot of competition and to stay ahead, one must take good care of the business and above all, one must fulfill the requests of potential customers as quickly as possible.  

Aida will invest the funds she receives from Fundación Paraguaya in the purchase of cell phone cards and accessories. This will allow her to keep her business well-stocked and thus, she will be able to offer the wide variety of products and services that are associated with cellphones in today’s market.  

Aida says that in the future she plans to open a branch of her business near the Church of Tobatí because, as it is the most frequently visited place in the city, the possibility of increased sales is higher there than it is anywhere else.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of cell phone cards and accessories, etc.

loans.name: Jeanneth

texts.en:
Jeanneth P., 26 and single, is a resident of Poblacion, Catarman, Camiguin Province. At her young age,she already feels the financial crisis in life. She finds ways and means to help her parents and her 3 brothers who are still studying.

Jeanneth ventured into running a sari-sari store (variety store) to address the needs of the villagers. She started her business with a small capital of her own. And now, she continues her dreams to be a leading sari-sari store in the village. With this goal in mind, Jeanneth needs to have an additional capital amounting to PHP 4000 to purchase grocery items for sale. She hopes that someday, out of her profit, she can have enough money for the renovation of their house.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Mirna María

texts.es:
La señora Mirna O. se ha destacado por vender los productos plásticos tales como bolsas de todo tipo, platos, vasos, cucharas y panas siendo este su negocio al que se dedica desde hace cinco años.

Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su situación económica y para ello ha buscado la forma de mejorar buscando el refugio en Ceprodel el cual ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los productos plásticos ya que se le están agotando y requiere llenar sus estantes para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mirna O. has made herself stand out by selling plastic products such as all types of bags, plates, glasses, spoons and other common household items. She has worked selling plastic items for 5 years. With a good deal of effort, she has successfully improved her financial situation. After looking for the best way to accomplish this she has sought refuge with Ceprodel and is requesting a loan for the purchase of plastic products since she is running out of inventory. She needs to fill her shelves in order to continue satisfying her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Two of them are currently independent but the others are pursuing education in the senior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming community called Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Being a resourceful mother, Mary works assiduously to support her husband in providing for the family, especially the kids' schooling. Mary is a petty trader. She deals in all kinds of bottled and canned soft drinks: malt, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Pepsi, etc. She procures the drinks from wholesale dealers in the national capital of Accra and sells in the community market.

She has been in this very business for the past seven years and wants a loan to procure assorted drinks in bulk. She believes the loan assistance would enable her to make timely delivery of stock to serve a larger market and eventually help improve her family finances.

loans.use: To procure soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 39 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Esther is a tailor and she also sells tailoring materials. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 ($350 US) to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 43 years old and cooks glutinous rice cakes in their village in Magsaysay Naguillan, Isabela. She is married to Rodolfo A. who is now 50 years old. They have three children; the eldest is now married, her second child is working in a private company while her youngest child Jonicio, who is 19 years old, does not want to continue college.

Fely is requesting a second loan of PHP 7,000. She has been in business since 1994 and would like to use her loan to market her products outside of her village and increase her income. She is currently able to generate PHP 500 daily income from selling her glutinous products. She is thankful that from her daily income, she is able to help her husband with their important necessities at home. According to her, it really requires a lot of patience if you want to gain more in your business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: A. Pascaline est âgée de 56 ans. Pascaline est originaire de GUEZIN un village lacustre du Département de MONO au BENIN. Pascaline est mère de quatre enfants: deux garçons et deux filles, tous majeurs. Pascaline est veuve depuis dix sept (17) ans. Pascaline vit et exerce son commerce dans la maison de son fils aîné à minontchou, un quartier périphérique de la ville de COTONOU, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Pascaline vend depuis quinze (15) ans des produits divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, huile de noix de palme et d'arachide, pétrole lampant, etc.) Pascaline a eu déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé. Pascaline sollicite présentement un troisième prêt de ALIDé pour mieux développer son activité.
texts.en:
A. Pascaline is 56 years old. Pascaline is originally from GUEZIN, a village near lakes in the Department of Mono in Benin. She is the mother of 4 children: two sons and two daughters, all adults.

Pascaline has been a widow for 17 years. She lives and conducts her business in the home of her elder son in Minontchou, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. For 15 years, she has been selling various products (candy, cookies; tins of milk, sardines, tomatoes; sugar, pasta, detergent, dish soap, hand soap, palm oil and peanut oil, kerosene, etc.)

Pascaline has already had 2 loans from ALIDé. She is now requesting her third loan from ALIDé so that she can better develop her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a jerry can of 25 liters of palm oil, 2 jerry cans of 25 liters of peanut oil, 50 liters of kerosene, two cartonse deux cases of candy, two cases of cookies and 50 kg of manioc flour

loans.name: Zeblon's Group

texts.en:
Zeblon M. is the chairperson of Ntenjeru group in Kayunga. He is a 56 year old farmer who grows cassava, maize, beans, and banana plantations on his three acres of land. He employs manpower to help ease his farming duties, hence making profits in a short while. He is married with 12 children. Four of his children are still in school while the rest are business people like their father. He has been in business for seven years and loans have helped him buy high quality yields to generate sufficient income.

Zeblon also sells charcoal that he buys from deep in the villages, hence bringing in extra income. He needs a loan to help buy more sacks of charcoal and to buy more produce for sale.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal and more produce for sale.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Don Sergio M. de 42 años de edad, es casado, con 3 hijos, el mayor de 22 años, la segunda de 20 y un niño de 9 años, unicamente tiene a su cargo al mas pequeño puesto que los 2 mayores son casados.  Se desempeña como operario de limpieza en la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa desde hace 17 años; actualmente esta solicitando su primer credito para terminar con la construccion de un cuarto para que su hija pueda habitar con su esposo y gozar de mayor privacidad y comodidad en el patio de su casa, ya tiene levantadas las paredes, pero le falta poner el techo, embaldozar y poner las puertas.  El mayor sueño de don Sergio es poder apoyar a sus hijos en lo que mas pueda, pues es la unica herencia que puede dejarles.
texts.en:
42-year old Sergio M. is married and has three children; the eldest is 22, the second is 20, and the youngest is 9. Only his son, the 9-year old, is still dependent on him as the two older children are married. Sergio has worked as a cleaner in Juigalpa’s town hall for seventeen years. He is asking for his first loan to finish the construction of a bedroom in the yard of his house so that his daughter and her husband can enjoy more privacy and comfort. He has already built the walls, but the room lacks a roof, which will need tiling, and also doors. Sergio’s greatest dream is to be able to support his children in whatever way he can as that is the only gift he can bequeath them.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a tiled roof

loans.name: Ziada

texts.en:
Ziada is a member of the Makongoro borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 23-year-old married woman.
 
Ziada started her own business three years ago selling clothes. She works eight hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 100,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Ziada’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, she hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Deysi Guadalupe

texts.es: Deysi Guadalupe R. H. reside en Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador, vive  con madre y  su esposo Jose que trabaja como empleado ganando mensualmente $200.00 US con los que aporta a su esposa para los gastos de la casa. Deysi  maneja su propio negocio una tienda ubicada en su casa de domicilio, la tienda de Deysi es la preferida en la colonia ya que Deysi se preocupa por mantener en su negocio lo que lo clientes más demandan y también ella es una persona muy amable al atenderlos cuando llegan  a su negocio, el crédito que solicita Deysi en esta oportunidad es para compra de productos de los que carece en este momento, con la ayuda de su crédito la tienda Deysi seguirá siendo la preferida de su colonia.
texts.en:
Deysi Guadalupe R. H. lives Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her mother and her husband, Jose, who works and whose $200.00 monthly paycheck goes to support his wife and pay the household expenses. Deysi manages her own business - a store located in a residential home. Deysi's store is already a neighborhood favorite since she makes sure that her shop maintains her customers' most requested items, and she is also a very friendly person and attentive when people come into her store. The loan that Deysi is seeking would buy the products that are currently out of stock. With the help if this loan, Deysi's store will continue to be a favorite of the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to supply her store

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. is 40 years old is a rice grower. She has no child but a husband who is very supportive of her in all her endeavors. She started helping her spouse tilling a 1-hectare farm last 2000. From then on, she learns to love the soil as well as the rice plant because this is their only source of living to buy her whole family needs.

She requested a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farming necessities. She would like also to use her loan to some other business that she likes to be able to augment their family income. 

Getting comfortable with CEVI services, she said, that she will continue to avail a loan in CEVI because it has the lowest interest rate compared to other micro finance that 
lent to her before.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia B. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Herminia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Herminia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Herminia is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 7th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ijau

texts.en: Ijau S. is currently in the business of selling pulses, beans etc  and is requesting a loan to stock more beans to sell.  Ijau is 32 years old and is Widowed.   She has 1 child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her daughter BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Sa Rorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sa Rorn C. lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province and she breeds pigs. As well as breeding pigs, she sells vegetables in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Met Chor, is a coconut seller. Mrs. C. is asking for a loan to buy six more piglets and a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. She is 31 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school. The other two are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy six more piglets and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Chhet

texts.en: Chhet L. was born in 1980. She is a married woman and blessed with a young school-aged child. Her 33-year-old husband, Chanthol, works as a local merchantman. He also orders produce in bulk and deals in retail to the market seller. To make a living, Chhet L. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs for a profit. Due to the fact that the rice harvest is approaching, Chhet L. is requesting a loan for her husband to use as capital in order to buy rice at the cheapest price from the farmers. They propose to sell when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To buys rice at cheapest price from farmers and they propose to sell it when the rice is commanding highest price

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona J. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol, and is requesting a loan to purchase hardware materials, e.g. iron sheets, nails, cement, etc. Lona is 20 years old and is married to a business man. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hardware shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase hardware materials to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk

loans.name: Onome

texts.en: Onome is 34 years old, married with 3 children. Her eldest child is 13 years old while the youngest child is 2 years old. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist and he also supports the home. She sells baby clothes and things by hawking. She hopes to own a stall in the future. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more baby clothes and things to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby clothes and things to sell

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
el sr. Raul R. tiene 56 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, su casa de habitacion esta ubicada en la colonia 17 septimbre, vive en union libre y no tiene dependientes.
se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia que posee desde hace unos 12 años en donde vende jabon, frescos, maiz, churros, pasta dental, papel higienico y todo lo relacionado a la canasta basica familiar
 
esta solicitando el crédito para comprar algunos productos que le hacen falta para cubrir con las necesidades de sus clientes.
 
Raul es un sr. de edad y esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, este credito lo necesita para salir adelante con su compañera de hogar y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
su sueño es tener un negocio grande en la zona.
texts.en:
Sr. Raul R. is 56 years old and lives in the city of San Lorenzo. His home is located in the September 17th neighborhood. He is in a common law marriage and has no dependents.

Raul sells popular consumer products. Twelve years ago, he opened his store where he sells soap, soft drinks, corn, churros (fried pastries similar to doughnuts), toothpaste, toilet paper, and other basic household products.

He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so that he can continue to meet the needs of his customers. Raul is an older gentleman and this is his only source of income. This loan is needed so that he and his wife can continue to support themselves and have a better quality of life. His dream is to have a bigger business in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Maria es casada y tiene 34 años, Maria tiene una farmacia en un local alquilado en el centro de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicinas.
Los sueños de Maria es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Agua Viva ("Living Waters") communal bank. She is 34 years old and married. Maria runs a pharmacy in rented business space in the city center, where she works every day. Maria needs a loan of 1200 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in purchasing medicines. Maria's dream is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing medicines

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more oil, rice and flour.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn M. is a single parent who solely bears the challenges of raising and supporting the needs of her only child Rojene. Though she and Rojene lives together with her parents, she doesn’t like to depend on them for their own needs, especially for her child’s. Therefore, when she heard about ASHI in their village, she joined this group of four women who have common dream in life - to live out of poverty.

After everyone in the group she joined in ASHI was recognized as an official member, she requested a loan which she will use to start up a business that she will grow some day. Arlyn plans to purchase a pig for fattening and sell it either alive or slaughtered after four months of raising. Through her profits she hopes to someday make her life stable so that she can live independently of her parents.

loans.use: To purchase a pig for fattening and selling.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy J., 52, is making sure that he provides enough for his family's daily needs. Married to Gemma J., they are blessed with one child. He makes sure that he provides well so that their family can have a better life.  He has been buying and selling a variety of products.

Willy has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. He regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays his weekly dues consistently. Because of his good repayment performance with his previous loans, he has been able to borrow seven times in CCT’s Cooperative.  He is consistent in paying his dues because he uses the money he borrowed to expand and improve his business.

Now with your help, he would like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for buying equipment and products needed to continue the operations of his business.

He dreams that his business will continue to grow so that he can have a good and comfortable life with his family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy equipment and products needed to continue the operations of his business.

loans.name: Oralia Mercedes

texts.es:
El Señor ORALIA MERCEDES G. L., Labora como Responsable de Computo en el mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua, es casada y madres de dos niños a los que tiene en el colegio ella junto con su esposo han podido sacar a delate la familia.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Oralia Mercédes González López is the Technology Manager at Managua's Roberto Huembés Market. She is married and the mother of two high school aged children. Together with her husband, she has helped her family get ahead. She will invest this loan in building materials to remodel her home to make it more secure and thereby provide better living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to home

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin A., J.. is a 55-year-old man from the village of Olango. Benjamin is married and has 2 school-age children. To earn a living, Benjamin owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. More specifically, his main source of income is derived from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Benjamin has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP during the harvest season.

In 2008, Benjamin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. In turn, he was able to engage in business activities and to improve his standard of living. Benjamin has successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. The previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Benjamin is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 35,000 PHP ($800), which will also be used to purchase fertilizers, including manure. Notably, this loan would be the fifth loan taken out by Benjamin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches, which cover the Central and Northeastern areas of the country. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To further expand his business by purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Mathida

texts.en: Mathida is a 53-year-old widow with nine children. Life as a widow is highly challenging, and she hopes to overcome the challenge. Mathida owns a grocery store selling groceries and drinks at retail prices, a business she has been in for a long time. Now requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell, she says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a 49 year old lady who has been practicing farming since 2004 in Kiambu, Kenya.

Rachael plants trees for timber and rears dairy cows for milk production and supply. She describes her business environment as good and supplies her products to Nairobi.

Rachael is a member of Waiyaki Self Help Group whose members have guaranteed her a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya. With this loan, Rachael intends to buy another dairy cow to increase her milk production.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 25 years old and is married with two children aged 2 months and 4 years. His eldest child is currently attending school.

James is a farmer in Kitale town in Western Kenya where he has been farming for three years. His major products are maize, milk and beans which he sells to the local market. He is also a motorbike mechanic (he is pictured on one of the motorbikes). His biggest challenges in farming are competition and, in the future, poultry diseases.

James has requested this loan Kes 20,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry project. He feels that the extra income from this project will enable him take care of his family. In future, he intends to take another loan that will enable him to expand and acquire other essential assets related to poultry.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita O. is from the village of Talon, Gingoog City. She is 42 years old. Mercedita is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Mercedita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mercedita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Mercedita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason J. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 28 years old. Jason is single. To make a living, Jason owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motor transport services. Jason has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Jason joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jason has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Jason is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing engine. This will be the 18th loan taken out by Jason from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing engine

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Anta de la provincia  Anta y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Alejandra; ella tiene 49 años de edad y La socia es natural de Iscuchaka, Ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos, la socia no pudo estudiar nunca desde muy pequeña ayudo a sus padres por ser la mayor de 8 hermanos y se puso a trabajar desde muy niña aprendiendo el oficio del comercio minorista,  ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores, la socia compra aves de corral y cuyes y los vende una vez que alcanzan la etapa de la madurez para la venta y la reproducción de los mismos.  Su conyugue es agricultor y ella también cuando no tiene este negocio salida vende leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer de el un capital de trabajo y comprar animales para abastecer su negocio. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY YUNGAQUI”, and she lives in the Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department. The member is Mrs. Alejandra, 49, and a native of Isuchaka. She is married and has 3 children. She couldn't go to school because from the time she was very little, she helped her parents because there were 8 children in the family. She began to work since she was a little girl in retail. She buys and sells young animals. She purchases poultry and guinea pigs and sells them when they are grown and ready for breeding. Her partner is a farmer and Alejandra works as a farmer as well. When she isn't doing this work, she sells milk. The member is requesting a loan for working capital to buy animals to stock her business. She values and infinitely appreciates the loan offered her since this will help her increase her business and improve her quality of living, and she promises to make the payments in the scheduled timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan for working capital to buy animals to stock her business.

loans.name: Estefa

texts.es:
Estefa nació en Ocongate y actualemnte vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. Estefa tiene un stand en el mercado de “Vino Canchón” del distrito de San Jerónimo de la provincia del Cusco donde vende gelatinas, mates, pastales y etc.  Le pueden encontrar en su puesto, que está equipado con mesas y sillas, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 noche o hasta que se agote el suministro de panes.  Un flujo regular de clientes visita su puesto y el negocio se anima bastante durante la hora del desayuno. Su esposo aporta a la canasta familiar con las ganancias que obtiene de la compra y venta de oro y plata.  
	
Con su próximo préstamo, Estefa espera recibir $ 1000 USD. Por el momento, su restaurante está equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero para darle capital de negocio a su esposo para que compre oro y plata. 

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Estefa es una de las fundadoras del banco comunal y le va muy bien.
texts.en:
Estefa was born in Ocongate but he now lives in the city of Cusco togther with her husband and their four children. Estefa has a stand in the market Vino Canchon, located in the district of San Jeronimo in the province of Cusco. She sells gelatins, pastries, cakes etc. People can come and sit down at her stand because it is equipped with tables and chairs. She is open for business 7 days a week from 7 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon, or until she has sold out of her foods. She counts on a regular influx of clients, especially during the breakfast rush hour. Her husband contributes to the family's finances by purchasing and reselling gold and silver. Estefa requests a loan in the amount of $1000 US. currently the restaurant is set up with only the most basic things. She would like to use these funds to have working capital and share with her husband to purchase more gold and silver. The community bank named The Lionesses of San Jeronimo has had 10 loan cycles. Estefa is one of the founding members of the community bank and she has enjoyed its benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cerilo

texts.en:
Cerilo R. is from the village of Sebasi Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 50 years old. Cerilo is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Cerilo owns and operates a motorcycle transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from operating a motorcycle "habal-habal" service (this is a motorcycle modified to seat more than two persons, which is common in the Philippines). Cerilo has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cerilo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerilo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Cerilo is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Cerilo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Gbla Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “G.” group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva in order to improve their businesses.
 
The leader of this group is Agnes K. who is thirty-seven and was born in Magburaka. She is married with four children: two in primary school and two in secondary school.

For eight years now, Agnes has made a living through selling ready-to-wear clothes and shoes. She is requesting this loan in order to buy clothes and shoes in large quantity to add to her stock. 

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes in large quantity

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has lived in Lahore in a two-room brick house with her family for the last 10 years. Lahore is the second largest city in Pakistan. A very talented Shahnaz owns & operates her embroidery business at her home. She makes embroidered dresses for her neighboring clients. Earlier, she made embroidery dresses for her relatives but now she is receiving orders from her neighbors as well. She is good at her art and knows many embroidery techniques. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes, which are admired by her customers and this gives her encouragement to work with more dedication and enthusiasm. She earns a good profit by completing orders. The earnings allow her to pay for the household utilities. Her husband appreciates her for her helping and caring nature towards the family.  

She is the mother of six children. All of them are illiterate and couldn’t get an education due to financial constraints. Her husband is a government employee and her eldest son has an embroidery shop in the market where he embroiders dresses and contributes financially to his family. He started learning this art from his mother at an early age. 
 
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, her son will buy embroidery items such as beads, colored thread and clothes in bulk, which will enable him to make more embroidered dresses to display in his shop to attract customers. Shahnaz is hopeful that, by investing the loan money in her son’s business, her son will be able to expand his business and increase his income as well. This is her first loan and she hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who is slightly raising her hand is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for her son's embroidery business

loans.name: Ochirpurev

texts.en:
Ochirpurev C. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both his children, ages 15 and 11, attend local school while his wife operates a sewing business at home. His son has a congenital decease of hip dislocation and has to be under treatment all the time.

 Ochirpurev operates an iron crafting business in his town. Before starting his iron craft business, he worked as a plumber in the school between 1989 and 1998. Since 1998, he started his own business by operating an electricwelding service in his home. He produces a variety of chimney and iron doors for fences in his own workplace that was built and completed in his yard. Moreover, he makes trailer and carriage bodies for vehicles according to customers' orders. Currently, he made contracts with construction companies to produce a variety of fence's doors, fence and roof items etc.

Over the many years of work, he has built a stable and successful operation and has gained much experience as a craftsman. Ochirpurev says, " I am one of first iron smiths in my town therefore my products are known and popular in the local community. It is good to learn and have one's skill". He is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan in order to purchase awelding machine with high capacity and steels and irons used for making stove pipe, chimney, door etc, for his iron craft business.

loans.use: To purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina operates a business buying & selling frozen foods. She started this business only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. The business is a big help for the family in covering their expenses and allows them to set aside savings for the future. The couple is requesting a new loan of PhP 20,000 to buy additonal inventory of frozen foods to sell. The proceeds of her business give her money to support the immediate and basic needs of her family. 

Carina hopes that her business will become successful someday. She wishes also to engage in more businesses that will provide her family a supplementary income thus augment her husband’s income. Along with the business success she is dreaming about is the hope to see the graduation of her two children at college level and to see them find a stable job. Carina wants to thank ASHI/Kiva lenders who are supporting this loan. That is one of the greatest chances for her to begin reaching for her goals.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca N. lives In Kamwokya Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has eight children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members ( in-laws ).  Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.   

Rebecca has a business of selling fruit and vegetables. She has been in this business for more than 10 years, and she works every day. Rebecca sells her products from home. She also generates additional income through her rental rooms. The main business challenges for Rebecca include competition and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing these fruits herself.

Rebecca has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of oranges, tomatoes, onions and cabbages to sell.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of oranges, onions, tomatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Dandy

texts.en:
Mr. Dandy E. is from the Barangay of Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He is 44 years old, and married to Elizabeth E. a DSWD worker in their barangay. They are blessed with 4 children; 3 are now school aged and the other 1 is still an infant. To make a living, he is presently engaged in driving a motorcycle for hire and  farming activity. He is also presently elected as Barangay Councilor. He’s been engaged in this kind of job for more than 15 years. He is earning an average amount of not less than Php4,500.00 as his monthly income from driving and an honorarium as an official. 

Just this year, Dandy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dandy as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program is now requesting a loan of Php10,000.00 as his 1st loan which will be used for purchasing commercial fertilizer for his rice production activity. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansions.


 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase commercial fertizer for his rice production activity

loans.name: Huantai

texts.en: Huantai J. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two teenage daughters in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both his daughters, ages 16 and 14, attend a local high school. Huantai operates a transportation business between provinces and, during winter months, he operates a coal-delivery business using his own truck. He began his transportation business in 2000 and has gained much experience as a driver. He purchases coal at a per ton rate of 19,600 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) from mines and spends between 250,000 and 300,000 MNT in petrol costs. He makes three to four trips in one month and can deliver up to 13 tons of coal using his big Russian truck and trailer in one trip. His monthly average profit is between 300,000 and 400,000 MNT. Huantai is a hardworking and honest man and says, "I am very glad that I can provide (for) my family by operating this business." He is requesting a 350,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts for his truck.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Yeni Luz

texts.es: Yeni Luz R. S. de 33 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, en donde vive junto a su esposo y un hijo de 3 años de edad. Yeni y su familia son personas muy queridas en su lugar de habitación en donde se les conocer por ser personas responsables. Yeni posee un negocio de venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres, jóvenes y niños, la cual comercializa en su casa de habitación, un lugar de mucho comercio en la zona. Yeni solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir, de manera que pueda contar con una gran variedad de ropa para las fechas de fin de año, las cuales son muy importante para todos los comerciantes debido a que las ventas crecen significativamente. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a Yeni ya que podrá darle todo lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en: Yeni Luz R. S. is 33 years old. She lives in the department of Ahuachapán together with her husband and their three-year-old son. Yeni and her family are really loved in their neighborhood because they are known as reliable and responsible people. Yeni has a retail business; she sells clothing for men, women, young people, and children. She runs her store from her home which is located in a very commercial area. Yeni is asking for a loan to increase her inventory of clothing so that she could have a larger variety of items available for sale during the end of the year holiday season, which is a key season for all retail merchants given that the sales increase substantially. This gives Yeni a lot of hope since she will be able to provide the very best for her son.

loans.use: Compra de ropa para vender.

loans.name: Huyagbaatar

texts.en: Huyagbaatar T. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent in the city of Harhorin in  Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His son attends a secondary school in town. Huyagbaatar, with his wife operates a dairy product trading business. He started his dairy product selling business in 2008 at the “Manlai” local market. He goes to the countryside in his car to buy large amounts of dairy products. He then  sell the products in his sisters store. Huyagbaatar is planning to buy a new car for his business. He is a very hardworking person and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To purchase a  new car

loans.name: Constructor Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “CONSTRUCTOR” es un grupo de 7 mujeres y 1 varón que están iniciando su segundo ciclo.  El primer ciclo la asociación fue conociéndose mejor, en general fue positivo, por lo que han decidido continuar como banca comunal y solicitar nuevamente los servicios de Pro Mujer. 
Cada una de las socias tiene negocio propio, de servicio, producción o comercio. Por ejemplo,venta de sombreros, costura y venta de chamarras, venta de sombreros, venta de chuño y mote, venta de gelatinas, artesanìa en cinturones.

La B. C. Urkupiña a elegido para su organización una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Octavia, una tesorera, la señora  Basilia  y una secretaria de actas, la señora Adela.

La  Presidenta, la señora  Octavia vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos.  El negocio que lleva adelante la señora Octavia es la venta de detergentes en la Feria de la zona donde vive.  Las ferias son los días miércoles y sábado, el horario de venta es de 7 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde.  Inició este negocio por que la cuñada le animó.

Cuando se le consulta a la señora Octavia  qué es lo que le atrae de la institución, ella responde “me gusta todo, solo me siento mal si alguien se atrasa o no trae la cuota”.
texts.en: The "Constructor" community bank is a group of seven women and one man who are beginning their second loan cycle. The members were getting to know each other better over the first loan, and in general it was positive, which is why they have to decided to continue as a community bank and request a new loan from Kiva partner Pro Mujer. Each one of the members has his or her own business, as a service provider, producer or merchant. For example, they sell hats, sow and sell jackets, sell potato flour and corn, sell jellies, and make craft belts. The community bank elected a board of directors consisting of a president, Octavia; a treasurer, Basilia; and a secretary, Adela. Octavia, the president, lives with her husband and two children. She makes a living selling detergents at flea markets in the area where she lives. The markets are on Wednesdays and Saturdays, and she sells items from 7 a.m. until 1 p.m. She started the business after her sister-in-law suggested it. When asked what attracted her to the community bank, Octavia said, "I enjoy everything. I only feel bad if someone is late or doesn't bring a payment."

loans.use: Purchase powdered detergents

loans.name: Dame

texts.fr: Monsieur Dame K. est un boutiquier qui gère une alimentation générale à Mbour au quartier Médine Extension il exerce ce métier depuis prés de 4 ans. Il est célibataire et soutien de famille. Médine étant un quartier enclavé monsieur K. a voulu investir dans le secteur alimentaire. Ainsi, il vient solliciter ce crédit pour le renforcement des marchandises dont sa population a besoin
texts.en: Mr Dame K. is a storekeeper who runs a grocery in the neighborhood Médine Extension in Mbour. He has been in this trade for nearly 4 years. He is single and supports his family. Since Médine is located in the center of an area with dense population, Mr K. decided to invest in the food sector. Therefore he applies for this loan to buy the goods that people need.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida has lived in Okara for 20 years. Okara is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area of 49/2-L with her family in a four-room brick house. She has four children: three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son drives a rickshaw.  The others are getting their education in a local school. 

Khalida is 52 years old and married to M. S., who is a farmer. He works in the fields, growing different crops. After cultivating the crops, he sells the produce to customers.  To share the family's financial burden with her husband, Khalida sells milk to her community clients. She keeps a buffalo that she milks early each morning and customers come to her home to purchase the milk.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase fertilizer, seeds and other supplies to get the maximum output from his fields.  He has been in this business for the past five years and Khalida is very hopeful that he will be able to expand it after the loan investment. 

Khalida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan, she established good credit and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort F. has been running a provision store in Effiakuma Estate, near Takoradi, for the past nine years. She also sells food items such as those displayed on a table behind her in the photo.  Educated up to senior high school, she is married and has two children 
Her income supplements her husband’s, who is a photographer, and helps pay for the household expenses.
She plans to expand her business by using the loan to acquire additional goods for resale.

loans.use: To acquire additional goods for resale.

loans.name: Pablo Victor

texts.es:
Pablo Victor T. S., es soltero, tiene 19 años de edad, es agronomo, se dedica a la agronomía, tiene 3 años de experiencia trabajando para otra persona, y ahora quiere empezar su propio bibero, por esa razon solicita un prèstamo a ASDIR, para poder comprar semillas, sembrar estos para que puedan germinar y crecer para poder venderlos cuando hayan crecido. Quiere cultivar flores y mora. 

Epera que con el credito pueda mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia, ya que es en su propio negocio donde quiere invertir.
texts.en: Pablo Victor T. S. is single.  He is 19 years old and an agronomist.  He has three years experience working for another person and now he would like to start his own nursery.  He is requesting a loan from ASDIR to buy seeds.  He will sow his seeds so that they can germinate and grow.  He will then sell them when they have grown.  Pablo would like to grow flowers and blackberries.  He hopes that this loan will help to improve his family's living conditions.  He would like to invest in his own business.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: El Espacio Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el espacio, uno de los integrantes sugirió este nombre para el grupo, ya que dice que en ninguna otra micro financiera le dan la oportunidad a los hombres de ingresar yaqui si, esta historia es acerca del señor Daniel L. S., (mejor conocido como don dani, ya que así le dicen sus vecinos), puesto que es el representante de esta UDE, el tiene 40 años de edad es soltero, tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva 19 años.
Daniel eligió esta actividad, puesto que es lo que mejor se vende en su comunidad, también porque dice que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, que le ayuda para continuar apoyando la economía de su familia, el invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas mercancía como son: refrescos, arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, leche, jabón, clara sol y papel higiénico
La meta que dice tener don dani para su negocio, es la de continuar invirtiéndole mucho mas, ya que lo quiere hacer crecer, puesto que está pensando en ampliar su local, para tenerlo muy bien surtido y así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias, para poder continuar apoyando a su padre ya que está muy grande de edad.
Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien, puesto que todos los integrantes se conocen perfectamente y son personas muy responsables con sus pagos y sobre todo bien trabajadores.
Las personas que conforman el grupo son las siguientes: inocencia, Carmela, enelva, blanca, María, maura, Daniel, Lizbeth, Edith y Estefanía, quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: abarrotes, venta de pescados, elaboración de tamales, frutería, venta de cosméticos, etc.
texts.en:
This group's name is El Espacio (The Space). One of the members suggested this name for the group, explaining that this is the only microfinance institution to give them the opportunity to join. 

This is the story of Daniel L. S. (better known as Don Dani, as his neighbors call him) since he is the representative for the development group ("UDE"). Daniel is a 40-year-old single man who has run a small grocery store for 19 years now. He chose this business because groceries are the best thing to sell in his community. He also says it's a very good source of income which allows him to continue supporting his family.

Daniel will use the loan to purchase more merchandise such as: soft drinks, rice, sugar, salt, oil, milk, soap, Clarasol cleaner and toilet paper. Don Dani's goal for his store is to continue investing in it because he wants it to grow. He would like to expand his store in order to stock it well and gain more income. This will help him to continue supporting his very elderly father.

Daniel told us how well his group works together. All of the members know each other well and are very responsible when it comes to making payments. Above all, they are very hardworking individuals. The group's members are: Inocencia, Carmela, Enelva, Blanca, María, Maura, Daniel, Lizbeth, Edith and Estefanía. They all have different jobs such as: selling groceries, selling fish, making tamales, selling fruit and selling cosmetics etc.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as: soft drinks, rice, sugar, salt, oil, milk, soap, Clarasol cleaner and toilet paper.

loans.name: Jesibel

texts.en:
Jecibel P., who is 37, aims for completeness in life. Jecibel completed high school and is in relationship right now with Richard Domasig, a carpenter. They have been blessed with four children who are currently studying in elementary school. Together they live in Balubad, Silang, Cavite, Philippines.

Jecibel has been retailing rice to her neighbors for quite a few years now.  Basically, she buys sacks of rice at a wholesale price and retails them to her neighbors by the kilo with a minimum mark up.  Along with this, she also incorporates within her store the retailing of cell phone load credits to all mobile network users among her community. Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of around Php10,000.

To help her continue operation of her businesses, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this to pay for additional sacks of rice and purchase more cell phone load credits for retailing.

Jecibel desires a successful business, a healthy body, and a peaceful and happy life. She also prays that she will be able to send all her children all the way through college. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional sacks of rice and more cell phone credits for retailing

loans.name: Marie Claudine

texts.en:
Marie Claudine is 37 years old and is married. She has three children between the ages of 4 and 16 years old. She sells different items such as: crafts, drawing etc. Her business is well-organized. She employees one person to help her. Marie Claudine has seven years experience and she runs her business from 6.30am until 9pm every day.

Marie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more different items for her arts business like: crafts, drawing etc. With the extra profits, Marie Claudine will expand her business and save money for her future.

loans.use: To expand her arts business.

loans.name: Nancy Coral

texts.es: La señora Nancy Coral es una mujer muy trabajadora junto con su esposo que desean ofrecer a su familia una mejora calidad de vida. Esta joven pareja viven en la casa de la mama de la suegra que les ofrece la parte alta de la casa para que construyan su propio patrimonio que en algún futuro será de ellos. Nancy es madre de un pequeña y uno que viene en camino es por ello que se desea iniciar con la construcción de un cuarto en la planta alta para tener mayor privacidad y dar a sus hijos su propio espacio. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Nancy Coral is a very hard working woman who, together with her husband, wants to offer her family a better quality of life.  This young couple live in her mother-in-law’s mother’s house and she is offering them the upper part of the house for them to build their own patrimony which some day in the future will be theirs.

Nancy is the mother of a little girl and has another child on the way so she wants to start construction of a room upstairs to have more privacy and give her children a space of their own.  To do this project, she needs to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to build a room upstairs.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto tiene 46 años de edad, está casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos en una comunidad pequeña (de condición pobre) ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope en Lambayeque.

Ernesto es un hombre trabajador que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Él se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace 5 años. Actualmente, Ernesto, cuenta con ganado porcino que cría en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Ernesto vende sus animales quincenalmente en la ciudad de Chiclayo y Lambayeque donde ya cuenta con clientela fija. Adicionalmente, Ernesto, se dedica a la agricultura y al jornal.

Ernesto solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado porcino. Así como, para comprar fertilizantes para sus labores agrícolas.

Ernesto quiere superarse y ver crecer a sus hijos de manera adecuada. Por ello es necesario para él prosperar en sus negocios y éste préstamo le sería de suma utilidad para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Ernesto tiene 46 años de edad, está casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos en una comunidad pequeña (de condición pobre) ubicada a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope en Lambayeque.

Ernesto es un hombre trabajador que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Él se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace 5 años. Actualmente, Ernesto, cuenta con ganado porcino que cría en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Ernesto vende sus animales quincenalmente en la ciudad de Chiclayo y Lambayeque donde ya cuenta con clientela fija. Adicionalmente, Ernesto, se dedica a la agricultura y al jornal.

Ernesto solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado porcino. Así como, para comprar fertilizantes para sus labores agrícolas.

Ernesto quiere superarse y ver crecer a sus hijos de manera adecuada. Por ello es necesario para él prosperar en sus negocios y éste préstamo le sería de suma utilidad para cumplir sus metas.

loans.use: Comprar alimento balanceado y fertilizantes.

loans.name: Maksuda's Group

texts.en:
Maksuda is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Uzgen, a beautiful ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 47 and divorced, and has raised four children by herself. She has three sons and a daughter; her youngest son and her daughter study at school and her other two sons are employed.

Maksuda is engaged in farming; she cultivates agricultural products and then sells them in order to make money to meet the family's daily needs. She has applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to purchase mineral fertilizers. In the near future, Maksuda plans to celebrate her children’s weddings. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en: Varduhi lives in Yerevan with her husband and two school-aged daughters. She graduated from teacher-training college and worked at a school for about 10 years. Seven years ago, she rented a shop where she creates flower arrangements and wedding baskets, and also sells wedding accessories. Thanks to a previous Kiva loan, Varduhi was also able to start renting evening dresses. Now she is applying for a new loan for $3,000 to buy new items to sell to her customers, including a perfumery.

loans.use: To buy a perfumery for her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene muchas energías para seguir trabajando, tiene 58 años y vive sola en su casa que es propia. En su tierra natal ha trabajado como agricultora así como en la crianza de animales, sus padres siempre le encomendaron cuidar del ganado ovino y vacuno, de las cuales aprendió lo necesario. Una vez que se casó, ella y su esposo compartieron 20 años de experiencia sembrando juntos los terrenos que heredaron y produciendo en cantidades suficientes para generarse ganancias. Pero ella considera más rentable la actividad ganadera, por ello desea aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene en su establo. Es su décimo crédito que tiene con MFP,  siempre ha trabajado de manera grupal de las cuales ha disfrutado de gratos momentos con los demás integrantes del grupo solidario a los que pertenece. Considera que los préstamos son un apoyo vital para el crecimiento de su negocio ya que puede verlo de su propia experiencia. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de 2 toros para su establo.
texts.en:
Alicia has plenty of energy to continue working. She is 58 years old and lives alone in her own home. In the land of her birth, Alicia works as a farmer and also raises animals. Her parents always entrusted her with the care of the sheep and the cattle, so she learned what the work requires. After getting married, she and her husband shared 20 years of experience working on the land they inherited and producing sufficient quantities of products to generate income. However, she considers her most profitable activity to be raising cattle. For this reason, she wants to increase the number of animals in her stable.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. She has always worked as part of a solidarity group and enjoys the good times she has shared with the other members. Based on her own experience, Alicia considers the loans to be a vital form of support for growing her business. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of two bulls for her stable.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls.

loans.name: Khvay

texts.en: Baray district, Kompong Province, Cambodia, has many kinds of jobs available. Mrs. Kvay is the old mother of four kids. She is a fish seller and raises pigs at home. With respect to her husband, he is the main the person in her family. He doesn’t depend on the farm, but also takes time to catch fish by the pound, in the lake and river. To support a big family and to be as comfortable as others, two of their four kids have gone to find suitable jobs in Phnom Penh. They earn specific salaries to bring to their parents. For improving her family to good living standards, Mrs.Kong wishes a loan in the amount of $125 in order to purchase fishing materials.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria del Carmen: de 48 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda y nueva desde hace dos años,ella nos cuenta que esta muy contenta porque gracias a Dios en el poco tienpo que lleba en su negocio le a hido bien, esta solicitando este credito papra la compra de ropa de segunda ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes,el sueño de ella es tener otro local mas grande y de la misma forma obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen, age 48, has been selling new and secondhand clothing for two years. She says that she is very pleased because her business has done well in a short amount of time, thanks to God.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy secondhand clothing, which is in high demand among her customers. Her dream is to have another shop that is larger so that she can generate better revenues.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Ever since Marcelina, 39 years old, was very little, she really liked the art of welding. That is why she thought of having her own business making gates and windows. Her husband and daughter help her with the business, specifically with customer relations. That is why Marcelina does her work with great enthusiasm and dedication. 

In order to continue with her business, Marcelina wants a loan to buy hoses and a welding machine for her welding shop. Her big dream is to have a well-established business and a good quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy hoses and a welding machine

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda was 16 years old when she got married, and is now 43 years old, separated and blessed with four children. Because her family had no stable source of income, she went abroad to work as a domestic helper. She did this for eight years, then came home and opened a sari-sari (or variety) store where she makes most of her income by selling snack foods, breads and drinks. Imelda is determined to give her children the best possible life, and uses much of her income to send them to school. She hopes to be able to send them to college someday. To make this possible, she has also gone into business selling meat such as chicken and pork, as well as lipstick, lotion and fragrances. She would also like to begin selling rice, but does not have enough capital to do this. That is why she is applying for a loan for PHP 50,000 to to open a new business. In the future, she hopes to buy a car, grow her businesses and send all of her children to college.

loans.use: to go into business selling rice.

loans.name: Mwaffaq

texts.en: Mwaffaq is a 19-year-old young man. He has his own project, which is a store for clothing sales that is located in a good area and is the only source of income for him. Mwaffaq wants to prepare for the coming winter season by purchasing new collection of winter clothes. He has some money but it is not enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $2,500 from FATEN. When Mwaffaq gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to prepare for the coming winter season by purchasing the new collection to sell, increase his income and live in better conditions. Mwaffaq is photographed in his store.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Mushuku Group

texts.en: Clemence is 26 years old, single and lives in the town of Masvingo. For the last two years, he has earned a living by selling clothing and footwear. The main challenge he faces is a high level of competition, and he will use his portion of this group loan to buy more items to sell to his customers. He hopes that this will improve his standard of living and allow him to have more food to eat. In the next five years, his goal is to open a shop in the center of his town.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and footwear to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Jameeleh

texts.en:
A 21-year-old lady, Jameeleh married Ayman, a 27-year-old baker with no children yet.

Jameeleh has always been into crafts, and after getting married she decided to use her talent and start her own small business at home in her free time, so she bought all the materiA. she needed such as straw and some types of accessories and started making baskets, straw trays, straw picture frames, and other items.

Selling her crafts has brought in some new orders, so she has applied for a loan to buy more materiA. and make new items from straw so she can have a new collection of products.

loans.use: to buy more material for making new craft items out of straw.

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, es casada, dueña y administradora de una venta de artesanías como aretes, cadenas, anillos, sandalias y más, este negocio lo inicio por su propia iniciativa y lo atiende de 6:00 a.m. en adelante.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las artesanías,piedras, hilos, accesorios,esta compra le ayudara a tener material para hacer artesanías variadas para la venta.
Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando, para generar ingresos y tener una mejora calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
María is married and lives with her husband and two children. She owns and manages the sale of crafts such as earrings, chains, rings, sandals and more. She began this business on her own initiative and attends to it from 6:00 AM onward.
She is requesting a loan in order to buy the materials to make the crafts: stones, wire, and fittings. This purchase will help her to have materials to make a variety of crafts to sell.
Her biggest dream is to continue working in order to generate income and have a better quality of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy fittings, stones, and wire to make jewelry.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.es:
Eloy sigue participando en el banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Eloy sigue trabajando como maestro de obras y sigue con la venta de materiales de construcción. 

Eloy con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Eloy requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo arena, cemento, pintura, madera, clavos, focos y otras cosas más.
 
Eloy se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Eloy is a member of the Inti Pakareq, a community bank associated with Asociacion Arariwa in Cusco.  He has a construction business.  

Eloy contracts for construction projects and sells building materials.  Funding from the bank helped Eloy's business before, so he's applying for another loan now.  

Eloy will use the loan to buy building materials such as sand, cement, pain, timber, nails and other products that he will resell.

Eloy is grateful for the opportunities your lending provides and is committed to repaying this loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy building materials for his construction business.

loans.name: Andres Abelino

texts.es:
el señor Andres Abelino es soltero, tiene 45 años de edad, cursó el segundo años de educación básica, se dedica ala sastrería, inicio siendo operario, lleva 8 años de experiencia.

solicita un préstamo para la compra de telar para la producción de camisas de tipo polos, ya que tiene demanda su producto, espera en el futuro ver su negocio productivo.
texts.en:
Señor Andres Abelino is unmarried and is 45 years old.  He studied up through his second year of basic education and works as a tailor.  He started as an operator for someone else, and now has eight years of experience.

He is requesting a loan to purchase fabric for making polo-shirts, as he has demand for these.  He hopes in the future to see his business be productive.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making polo-shirts.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 61 years old. She's a widow with two children, and she's from Ozamis City. 

To make a living, Natividad operates a charcoal making business. Natividad has been 10 years in this business and she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2011, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase charcoal equipment. This will be Natividad's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal equipment

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.es: La socia Anastasia; tiene aún su negocio de elaboración de tejas y ladrillos, la socia tiene su fabrica en casa y tambien se dedica  la crianza de animales menores, ella cria aves de corral como pollos, la socia tambien vende menestras en el mercado es una mujer muy trabajadora y en esta oportunidad ella desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para la elboracion y fabricacion de tejas y ladrillos. La socia desea a futuro cercano poder crecer y aumentar sus ventas para dedicarse solo a una cosa y dedicarle tiempo completo alternando con su familia. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer las tejas y ladrillos.
texts.en: Anastacia has a workshop in her home where she makes bricks and tiles. She also raises small animals like chickens. In addition, she sells stews in the market - she is a very hard working woman! On this occasion she wants a loan to buy materials for making bricks and tiles.
