In the near future she would like to grow and increase her sales so that she can dedicate herself to just one business and also have time to spend with her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bricks and tiles.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is applying for another loan to start a new charcoal selling business.  She will use this 40,000 Kes loan to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.  In the future, Irene aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Irene has greatly improved her family’s standard of living.  She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Aged 32, Imelda is a farmer in Tapel. She is married and has three children. She has been farming for five years and currently produces rice to sell in the market. She earns P9,000 every crop season and but finds that this is not enough due to the high cost of school fees, commodities and foods.

She is now requesting a loan of P10,000 to purchase maize seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for her farm. She hopes these inputs will boost her farming business to produce good income and definitely improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Lucerito De José Gálvez Group

texts.es: Isabel es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Lucerito de José Gálvez”  y está conformado por 10 socios dedicados a diversas actividades comerciales. Isabel es una mujer emprendedora que ha salido adelante. Ella tiene 50 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos, aun sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos, ella se dedica a la venta de lencerías la cual trabaja sobre pedidos, donde la gran mayoría de sus clientes son gente de su zona. Isabel empezó trabajando como vendedora de dicho productos, con la experiencia que adquirió decidió emprender su propio negocio, gracias a su perseverancia y con la ayuda de su pareja ha  logrado comprarse su propio terreno, y ayudar en la educación de sus hijos. Isabel tiene como meta construir su vivienda ya que nos manifiesta que es de material pre-fabricado. Ella solicito el crédito para la compra de trusas y brasieres y de esta manera tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. La Alcancía Comunal “Lucerito de José Gálvez” agradecen el crédito brindado.
texts.en: Isabel is a member of the “Lucerito de José Gálvez” community bank.  The bank has 10 members who are all engaged in different commercial business activities.  Isabel is an entrepreneurial woman who has managed to get ahead in life.  She is 50 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She is still supporting one of her children.  Isabel's business is selling lingerie.  She works to order and most of her customers are people from her area.  Isabel started selling this kind of product as a sales assistant.  With the experience that she gained, she decided to start her own business. Thanks to her perseverance and with the aid of her partner, she has managed to buy her own plot of land and help educate her children.  Isabel's goal is to re-build her home as she tells us that it is currently made from pre-fabricated materials.  She requested this loan to buy underpants and bras so that she has stock to offer her customers.  The “Lucerito de José Gálvez” community bank are grateful for the loan they are being given.

loans.use: to buy lingerie (underpants and bras)

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mrs. So is 39 years old and a security guard who works for a private company in Phnom Penh City. She works eight hours per day and has only a day off within a week. She lives in Dongkor district with her husband, a construction worker, and three children. 

Currently Mrs. So has saved some money because she wants to build a fence around her house. However, her funds are insufficient for this. Therefore, she would like to seek a loan from HKL to add to her existing capital so she can build a fence in order to protect her home. 

In the future, Mrs. So hopes to own a construction supplies store. She will try to work hard to provide her children with further education.

loans.use: to add to her existing capital to build a fence in order to protect her home.

loans.name: Abey

texts.en: Abey is 45 years old, married with children who are all attending school. He has a responsibility of paying their school fees .  He does farming for now 20 years.He started on a small scale farming, but now does it on a larger scale. He is doing well, but is interrupted by pests, being a rainy season. He is requesting for a loan facility to buy pesticides, and spray his crops, for better yields.

loans.use: to buy pestcides to spray his crops.

loans.name: Aleimalo

texts.en: Alaimalo is married with 8 children. Only one still goes to school, the rest are of working age. Alaimalo is an industrious women who is the chief of the lending group of her village consisting of 14 other women.  She earns her income from a number of pursuits. Her main business is a plantation which grows taro, bananas and ufi. She also has two cows and wishes to purchase one more with this loan. Aside from this she makes ice cakes which she sells from her home and sometimes at the local school. She is pictured in the photo in her kitchen holding one of her ice cakes. In the past she has used loans to build up the plantation, buy cows and also build an outside toilet.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, weed killer and one cow

loans.name: Nolvia Liceth

texts.en: My business is the sale of seasonings for all types of food preparation, and I have been doing so for two and a half years. I use my income for my family and education.

loans.use: Purchase of cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Chran

texts.en: Mrs. Chran N. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and seven children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  N. and her husband work as merchants, buying coconuts and rice crops from farmers.   They then take these crops to the market, where they re-sell them for a profit.  However, their business is limited because they can only transport a small amount of crops on their motorcycle.  As such, they are requesting a loan in order to purchase a small car for business transportation.  They currently can make about $7.50 per day (comibined), but with a car they would be able to expand their business.  To help with the family's finances, three of their children work at a nearby garment factory, where they can each make about $60 per month.  The remaining four children are students.  In the future, N. and her husband hope that they will be able to further expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase a small car in order to transport crops from farm to market

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala is 45 years old and has 10 children. Her husband sells fruit and vegetables in his community and she dedicates herself to embroidering blouses and skirts and sells them to tourists who visit the area. She is a member of Grupo Clavel 5 along with Mrs. Juana Hernandez (craftswoman) and Mrs. Rosa Perez Perez (craftswoman). Their loan will be used to purchase large amounts of silk threading for their embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUALA, TIENE 45 AÑOS , TUVO 10 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES COMERCIANTE VENDE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS EN LOS ALREDEDORES DE SU COMUNIDAD Y ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ARTESANIA BORDANDO BLUSAS, FALDAS, Y LAS VENDE CON LOS TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA ZONA. ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO CLAVEL 5 JUNTO CON DOÑA JUANA HERNANDEZ L. (ARTESANA) Y DOÑA ROSA PEREZ PEREZ (ARTESANA). SUS PRESTAMOS LO INVERTIRAN COMPRANDO GRNADES CANTIDADES DE HILO DE SEDA PARA SUS BORDADOS.

loans.use:
Arts & Crafts

ARTESANA

loans.name: Mirdamet

texts.en: Mirdamet A. lives in Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. He is 43 years old, is married and has five children. Mirdamet is a low income person. He is engaged in cattle and sheep breeding. He has 2 cows and 15 sheep. He wants to increase the number of his sheep, so he applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan. He needs a loan in the amount of $800 to buy 10 sheep.

loans.use: Mirdamet would like to buy 10 sheep to breed.

loans.name: Soraida

texts.en:
Soraida travels to all parts of Peru, buying clothing and bringing it home to sell in the small Andean city of Ayacucho, Perú. She explains that she has a passion for travel, having been to every corner of her country. For this reason, Soraida has truly found her niche in clothing sales, which allows her to travel all over. Every single day she wakes up early and leaves her home by 8 am. She then spends the entire day or several days traveling to different sites, buying and selling clothing. She sells all types from the very traditional to the most modern and fashionable. The majority of Soraida’s purchasing is done in either Cusco or the capital city of Lima, both of which are more than a 10 hour car trip outside of Ayacucho.

Before she sold clothing, Soraida was living in Lima, selling vegetables from a stand in one of the busy markets. It was an extremely difficult way to make a living, she explains, so she decided to move back to her hometown of Ayacucho where she has been able to buy her own home and begin her small business in clothing sales. For the past 6 years, her business has been growing steadily and she currently has many regular clients who come to her for all of their clothing needs. Soraida asserts happily that she is doing what she loves, and is always looking for new and better ways to increase the amount of clients she serves.

A key element in Soriada’s success has come from her involvement with her village bank. She says it has not only been a place to receive economic opportunities, but also it also serves as a distraction from the difficulties of life, as she has made many close friends. She also loves the lessons taught in her village bank regarding everything from business practices to self-esteem. Soraida is requesting a loan of $1000. With this money, she will pay for her transportation between Ayacucho and the rest of Perú, as well as the purchase of larger quantities of clothing to sell to larger quantities of clients.

loans.use: To pay for transportation between Ayacucho and the rest of Perú, as well as the purchase of larger quantities of clothing to sell to larger quantities of clients.

loans.name: Metanet

texts.en: Metanet is an Internally Displaced Person from Fizuli region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan. She and her family were relocated to Baku as a result of Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. She now lives in an university dormitory with her husband (also pictured) and three children. She trades fruit and vegetables near the dormitory, a business that she and her husband started in 1994 when he moved to Baku with a loan of $300 from Normicro Baku bank. Today, they buy goods from wholesalers that bring goods from regions and sell to retailers in the big markets. Now they need a loan of 1200 AZN to increase working capital. 1000 AZN will be funded by Kiva, and the remaining 200 AZN will be funded by Normicro. She has had a total of 6 loans, all of which she has paid back on time.

loans.use: To expand range of goods

loans.name: Issam

texts.en: Issam is a 48 year old man who lives with his family in south Lebanon, in the region of Tyre. Issam has 3 children and owns an internet cafe. He is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy more computers. Issam started with one computer and is constantly striving to develop his business, which is in high demand in the area.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Mrs. S. is an enterprising woman who is always searching for a way to offer her family well-being. She is a humble farmer who has been working in this domain since childhood. Her enterprising spirit has motivated her to keep working hard. She has established a cattle complex in her hometown of Huancavelica, where she periodically travels to in order to monitor the progress of her livestock. Since she currently lives in the city of Huancayo, she always brings cows and/or bulls on each trip to sell them to her buyers at the cattle market. Because she would like to increase her amount of cattle, she is requesting a loan that she plans on investing in the purchase of young livestock, thus increasing her variety.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Luisa, es una mujer muy emprendedora que siempre ve la mejor manera de otorgarles bienestar a los miembros de su familia, ella es una humilde agricultora y se dedica a estas actividades desde su niñez, su espíritu emprendedor la ha motivado a seguir esforzándose.En su pueblo natal de Huancavelica ha establecido un complejo ganadero y periódicamente viaja a esta ciudad para observar el progreso de sus animalitos, debido a que radica actualmente en la ciudad de Huancayo, a este lugar en cada viaje de retorno trae vacas y/o toros a solicitud de sus compradores para ofertarlos en la feria ganadera.El deseo de incrementar la cantidad de sus animalitos la conducen a solicitar un préstamo ya que tiene planeado invertir esta cantidad en la compra de pequeños animalitos para incrementarla variedad de los mismos.

loans.use: Purchase of young cattle

loans.name: Afi Mawulawoè

texts.fr:
Afi Mawulawoè A. was born on June 14, 1974 in Lomé. Married and the mother of three, her main business is in the catering of rice, salad, and corn mash every evening in one of the busiest district of Lomé. She started this business in 2005. Since that year, she alone has been ensuring that her children are cared for. To serve her customers better, she is requesting, for the first time, a loan of 300,000 francs CFA to buy 15 sacks of corn and 3 sacks of rice. This supply will allow her to avoid being subjected to the price increase in April.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Afi Mawulawoè est née le14 juin 1974 à Lomé. Mariée et mère de 3 enfants elle a pour activité principale la restauration du riz de la salade et de la pâte de maïs chaque soir dans l’un des quartiers les plus animés de Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2005. Depuis cette année elle assurait seule la charge de ses trois enfants. Pour mieux servir ses clients, Madame A. Afi Mawulawoè sollicite pour la première fois un emprunt d’un montant de 300.000FCFA pour faire acheter 15 sacs de maïs et 3 sacs de riz. Cet approvisionnement lui permettra de ne pas subir l’augmentation des prix des sacs dans le mois d’avril

loans.use: To increase her stock of corn

loans.name: Salha's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Salha is 21 years old and married with one 10-month-old child. Salha sells shoes, a business she started in 2007. She works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to increase her stock of shoes for her business. She will share this loan with Veronica, who has a business making batik.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of shoes.

loans.name: Hudoer

texts.en:
I. Hudoer, 43 years old and married with four children, has been operating a taxi service for the past nine years. While the hours are very long, this successful business generates a stable income, enabling Hudoer to support his own large family as well as his mother and father.

In order to provide higher quality services in the future, he is now planning to fix his car . Hudoer therefore requests $600 for the term of 7 months to purchase spare parts. He thanks all for supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the car

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen, 51 years old, joined the Fund in 2007.  She runs a business that her family has ran for more than 10 years, a restaurant.  She is very proud when speaking about her restaurant; when customers visit it even once, they want to come back to her restaurant again.  Not only are the food fresh and clean, but the family’s service is also very friendly and attentive with their customers.  When leaving the restaurants customers always receive a smile and thanks from Mrs. Nguyen.  Because of these points, her family’s restaurant is always busy and full of diners, and is also the number one eatery in the area.  Mrs. Nguyen and her husband have two children, one who is still in school, and one who is grown and help out at the restaurant.  Continuing to invest in their restaurant, in this round of funding the family is requesting 7,000,000 VND.  Their monthly income is 5,000,000 VND.  
Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.
Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2007, chị Nguyễn Thị L. 51 tuổi với một mô hình kinh doanh mà gia đình chị đã làm trên 10 năm nay đó là kinh doanh hàng ăn. Thật tự hào khi nói về cửa hàng ăn của gia đình chị, khách hàng đến ăn dù một lần nhưng sẽ luôn có ấn tượng và sẽ mong muốn được ăn tai quan chị vào những lần sau. Không chỉ là các đồ ăn của hàng chị ngon sạch sẽ, mà thái độ phục vụ của gia đình chị cũng rất nhiệt tình, chu đáo với khách hàng. Khi ra về khách hàng luôn nhận đuợc nu cuời trên môi và lời cảm ơn của chủ quán. Chính vì vậy cửa hàng ăn của gia đình chị lúc nào cũng đông khách, và đó cũng chính là điểm đến ăn số 1 của khách hàng quanh khu vực. Vợ chồng anh chị có 2 con, 1 con đang đi học, 1 con đã lớn và ở nhà bán hàng giúp bố mẹ. Vẫn tiếp tục đầu tư vào cửa hàng ăn vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 7.000.000đ.  Thu  nhập bình quân của gia đình. 5.000.000đ/tháng

loans.use: Invest in restaurant's continuing operation

loans.name: Djiguiya 2 (Soutien) Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Djiguiya 2 group are married. Their average age is 30 and they have, on average, 6 children. They live in Sikouna 2, one of the villages of the Fana Sous-prefecture, Republic of Mali, in polygamous families with their husbands, co-spouses, parents-in-law, brothers, sisters, and children.

They are essentially engaged in selling grocery items: bags of powdered milk, packets of pasta, dried and smoked fish, sugar, salt, soap, etc. With confidence in each other and united by ties of work and friendship, these women have decided to collaborate with the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso this year. This is their first loan as a group. They generally procure their merchandise in the big open-air market in Fana or at the Marka Coungo fair, their economic metropolis for the aforementioned items.

They sell on a cash or credit basis, generally retail, at the same fair, under shed roofs, on tables, often even on the ground, or as ambulant salespeople going to village houses. Their clientele is essentially composed of women, children and male heads of families wanting to vary their meals.

With this loan, the women of Djiguiya will purchase 50 packets of pasta, 10 kg of fish, 20 bags of powdered milk, 10 kg of sugar, packets of tea, etc., that is, they will spend 50,000 FCFA, hoping to make a monthly average profit of 15,000 FCFA with which they plan to make payments on the loan, re-invest in their businesses, and contribute to family living expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Les membres du groupe Djiguiya 2 sont mariés avec une moyenne d’age de 30 ans 6 enfants et vivent à Sikouna 2 un des villages de la sous préfecture de Fana (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali) dans des familles polygames avec leurs maris, des coépouses, les beaux parents, les frères, les soeurs et les enfants.

Elles exercent essentiellement le commerce d’articles divers qui s’apparente à une munie alimentation : sachets de lait en poudre, paquets de pâtes alimentaires le poisson fumé, séché sucre, sel de cuisine savon etc. Se faisant réciproquement confiance et unies par des liens de travail et de d’amitié ces femmes ont décidés de collaborer avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe. Elles s’approvisionnent généralement au grand marché de Fana ou à la foire de Marka coungo leur métropole économique pour les articles ci-dessus cités.

Elles effectuent leurs ventes au comptant à crédit généralement en détail dans la même foire sous des hangars sur des étales souvent a même le sol, d’une façon ambulante devant dans les maisons aux villages .La clientèle est essentiellement composée de femmes d’enfants et de pères de famille désirant changer de repas

Avec ce prêt ces femmes du groupe Djiguiya en achetant 50 paquets de pâte alimentaires ,10kg de poissons, 20 sachets de lait en poudre 10 kg de sucre des paquets de thé etc. soit une dépense de 50000FCFA espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA avec lequel elles envisagent payer les intérêts de prêt investir dans leurs activités et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille. essentiellement dans leurs activités.

loans.use:
Purchase of various goods for re-sale

Achat de divers articles

loans.name: Debora

texts.es:
Debora is 30 years old, separated and the mother of two children: Edison, who is 8, and Andres, who is 4. She currently lives with her two children in a rented home. Debora is from Lima, the capital, but has lived in Juliaca for the last 5 years.

After finishing her secondary studies, she started working various jobs, such as lingerie sales, which she has been doing now for 8 years. She does traveling sales, going to the different areas of Juliaca to sell her products. Debora's job allows her to take care of and spend time with her sons, since she works on weekends and during the morning on weekdays. The most challenging aspect of her work is having to take along her son Edison. Since he's so young, he needs a lot of attention but at the same time she has to carry and sell her merchandise. This is quite challenging, but she likes her job because it allows her to earn the money she needs to care for her sons and be able to spend time with them also.

Debora plans to use the loan money to buy additional lingerie and increase her inventory. The extra income will allow her to give her children a better education. In the future, Debora plans to have her own stand where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Debora es una mujer de 30 años de edad, separada de su pareja y madre de dos hijos; Edison de 8 y Andrés de 4, con los que vive actualmente en una vivienda alquilada. Ella es de la ciudad capital, Lima reside en la ciudad de Juliaca hace cinco años, culminó sus estudios secundarios y desde entonces se ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes labores, en el negocio de la venta de lencería tiene ocho años de experiencia, ofreciendo sus productos de forma ambulatoria por las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Juliaca. El trabajo de Debora le permite cuidar y pasar tiempo con sus hijos, ya que lo hace los días sábados y domingos y los demás días de la semana por las mañanas. Lo más difícil es tener que trabajar con su hijo Edison, ya que al ser pequeño necesita de sus cuidados, y al mismo tiempo manejar la mercadería y ofrecerla, esto se le hace complicado, pero le gusta su trabajo ya que le permite ganar dinero para mantener a sus hijos y poder pasar tiempo con ellos. Con el dinero que Débora solicita comprará más lencería para poder aumentar su mercadería y así poder brindarles una mejor educación a sus dos hijos, Débora planea en el futuro contar con su propio puesto, donde ofrecer sus prendas.

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise (lingerie) to continue with her business.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
El Sr Guadalupe M. esta construyendo en su casa pero le está haciendo falta las bardas de enfrente y el portón y algo mas de material.

El señor Guadalupe M. es una persona pensionada el motivo fue porque sufrió un accidente en su trabajo que lo dejos incapacitado pero eso no le a impedido salir adelante con su familia. Con su pensión y algunos trabajos de construcción que el realiza son las ingresos de su familia. Cuando fuimos a realizar la visita a su casa el Sr. Guadalupe no se encontraba andaba haciendo un trabaja solo se encontraba su esposa la Sra. Esther y sus nietos.

El Sr. Guadalupe fue acreditado de Fvp es un bien cliente el esta solicitándole otro por medio de Kiva por $750.00 dlls que es para comprar el material que le esta haciendo falta para terminar las bardas y portón y así su familia este mas segura.
texts.en:
Mr. Guadalupe M. is building at his house but he lacks a wall and a gate in the front since he does not have enough materials.

Guadalupe M. is a person who lives off of a pension since he suffered a work accident that left him disabled. However, this did not impede his ability to get his family and himself ahead. He generates income for his family through his pension and some odd jobs. When we visited Guadalupe's home, we found only his wife, Esther, and their grandchildren.

Guadalupe is accredited by FVP and has been a good customer. He is requesting another loan from Kiva in the amount of $750 which is to purchase the material that he lacks.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Dulce Lorena

texts.es:
Dulce inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, comenzó hace cinco años ayudando a su papa en la carnicería y posteriormente su padre se la dejo para continuar ella el negocio y sea ayudara para la manutención de su niña, ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero y ellos deseaban darle mejor calidad de vida a su pequeña de 5 años.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mas surtido su negocio. Con tu apoyo Dulce seguirá progresando.
texts.en:
Dulce started her business to help her husband with the living expenses. Five years ago, she started helping her father at the butcher shop. Later, he deiced that it was better for her to be in charge of the shop so she could support her 5-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a construction worker and both of them want to provide a better quality of life to her. She needs a loan in the amount of US $350, which will be paid back within 6 months, to purchase merchandise and help her business succeed. With your support she will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maríanila

texts.es:
Maríanila es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Marínala es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 2 hijos, Marínala vende comida de manera ambulatoria en una calle cercana a los terminales terrestres, actividad que realiza desde las 6 hasta las 10 de la noche. 
Marínala necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ají, ajo, comino.
Marianala sueña con tener casa propia, un negocio estable y sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maríanila is a member of Las Gaviotas Communal Bank. She is 22, living with her partner and 2 children. She is a street vendor of food in a street near the overland terminals, which she does from 6 am until 10 pm. Marínala needs a loan of $200 to purchase chili, garlic, and cumin. Marínala dreams of having her own house, a stable business, and that her children could complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chili, garlic, and cumin

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita S. tiene tres hijos, ella vive en Tecpán Guatemala Chimaltenango, su negocio es una fabrica de ropa para bebe.  Desde muy pequeña Margarita se dedicó a los negocios, su primer negocio fue vender plantas medicinales, así como también atender los nacimientos de niños.
También inicio un negocio de crianza de pollos, pero por no tener experiencia, no le fue muy bien y se le murieron todos sus pollos.
Siguió luchando y con la ayuda de su esposo logró comprar 3 vacas, las que pronto tendrán sus crías, por eso esta muy contenta.  También cuenta que no tenia posibilidades de darles educación a sus hijos, y por eso desde hace cuatro años se dedicaron junto con su esposo a trabajar para fabricas de suéteres, y de esa forma fueron aprendiendo y adquiriendo  experiencia, por lo que nació la idea de comprar su propia maquina de tejidos para elaborar trajes de bebe.  Actualmente es uno de sus hijos el quien le ayuda a administrar su negocio, y ahora ya puede estudiar él y también su hijo mas pequeño va a la escuela.  Su sueño es poder construir su casa y que sus hijos sean estudien y lleguen a ser profesionales, y personas de bien.
texts.en:
Margarita S. is a woman who has 3 children and lives in Tecpán Guatemala Chimaltenango. She has a baby apparel factory. Ever since she was young, Margarita has been in retail. Her first business was herbal remedy sales. She also assisted in delivering babies. She started a chicken farm as well, but because she had no experience in that line of work, things did not go well and all her chickens died.

She kept working hard, and with the help of her husband, was able to purchase 3 cows, which will soon have their own young. This is why she is very happy. She also notes that she did not have an opportunity to provide her children with an education, which is why they, along with their dad, went to work at a sweater factory four years ago. As a consequence, they started learning skills and obtaining experience, which is how the idea to purchase a knitting machine to make baby outfits was born. One of her children currently helps her manage the business, and he can now study. Her youngest son now attends school as well. She dreams of being able to build her own house and of seeing her children get an education so that they can be upright professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make sweaters and baby apparel

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es comerciante se dedica a la venta D.  chicharrón D. cuero  D. chancho seco, su esposo es empleado.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona D. Irpavi II y vive en Alquiler
Su actividad económica D. la señora es la venta D. chicharron D. chancho ambulando por las calles  ya que no cuenta con un puesto fijo y así le pueD. ayudar para generar ingresos a su esposo.
Sus ganas D. trabajar le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que será D. gran ayuda para su actividad económica.
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en impro y la tercera vez que requiere la ayuda D. Kiva.
El crédito será  destinado para la compra D. mercadería (cuero D. chancho, sal, pimienta).
texts.en:
Irene is a business woman who sells deep fried pork rind. Her husband is her employee. Their home is a rental located in the Irpavi II neighborhood. Irene sells pork rinds on the street walking from place to place because she does not have a food stall, and in this way has been able to generate income to assist her husband. Her desire to work qualifies her for this loan, which will proviD. a substantial stimulus to her business. This is the sixth time Irene has requested a loan from Impro and the third time she has required Kiva’s assistance. The loan will be used for the purchase of ingredients (pork rind, salt and pepper).

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La señora Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal “Sacuyo”, en la comunidad de Sacuyo, distrito de Acora, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente y esta al cuidado de dos hijos, posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace poco con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de engorde de ganado y su venta en las ferias ganaderas; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la alimentación de su ganado para engordarlo y comercializarlo.
Ella desea obtener un mayor capital para poder invertir en la compra de semillas de alfalfa y alimento (cebada, afrecho, etc.) para engorde ganado (vacunos y ovinos); por ello viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1600.00 nuevos soles, asimismo ella refiere que juntamente con la ayuda económica del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, se debe brindar Capacitaciones y asistencia técnica  para poder invertir mejor el dinero prestado y producir ganado de mayor peso y mejor calidad, ello le permitirá obtener mejores precios en la feria ganadera a donde lleva su ganado, sin embargo agradece a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo, ya que le permitió mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar y ayudar a la educación de sus hijos que es lo más importante para ella, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the communal bank "Sacuyo", in the community of Sacuyo, Acora district, Puno District, Puno Department. She is 30 years old, married and has two children and has completed primary school. She has worked recently with the Manuela Ramos organization. She has a business of fattening cattle and selling them in the animal markets. Her first loan of 500 Nuevos Soles was used to invest in animal feed to fatten and sell them. She would like to have more capital to be able to purchase alfalfa seeds and feed (barley, bran, etc.) to fatten livestock (cattle and sheep). For this she is requesting a new loan of 1,600 Nuevos Soles; in addition to the economic help of the Manuela Ramos organization she would also like training and technical assistance to be able to better invest the money she is loaned and produce livestock of a better weight and quality; this will allow her to obtain better prices in the livestock market where she takes her animals. Nevertheless, she is thankful to Manuela Ramos for its support, since it has allowed her to improve her quality of life and help with the education of her children, which is the most important to her. Finally, she is committed to repaying her loan on time in three monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of alfalfa seed and feed (barley, bran, etc.) to feed her livestock (cattle and sheep)

loans.name: Dory

texts.es:
La señora Dory pertenece al banco comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en  Jr. Loreto Nº s/n, Provincia de Juanjui, departamento de Mariscal Cáceres. Tiene 45 años y es madre de 2 hijos los cuales dependen aun de ella. Es conviviente, su pareja trabaja como transportista en un motokar. Dory  con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en la compra de verduras regionales para venderlos en el mercado. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente cuenta con dos puestos en el mercado central de su ciudad, además de un motokar propio que le permite ingresos diarios para poder pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1,900.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara 10 sacos de yuca, hojas en cantidad, 20 racimos de plátano, naranjas y otras frutas en cientos, etc.

Dory esta muy agradecida con el Banco por el apoyo brindado por haberle permitido sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Dory belongs to the communal bank "Honesty and Work", an affiliate of Kiva, and lives in Jr. Loreto Nº, in the province of Juanjui, department of Marshal Cáceres. She is 45 years old and is a mother of two children who depend on her. Her spouse works as a trucker. Dory used her first loan of $300 to invest in the purchase of regional vegetables, in order to sell them in the market. She has worked with the bank for eight years. At the moment she has two stalls in the central market of the city, in addition to owning her own motokar, which allows her a daily income in order to be able to repay the loan promptly. With this loan of 1,900 nuevos soles that will be repaid in six months, she will buy 10 bags of yucca, leaves in bulk, 20 bunches of bananas, oranges and other fruits by the hundreds, and numerous other goods. Dory is very thankful for the Bank for the support they have offered which has permitted her to move ahead with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of yucca, leaves in bulk, 20 bunches of bananas, oranges, and other fruits.

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a widowed mother of five who would like a loan to expand her businesses in order to make some small improvements in her life. After the death of both her husband and one of her children, Prudencia has been supporting her family on her firewood and her farming businesses.  
 
This is Prudencia’s tenth loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 1998. She says firewood is always needed in her community and her farm always produces well, so her business is sure to be successful after this loan. 
 
With the profits from this loan, Prudencia plans to pay for her children's school fees and other educational needs.  She also intends to renovate her kitchen if possible. She hopes this loan will improve her and her family's standard of living. She prefers GHAPE loans because the conditions of the loans work well for her.
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase firewood, yarm seeds and materials for the construction of two rooms in her house.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Mr. Phally S. lives in Krang Roung village in Takeo province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Chhoem Chanthon, is a rice farmer who works their plot of land and also breeds pigs. She is 41 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. Although they work hard, they have not been able to improve their family home. Thus, Mr. Phally S. has decided to ask for a loan to add to their savings so they can buy cement, sand, and other construction supplies needed to work on the house.  His wife is present in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, and other construction supplies

loans.name: El Hadji

texts.fr:
El Hadji F. est un boucher, son exploitation "La Belle Viande" est situéee à 200 m du marché centrale de Ziguinchor. Ce pére de famille vit de son activité qu'il souhaite renforcer par ce prêt.
Avec ce crédit il compte augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et surtout répondre à la demande des clients de plus en plus nombreux.
texts.en:
El Hadji F. is a butcher. His business is located 200 meters from the central market of Ziguinchor. This father with a family makes his living by his business, which he would like to bolster through this loan. He plans to increase his turnover and especially to respond to the continually growing number of customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Butcher shop

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama K. is thirty-five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter. Both of her children are in the primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. As a single parent, she works very hard to be able to provide for the family.

Mariama is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge in the mornings. She prepares the porridge from ingredients such as millet, maize, beans, etc. She sells on the street.

Mariama has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy maize, millet, etc. to prepared cooked food for sale

loans.name: Iram Waseem Javed Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. 
Parveen baji and Naziran baji each want a loan to buy goats for their animal-selling business. 
Karam baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.   
Iram baji is the group leader of these four ladies. They all are very hardworking ladies and manage their own businesses easily. Iram baji is married to W. J. who runs a tailoring center. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine to increase the profit of her husband’s tailoring center. 
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Ana Liliana

texts.es:
la Sra. Ana Liliana G. tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulperia ANA, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 7 años, el crecimiento de su negocio es notable y esto debido a la ubicacion con que cuenta el mismo y tambien por la atencion que ella les brinda a sus clientes.
ella vive en union libre y solo uno de sus hijos depende de ella, su compañero de hogar trabaja como motorista de equipo pesado.
ella solicita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio, ella nos comenta que se siente muy alegre.
con los ingresos que le genera su negocio le colabora a su esposo para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Liliana G. has a mini market named ANA located in her house. She has been in this business for seven years. The notable growth of her business is due to its location and also to the attention she offers her customers. She is in a common law marriage, and only one of her children is a dependent. Her husband works as a heavy equipment operator. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy merchandise to better stock her business. She feels happy with the income the business generates. She and her husband both contribute to cover the family and household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy sugar, rice, soap, toilet paper, soft drinks, coffee, canned juices, chicken, eggs, corn flour, cheese, butter

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar Sánchez , tiene la edad de 52 años , habita en el barrio San Caralampio, ubicado en el municipio de la Concepción , junto a su esposa , la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene cuatro hijos , todos dependen de él , actualmente estudian y la apoyan con las actividades agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda , desde hace 3 años don Julio se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, el inicio esta actividad por si solo , los planes hacia un futuro con su cultivo , es que quiere tecnificarlo. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Cesar Sánchez is 52 years old and lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood in the town of Concepción. He and his wife have four dependent children who attend school. Julio works as a farmer to support his family, and his wife supports him by handling all the household chores.

He and his family plan to improve their living conditions. Don Julio has been farming for three years, and his greatest challenge has been a lack of funding. His work involves a great deal of manual labor that he does himself, so he would like to mechanize his farm in the future. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizer and other supplies to help increase his harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and farming supplies

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es: Doña Silvia Elena está solicitando su 6to crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para realizar mejora de su casa de habitación repellar la casa y cambiarle el zinc a la cocina, labora como docente en la colonia la Unión desde hace 24 años, tiene 5  hijos, la mayor de 15 años estudia su tercer año de educación secundaria, el otro hijo tiene 13 años estudia 6to grado, el otro niño tiene 11 años y la niña menor de 10 meses, su esposo trabaja como agricultor el cual ayuda con los gastos familiares y bestimenta de sus hijos, Silvia  es un docente que asume su trabajo con gran responsabilidad, se ha desarrollado en el campo laboral  desde muy joven para poder ayudarle a sus padres desde pequeña, es una mujer muy reconocida por ser una persona  honesta en sus actividades que se desarrolla, es una clienta que esta satisfecha por los beneficios que ha recibido por la institución, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral salud  y una vivienda  digna con buenas condiciones humana en su comunidad, que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Dona Silvia Elena is applying for her 6th loan from AFODENIC to make home improvements such as repairing the walls of her house and installing a new roof over the kitchen. She has worked as a teacher in the La Union area for 24 years. She has 5 children, the oldest of whom is 15 years old and in his (or her) third year of high school. She also has a 13-year old son in the 6th grade, an 11-year old son and a 10-month old daughter. Her husband is a farmer and helps pay for the family's expenses and clothing for the children. Silvia is a teacher and very conscientious in her approach to her work. She grew up in the country, working hard even as a young girl to help her parents. She is a woman widely recognized for being scrupulous about everything she does. She is very happy with the returns that she's received from her loans from the institution. Her dream is to have a steady job, health and a decent house so that her children can continue to study and become happy and productive adults.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair walls and roof.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn D. is a 47 years old farmer in Sto. Nino, Cotabato. She has eight children and a very supportive husband who helps her manage their rice field. In 1983, they started to till land on a two-hectare farm. Aside from farming, they also have a sari-sari store. These are their sources of income.

She would like a loan of Php 15,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc.in order to purchase fertilizers and chemicals that are vital to ensure quality and healthy rice. She is very optimistic that she will be able to achieve more than the average of what is normally yielded in her rice farm.

CEVI helps small business grow and provides clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Marcelo II”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y 03 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Doris, es una mujer trabajadora y Luchadora, se siente capaz de seguir a delante y trabajar con muchas ganas y así hacer profesionales a sus hijos, esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, sus ventas le salen muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes.

Doris, poco a poco fue ahorrando, de esta manera es que decidió implementar su propio negocio.
Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con lo que hace, también cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. 
En su negocio, sus clientes encuentra lo necesario para preparar sus ensaladas y jugos  es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas y frutas en diferentes variedades propias de la región y de otras partes del país, para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Doris, expresa haber cumplido algunas de sus metas que tiene trazada en su vida. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y a desarrollarse en lo como Mujer y Empresaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Doris is a member of the Communal Bank “San Marcello II”, which is located the District of Morales, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 3 dependent children.

Doris is a hard worker and a fighter. She feels she can continue to press forward so that her children can become professionals. She is very pleased with what she has already accomplished. Doris sells fruits and vegetables. Sales have been very good since she is well-known among her customers.

Saving little by little over time, Doris decided to start her own business. She continues to invest in her business in the same manner. She enjoys what she does, but she is in business primarily to support her children. Her customers visit her in order to purchase items needed to make salads or juices. She greets all of her customers personally with a smile.

Doris will use her loan of 1000 soles to buy bags of oranges, tangerines, citrons, taperebá (a native fruit of the Amazon region), and other varieties of fruits from the region and different parts of the country so that she can provide better service to her customers and give them what they need.

Doris says that she has been able to complete some of the goals she set for herself. Thanks to the help of Manuela Ramos, she was able to start her business and develop personally as a woman and an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase regional fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a member of the Kidumu borrower group in Kiboriloni , Kilimanjaro, She is 38 year old woman, She is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 15,11,8,5 years old. She also cares for other 1 dependent.

Prisca has owned a clothing business selling clothes for  5 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 30,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Prisca`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Prisca hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle L. is from the village of Sto. Nino, Manolo Fortich Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Annabelle joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Larng

texts.en:
Larng H., 58, is married with three children. She lives with her husband and children in Battambong Province. She manufactures a kind of Cambodian traditional cake made from rice and used for rolling meat and vegetables, earning an income of $5 per day, which is the primary source of income for the family. She is assisted by two of her children in the process of preparing those products. Her husband is hired to produce different kinds of furniture, especially tables, earning approximately an income of $2 per day. Another source of income for the family is generated from one of H.’s children who sells clothes in the town located at the border of Cambodia and Thailand. 

H. is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a trailer and a motorbike attached together to transport rice and grains. She hopes that her new business plan, in which she will invest the expected loan, will be successful.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike and a trailer for transporting food items

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married to Reynaldo and they live in Marcos, Roxas, Isabela. Her husband works as a salesman in Abu Dabi while she manages her own sari-sari store (community based store). They are gifted with a son and he is now three years old.

Aside from her store, Arlene is also engaged in different businesses like hog-raising and the retailing of dry goods. She dreams that her son will finish his studies in the future.

With her desire to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family, Arlene wants to improve her business and she is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000. This amount will be used to purchase more grocery items for her store.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Davlatbegim

texts.ru: Давлатбегим Юсуфалиева проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 21 лет. Свободна. Давлатбегим имеет аптеку, рядом с базаром, где торгует качественными медиаментами. Этим видом торговли занимается более 2 лет. Кредит просит для расширения бизнеса, закуп новых медикаментов.
texts.en:
Davlatbegim Y. lives in the city of Hamadoni. She is 21 years old and single. Davlatbegim owns a pharmacy near a market, where she sells quality medications. She has been involved in this type of retail sales for over 2 years. She is requesting a loan for business expansion and purchase of new medications.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new medications

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando E. makes a living primarily by operating a tricycle. He is 33 years old, married and has one school-age child. They are from the town of Turod Norte, Cordon. Fernando has been in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Fernando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Fernando is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce sells colorful sarongs at retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 49 years old and married with 4 children. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She is requesting for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Pérez de 65 años, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil su casa es de cemento, es divorciada hace 12 años con su ex cónyuge tiene 6 hijos de 47 años, 44 años, 42 años, 37 años, 32 años, 25 años todos ya casados y trabajando.

María comenzó con la ayuda de una de sus vecinas la que le enseño todo con respecto a costura. Ahora ella trabaja todos los días en su casa confeccionando camisas, sacos, pantalones, blusas etc. Una de las mayores dificultades que tiene es la inseguridad de su sector.

El préstamo lo quiere para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, en el futuro quiere tener ya un negocio bien establecido con sus propios modelos de ropa para poder hacer una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Maria P. is 65 years old, and lives in semi-urban zone in the perimeter of Guayaquil. Her home is made of concrete. Maria got divorced 12 years ago; she has 6 children with her ex-husband, ages 47, 44, 42, 37, 32, and 25 years old. Each is married and working. With the help of her neighbors, Maria started to learn everything she could about sewing. Now she works at home everyday, making shirts, jackets, pants, blouses and so on. One of the biggest challenges Maria faces is the insecurity of her industry. Maria is seeking a loan to improve her home; in the future, Maria wants to have well-established business in her home, with her own line of clothing to sell as a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Este cliente tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este esta en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado un créditos con CEPRODEL durante un años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y ladrillos, para su casa de habitación por lo que esta no tenía.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

El dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda más segura.
texts.en:
This client is married and has a school-aged son under his care. He has had one loan with CEPRODEL during the year which, thanks to the financing from CEPRODEL, he made some home improvements . He is asking for funding to buy building materials like, cement, sand and bricks for his home, because it doesn't have any. His goal is to have better security and living conditions for his children. He said he now has a safer home thanks to the loans from CEPRODEL, which have been of great help to him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair and enlarge his home.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima is a 36-year-old divorced woman living with her parents. After getting 10 years of experience, she decided to open a beauty salon in her town in 2007. She offers hairdressing and beauty services to her clients. Her business has developed well over the past two years. Today, she is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy merchandise for her shop such as makeup, hair colors, cosmetics products and other items to continue to serve her clientele.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is a loving mother to her three children whose ages are from nine to 15 years old. The welfare of her family, especially her children, is her main priority above anything else. She joined ASHI with the support of her husband because she believes that through ASHI, loans she can avail will enable her to have her own business. This will provide her with the finances she needs to support the achievement of her dream. However, being a newly recognized member of ASHI, the Kiva field partner in the Philippines, Josephine understood that the amount of loan she can initially request is not that big yet. However, this will be used accordingly, in a hog/pig fattening business to have a profit when it will be sold after four months either by slaughtering or alive. 

Just like other poor mothers, Josephine is not dreaming for more than her children graduating from college and living a life than is not under the umbrella of poverty.  Profits of her business will be her great means of achieving such in addition to the financial support that her husband can provide her sporadically.

loans.use: To purchase hog/pig for fattening and selling.

loans.name: Davlatali

texts.ru: Даминов Давлатали проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 9 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын на заработках в России. Сам Давлатали занимается растениеводством. У него земельный участок, где он сажает пшеницу и оващи. Урожай который он получает вывозит на рынок а часть оставляет своей семье. В этой области более 8 лет. В свободное время он предотавляет услугу, такси. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Давлатали хочет получить хороший урожай, что привлечет новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Davlatali D. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 49 years old, married and has 9 children. His wife is a homemaker. His son works in Russia. Davlatali is involved in agriculture. He has a plot of land, where he grows wheat and vegetables. He sells part of the received harvest at the market and leaves some for his family. He has been in this business for over 8 years. Davlatali also provides taxi service in his spare time. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers. Davlatali wants to get a good harvest, which will attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es: Cruz M. H. 59 años de edad, reside en Cantón el Amate, ubicado en San Isidro departamento de  Cabañas. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor y junto a dos nietos. Cruz posee una venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, así mismo comercializa productos para el cuidado de la piel y cosméticos, el negocio está ubicado en un pequeño centro comercial, el cual está ubicado a la entrada de San Isidro, este es un lugar muy transitado por las personas y por el transporte público, lo que beneficia a Cruz ya que se encuentra a la vista de todas las personas. De esta misma manera ella comercializa la ropa de forma ambulante por diferentes cantones del lugar, esto le asegura mayores ganancias las cuales son de mucha ayuda para el bienestar de su familia, ya que sus nietos dependen del trabajo de la señora Cruz y de su esposo. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual desea poder invertir aún más en su negocio, comprando más ropa, cosméticos y de esta misma manera surtiéndolo con otros productos como: zapatos, ropa interior y más. Uno de los mayores deseos de Cruz es poder aprovechar la temporada de Semana Santa ya que en este tiempo sus ventas aumentan, lo cual sería de gran beneficio para ella.
texts.en:
Cruz M. H., 59, lives in the canton of El Amate, located in San Isidro in the department of Cabañas. She lives with her husband, who works in agriculture, and their two grandchildren. Cruz has a business selling clothing for men, women and children. She also markets skin care products and cosmetics. Her business is located in a small commercial center which is located at the entrance of San Isidro. This is a place that many people pass through, as there is public transportation there, which benefits Cruz because her business is seen by all of these people. Cruz also works as a street vendor selling clothing in various cantons in her area. This assures her greater earnings, which is a great help to her family's economic welfare, as she and her husband are supporting their grandchildren. For this reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which she will use to invest in her business, buying more clothing and cosmetics, and stocking her business with other products such as shoes, underwear, and more. One of Cruz's main wishes is to be able to take advantage of the Semana Santa (Easter Season), since at this time the sales rise, and this would be a great benefit for her.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics and shoes

loans.name: Nenita's Group

texts.en:
Nenita L. is a married, 39-year-old woman from the village of San Rafael. She has 3 school-age children. Nenita is the group leader of a 12-member loan group administered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if one of them is delinquent or defaults on a loan. The official name of this borrowing group is Nenita L.'s Group.

To earn a living, Nenita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, she runs a general store, so her primary source of income is derived from selling a variety of products to her fellow community members. Nenita has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. In turn, she was able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her standard of living. Nenita recently repaid a prior loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items in order to expand her product offering. Nenita is now seeking another loan, this time in the amount of 15,000 PHP (though the amount being sought for the entire group loan is 165,000 PHP, or $3,700), which will be used to expand her business. This loan would be the fifth loan taken out by Nenita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches, which cover the Central and Northeastern areas of the country. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To further expand her business

loans.name: Gborbaah Group

texts.en:
Sarah K. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'Gborbaah'. She is 42 years old, married with 4 children who range from 13 to 28 years old. She also cares for 4 step-children. Sarah is a nurse by profession.

For 2 years she has been selling medical drugs at the Redlight market in Paynesville, Liberia. She started her drugs sales with a little  earned money. She sometimes faces problems with traveling from one place to another to sell drugs and also has problems with low working capital.

Sarah sells good drugs at a reasonable price to keep customers returning. Her goal and dream is to own a medical store and improve the living conditions of her family. She needs this loan to purchase more medications for sale.

In the photo that accompanies the profile, Sarah is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more medications for sale

loans.name: Akilimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe Akilimaya sont de femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans,  4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à KABOILA II  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce général avec Mariam D. dans l’achat vente de concombres, le bois de chauffe, des  vêtements pour enfants, le savon liquide, etc.
Mariam D. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  15 sacs de 100kg de concombres
au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et dans les jardins des villages avoisinants auprès des producteurs.
Elle revend au  marché de Mancourani I et en famille à une clientèle composée  de femmes, en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six members of the Akilimaya group are married women with an average age of 28 and 4 children on average, living for the most part in polygamous families in KABOILA II, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the third time with a view toward satisfying the needs of their clientele. Both the preceding loans were correctly resolved. This group of women engages in general commerce. Mariam D. sells cucumbers, but others sell firewood, children's clothing, liquid soap, etc. Mariam D. intends to use her loan to buy 15 sacks of 100 kg of cucumbers in the big open-air market of the town of Sikasso and directly from producers in the surrounding villages. She sells the cucumbers in the market of Mancourani I and among her family members, to a clientele composed of women, retail, for cash and often on credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 17,500 F CFA of which part will be used for family expenses and the rest reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying cucumbers for resale

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit M. is 30 years old and lives in Ijevan city. He is married and has two daughters. Davit is engaged in beekeeping and his father helps him in his hard work. With the profit from his business, Davit keeps his family. Part of his produced honey he keeps for his family's usage, because natural honey is very useful, especially for children. Davit said beekeeping requires systematic and attentive care, so you’ll have very strong and hard-working bee families. Davit has many regular customers, so he sells his honey very quickly.

Davit asks for a 900,000 AMD loan to buy 10 or 12 beehives, wax papers, and frames for his bee families.

loans.use: To buy 10 or 12 beehives, wax papers and frames for his bee families.

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothy H. is married, with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. She is 40 years old. She and her family are living in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a Khmer noodle seller in their local village and can earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chab Choem, is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where he can cultivate rice to sell to support his family. 

Now she has a problem because her husband’s field is infertile. So to improve production, Mrs. Sothy H. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, a plow to plow her husband’s field, and, with the rest of the loan, a cow for breeding. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a plow  to plow her husband’s field

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia A. is from the village of Igpit, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Lydia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She chose to lower the amount of her loan from 7,000 PHP to 5,000 PHP because she finds it easier to pay back. Lydia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Remedios' Group

texts.en:
Remedios P. is from the village of San Mariano. She is the leader of a 13-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Remedios P..
Remedios is 55 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store selling clothing products in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Remedios joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María tiene 51 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es casada vive con el esposo y un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales, atol, pan con piña, (antojitos).
Ella se dedica al negocio de venta de Leña y durante la semana elabora tamales, atol y pan con piña, comercializa los productos de forma ambulante en zonas cercanas, ella solicita un préstamo para compra de Leña y productos para elaborar tamales y continuar con el negocio, esto contribuirá para mejorar las ventas.
Los sueños son continuar trabajando para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old and lives in the town of San Francisco Gotero in the Morazán department. She is married and lives with her husband and son. She sells tamales, cornflour drinks, and pineapple bread (sweets).

She sells firewood and during the week she makes the tamales, cornflour drink, and pineapple bread. She sells the products door to door in nearby areas. She is requesting the loan to buy firewood, products to make tamales, and continue with her business. This will contribute with improving sales.

Her dream is continue working to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of firewood and ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Mr. Sareth Kung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen people who live in Krasang Pul village in Takeo province. Mr. Sareth K., who was born in 1966, is the village bank president, having been selected by the other members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a different purpose.

Mr. Sareth K. and his wife, Mrs. Srey Sum, are farmers who own a three-hectare (7.5-acre) plot of land that they use to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Mr. Sareth K. is also a vice village chief and his wife is a farm laborer.

Mr. Sareth K.’s problem is that his field has infertile soil. So, to improve his rice production, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer.

Mr. Sareth K. is the father of two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is studying in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Benito; el tiene 50  años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio trabaja en arreglos de zapatos desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, el tiene un puesto  en el Centro Comercial de Confraternidad, y por medio de este pequeño negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere tener una tienda de venta de zapatos. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para arreglar los zapatos.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II". The communal bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mr. Benito. He is 50 years old. He is married and has 4 children. The member works fixing shoes from 8:00am to 7:00pm. He has a stall in the Centro Comercial de Confraternidad and because of this small business he is able to give his children a good life. The members wants to have a store that sells shoes. The member is requesting a loan to buy materials to mend shoes. The member thanks the people who are helping him with his dream through this loan and promises to make his payments in the established installments.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is a requesting a loan to buy materials to mend shoes

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn A. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Rocelyn is separated from her spouse and has 2 young children. To make a living, Rocelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.
