Rocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Rocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin O., from Ngiya in Siaya town, is 23 years old, married to Roselyn, and the father of a three-year-old daughter. Edwin, who has been operating a cereals business for the last five years, has a monthly income of Kshs 30,000 and is now applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after having repaid the first one. He intends to use the money to buy green grams, maize and rice to add to his stock and will use the profits made to educate his daughter through school and pay for the family's needs.

Edwin's dream is to see the business grow and even open a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: To buy green grams, maize and rice to add to his stock.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine M. is a married lady. She has two children, aged twelve years old and four months old. She and her husband hope to give their children a quality education to the university level. Her business is located at the busy Mwingi market, though she is served by the thika branch office. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. 

Catherine makes curtains and clothes, as per customer orders, since she is a tailor. She has been in this business for ten years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is high prices for materials. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy materials to make more clothes to sell and to meet her customer's demands. She hopes to grow her business and to be able to make clothes to sell to many more customers. She also hopes to provide employment to many people. She sees herself building her own house. She describes herself as courageous, social and hardworking.

loans.use: Materials

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg D. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her family live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son is university student, and her two younger sons attend high school. Her husband operates a taxi service using his own car. Erdenechimeg makes a living selling clothing and shoes which are imported from Israel in one of the main markets in the city. She also sells farming equipment in a different stall in this same market. She is doing well because she has a wide selection of items and works hard to meet her customer's needs. Her goal is to pay for her children's education and make sure they have the best possible schooling. She is applying for a loan for 1,500,000 MNT to buy winter products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy winter products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo P. is from the village of Victoria. He is 56 years old. Ricardo is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Ricardo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Ricardo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ricardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ricardo is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ricardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Mr. Koeun D. (shown in the photo) is 42 years old and his wife, Mrs. Thoeun Oeun is 47 years old. They live on an Island in Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married for almost 20 years and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One was hired to sell food, one is a wooden house constructor and three are in school.  

Koeun is a motorbike repairman. His wife stays at home and does housework. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $300 to repair the house where he lives.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and has two adult sons. She sells clothing at the local open market. Ludmila started her business 10 years ago. Today she has three kiosks selling clothing. Ludmila works in one kiosk, and her husband and son sell in the other two. Good variety and affordable prices attract many clients.  Extensive experience helps Ludmila choose the right merchandise that will sell well. 

Ludmila is a very enthusiastic and happy person. She enjoys being in sales and dreams of opening a small shop in her town. Ludmila would like to borrow 12,000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal inventories.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventories

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en: Annaliza F. is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a business making siopao (steamed buns) and hamburgers. Her husband Melvin, who is 32 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 10 and 14 years old. Annaliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 years because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annaliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 9th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy ingredients for her siopao and hamburger making so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Annaliza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: to fund the operation of her siopao and hamburger making business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teodora; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de agua de manzana,ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia quiere tenr un atienda para poder vender el agua de manzana. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar manzanas al por mayor.             

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teodora is a member of the "Madres Trabajadoras" (Working Mothers) community bank which is located in Cusco district, province and department.

Teodora is 36 years old, married, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling apple water.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  She would like to have a store from which she could sell her apple water.

Teodora is requesting this loan to buy apples wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy apples wholesale

loans.name: Anipa's Group

texts.en:
Last year farming entrepreneurs became very vulnerable because of the political instability that occurred in Kyrgyzstan and caused a closure of borders with the neighboring countries. Businessmen lost a significant portion of their customers. Since those events entrepreneurs are recovering slowly and going back to a normal life. 
 
Anipa J., 56, is a leader of this group. She is a widow and lives with her four-year-old grandson. Anipa’s grandson goes to a daycare, and Anipa devotes the whole day to a business of cattle breeding. Two years ago her son recommended that she start this business, and since then she hasn’t regretted doing so once. Anipa buys young calves, breeds them and resells them in a local market. She gathered a group with three other stock breeders and applied for a loan from Kiva through its partner Mol Bulak Finance. The proceeds from this investment will help her to improve living conditions for her grandson. Anipa also runs a dairy business and sells milk to a local market every morning. Her primary challenges were high costs for transportation and feeding the cattle, but despite those hardships Anipa believes she will overcome all challenges and expand her business. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Chek T., 51, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. T. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 day. Her husband is a tuk-tuk driver, earning an income of USD 7 per day to help cover the family's expense. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 90 on the other necessary expenses. T. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Saadah

texts.en:
Saadah, a 44-year-old divorced woman from Bint Jbeil, has been working as a tailor and a beauty artist since 2003. Most of her clients are her relatives, friends and neighbors. She lives with her elderly mother and takes good care of her, saying that a mother is a blessing everyone must cherish.

Saadah is requesting her fourth loan from Al Majmoua in order to improve her business and to pay back money she borrowed from friends to pay for her mother's medication. Her previous loans have helped her a great deal, given she has no one else to help her in improving her business, economic, or social life.

All that Saadah hopes for is to have some rest after having confronted many problems that arose after her divorce and her mother's sickness.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda, de 52 años, se separó de su esposo hace 2 años. Pero trabaja arduamente para educar a sus 2 hijos. En su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Desde que tenía 18 años comenzó su camino en la siembra de arveja, maíz y papa, en sus terrenos propios y arrendados a las afueras de la localidad. En todo este tiempo pudo obtener buenos compradores en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, quienes le pagan muy bien por sus cosechas; con el tiempo comenzó a llevar sus productos a la capital del país. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder negociar sus cosechas. “Cuando se trabaja a tiempo completo y con mucha inteligencia, se obtiene muchas ganancias”, menciona. Su principal problema es el pago de los estudios de sus menores hijos, como también en el pago del arrendamiento de sus terrenos agrícolas. Ahora ella desea obtener su propio capital de dinero para poder invertir con más facilidad en las cosechas de los diferentes productos que constantemente siembra. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde se siente contenta por el trabajo de presidenta que desempeña. Herlinda, sembrará un promedio de 30 sacos de papa, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar con éxito su nuevo sembrío.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 52 years old.  She separated from her husband 2 years ago but works hard to educate her two children.  Herlinda lives in her own home which is located in the small village of Bellavista Huaracayo.

Herlinda started growing peas, corn and potatoes at the age of 18, on her own land and on rented land, on the outskirts of her village.  During this time, she has been able to obtain good buyers in the wholesale market in Tarma who pay her very well for her harvests.  Over time, she started taking her products to the country's capital.

What Herlinda most enjoys about her work is being able to negotiate her harvests.  "When you work full time and intelligently, you make good profits", she says.  Herlinda's main problem is paying for her children's studies and paying the rent on her farmland.  She would like to obtain her own capital in order to be able to invest more easily in her harvests of the different products that she constantly grows.

Herlinda is a member of the “Señor de Muruhuay” community bank and this is her ninth loan from MFP.  She feels very happy with her work as the president of her community bank.  Herlinda will sow an average of 30 sacks of potatoes.  She will use this loan to buy several sacks of organic manure so that she can start off her new crop successfully.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
El señor Elodio O. vive en la comunidad de Tres estrellas, es una comunidad que poco a poco va avanzando en carretera y servicios, ya cuenta con escuelas para los niños y va mejorando la educación. 

Eladio tiene una herreria, trabaja con aluminio y vidrio para ventanas y puertas. Él desea invertir el credito para comprar herramienta nueva y tambien para conseguir mas material para poder trabajar, Eladio nos dice: "lo complicado de mi negocio es que hay mas herrerias como la mía, entonces hay menos trabajo para mi".
Él espera que el prestamo le beneficie para poder tener un mejor futuro, tener mas trabajo y y un mejor estilo de vida para su familia, comenta que entre mas competencia tenga, tiene que terminar mas rápido, para entregar su trabajo mas rápido y buscar mas clientes.

Una de sus metas es que su negocio prospere, desea tener pronto un pedido y va a hacerlo  bien y con las ganancias quiere darle el dinero necesario para la casa a su esposa, comprar ropa, y espero que el dinero alcance para todos los gastos, Él vive en union libre desde hace 2 años, tiene una niña de 6 meses, la casa en la que vive es de sus padres y su esposa se dedica al hogar.
texts.en:
Eladio lives in the community of “Tres Estrellas” (Three Stars).  This community is slowly advancing as a result of a highway and services, such as schools for the children that will improve education. 

Eladio has a metal shop where he works with aluminum and glass for manufacturing windows and doors.  Eladio wants to invest this loan in the purchase of new equipment and more materials needed to complete his work.  He tells us that "what complicates his business is that there are many establishments that are similar to mine, so there is less work available for me." He hopes that this loan will benefit him so that he can have a better future, generate more work, and provide his family with a better lifestyle.  Since there is more competition, he must complete his work quickly so that he can attract more customers. 

His goals are for his business to prosper, generate more orders soon, and become successful.  With his earnings, Eladio wants to furnish his house with necessary items, and wife to be able to buy clothes.  He hopes to be able to do everything he needs to with his income.  

Eladio has been in a common law marriage for two years.  He has a six month old daughter.  His wife is a homemaker and they live with his parents.

loans.use: To purchase aluminum, glass, and equipment for his metal shop.

loans.name: Tajimurat

texts.ru: Ачилов Тажимурат проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 52 года. Он вдовец. У него большая семья, имеет 8 детей. Двое сыновей работаю в Москве. Сам Тажимурат у себя дома занимается торговлей запасных частей велосипеда.  В этой области он более 13 лет. По специальности Тажимурат мастер по сборке велосипеда и починке автомобилей. Поэтому он легко разбирается в этом деле. Кредит просит для покупки новых запасных частей велосипеда.
texts.en: Tajimurat A. lives in the region of Jilikul. He is 52 years old. He is a widower. His family is large, he has eight children. Two sons are now working in Moscow. Tajimurat sells bicycle spare parts from home. He has been in this business for more than thirteen years. His specializes in building bicycles and repairing vehicles. This is why this business is easy for him. He is asking for the loan to buy new spare parts for bicycles.

loans.use: to buy new bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Shaiymkul's Group

texts.en:
Shaiymkul A. is the leader of this group. She is 40 and married to a taxi driver. She has four daughters and a son. Her two older daughters work in Russia and the other children study at school. The family is engaged in agriculture. They breed livestock animals and cultivate agricultural products. Shaiymkul started to breed livestock two years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 soms. By reselling livestock after fattening, they earn 1,500 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Shaiymkul wants to purchase a variety of seeds for farming. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia de 27 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora, con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Delia se esmera por sobresalir en la vida y agradece a sus padres por brindarle educación superior, ella práctica la profesión de enfermera, trabaja en el centro de Salud San Francisco y en sus horas libres aprovecha para trabajar en las farmacias. Ella se entrega por completo a su trabajo, por que gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano pudo comprarse un lote de terreno que con mucho sacrificio trata de levantar los cimientos de su vivienda. Le gusta su trabajo y estar pendiente de sus pacientes quienes la agradecen por su paciencia y trato hacia ellos. Delia con el crédito solicitado mejorará las fachadas de su vivienda. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir creciendo y ahorrando sus ingresos económicos ya que tiene planificado abrir un centro medico dentro de la ciudad de San Francisco. Este es su primer crédito de Delia con MFP, se siente muy comprometida en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente por que desea acceder a otros créditos mas adelante. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles solicitados mejorará la fachada de su casa, ya que desea vivir cómodamente.
texts.en: Delia, 27, is a cheerful and hard working single woman who wants to succeed in life. she lives at home and what she wants the most is achieve a greater income in order to provide economic stability for her future family. Delia strives to excel in life and thanks her parents for providing her with the opportunity to go to college. She works as a nurse in the San Francisco Medical Center. In her free time, she works pharmacies. She is completely dedicated to her work. Thanks to her daily effort she was able to buy a plot of land. Now she is sacrificing greatly in order to build a house there. She enjoys her work treating patients who appreciate her for her patience and medical attention. With the loan she is requesting, Delia will improve her home. The plan she has in mind is to continue to grow her savings until she can open a medical center in the city of San Francisco. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very committed to make all of the payments on time so that she can receive other loans in the future. With the requested $725 she will improve the outside of her home, in order to live more comfortably.

loans.use: make home improvements

loans.name: Deysi   Laura

texts.es: La señora  Deysi  tiene mucho entusiasmo de trabajar con nuestra institución, ella  es una cliente nueva muy emprendedora    que tiene muchas ganas de superación ya que la señora  esta realizando  su tesis de grado en la universidad de la carrera de derecho,  tiene dos hijos que  están  en la edad  escolar. La Sra. Deysi vive en la zona de Munaypata de igual manera su taller esta ubicado en  la misma dirección.  Esta muy contenta de que se le haya elegido para el programa kiva debido a que siente beneficiada de gran manera con el préstamo que se le otorga,  se dedica a  la   confección de mandiles para señoras. El crédito lo  destinará  para comprar tela por mayor y una maquina  juki de confección. Y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Deysi is very excited about working with our institution.  She is a new, very enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead because she’s writing her law thesis at the university.  She has two school age children.

Deysi lives in the Munaypata zone and her workshop is there too.  She is very happy to have been chosen for the Kiva program because she feels greatly benefitted by the loan she’s being granted.  She makes aprons for women.  The loan will be used to buy fabric at wholesale and a Juki sewing machine to thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en:
Normalita, 21 years old, is married with one child and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Normalita has owned a mini grocery store, selling basic foods such as rice, corn, water, medicine and feed, for more than 2 years. She likes this type of business as she earns PHP 6,000 per month. Normalita wants to double her income, so she needs more capital for her grocery store. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase additional stock to sell.

Normalita is a new member of GDDMPC. In the future, she hopes to improve her store and be able to display more items.

loans.use: to  purchase additional stock

loans.name: Diala

texts.en:
Diala is 23 years old, married, has one child and lives in Al Aqaba, Jordan. She is the oldest daughter in a family with five children. When she was growing up, her mother did not work outside of their home, but had a reputation in her community as an excellent cook. Diala remembers waking up early in the morning before school and bathing and grooming her younger sisters, all the while being drawn to the kitchen by the smell of the fresh falafel, beans and warm bread with hot tea that her mother would prepare for breakfast. Though her family survived on the small income that her father made as a spice peddler, Diala remembers how her mother kept their door open to her neighbors and friends, who knew they could always stop by for a warm welcome and a hot meal.

Diala learned the art of food preparation from her mother, along with her commitment to share their food and homes with people in their community. Diala is also developing a home-based business where she makes pastries to sell. She is applying for a loan for 400 JOD to buy an automatic oven and equipment to start making pickles. Her goal is to increase her income and eventually open a pastry shop. She would also like to earn enough money to buy a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy an automatic oven and equipment to start making pickles.

loans.name: Lovisa

texts.en:
Lovisa is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. Lovisa has a stationery business, which she has run for five years. She also has rental houses.
To help expand her business, Lovisa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase exercise books and reams of paper. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Lovisa hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Lovisa hopes to start up another business.

loans.use: to purchase exercise books and reams of paper.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 35 years old and single. She lives in the Philippines. For the past year, Raquel is has been a farmer and she raises pigs to earn a living. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

Raquel is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente de 32 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Cañaris que pertenece a la provincia de Ferreñafe y al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Vicente es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra café, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos diarios de su familia. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y para el pago de mano de obra cuando se inicie la cosecha de café, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así tener mejoras económicas.  Vicente es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que su familia mejore y tenga algunas comodidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
Vicente is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his family. The only service they receive is electricity. Vicente resides in the rural section of the District of Cañaris, which is part of Ferreñafe Province in the Department of Lambayque. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture and livestock breeding.

Vicente is a farmer and has his own land on which he grows coffee. Once his crop is harvested, his product is offered at different markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque. With the income he generates, Vicente is able to cover the daily expenses of his family.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN in order to buy fertilizers to improve his land and his crops. He will also pay for labor when the coffee is ready to be harvested. In the end, he hopes to obtain a good price from the merchants and improve financially. Vicente is a father who is concerned about seeing his family get better and acquiring a few comforts for their home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for labor during the harvest season.

loans.name: Falasteen

texts.en:
Falasteen is a 42-year-old woman, who is helping her husband in his business selling bottled water. They have a contract with one of the small factories that filters water to distribute drinking water bottles in the areas that cannot be reached.

Being in the business for six years has given them a trusted reputation. Now Falasteen has applied for a loan to buy more bottled water at a good price to be able to cover and serve more people in the area.

loans.use: to buy more bottled water at a good price to serve more people in the area.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is 45 and has three school-age children. Despite of being a widower, he has the strong determination to improve his childrens' status of living and give them a better life. He has owned and managed a rice farming business in their village for almost 28 years, earning profits of P26,000 in every harvest season. He works hard and endures hardships for he wants his children to finished their studies and earns a degree.

Juanito is requesting additional capital of P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to sustain his rice production. He believes that with the help of this loan he will improve his rice production and increase his income. He hopes that in the future all of his children will finish their studies and find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to sustain his rice production

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is an ambitious young man living in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda.  For two years, he has been selling agricultural produce and with the money earned, he has been able to buy land. He faces the challenge of a poor road network, which hinders him in transporting goods from the farmers to the market. His dream is to set up a food store. Stephen intends to use the loan to buy rice, beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame Mariam est âgée  de 41 ans mariée, mère d’un enfant et vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux ,sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
N’ayant pas eu la chance de faire de continuer les études, elle s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis son jeune âge, qu’elle apprit auprès de sa maman. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités génératrices  de revenus,  elle finit par opter pour l’achat vente de d’articles divers notamment  les tissus, les chaussures, les bijoux, l’encens et les pagnes wax, il y a 12 ans.  
Cette activité lui procure de revenus car elle reçoit  beaucoup de commandes dans le mois. 
Pour l’agrandissement de son activité,  Mariam a fait  recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a  5 ans.  Après  3 prêts solidaire (prêt de groupe ) tous payés correctement, elle est à son 3 eme   prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été bien remboursés.  
Avec ce financement elle compte acheter, 30 pièces de différents sortes de pagnes à Bamako (capitale du Mali), Elle effectue sa vente d’une façon ambulante dans la  ville  de Koutiala, à une clientèle  mixte en détail, à crédit et au comptant. 
Elle compte sur un bénéfice de 70.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de l’échéance du prêt et contribuer aux petites dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Mariam is 41, married and the mother of one child. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-spouse and their children in the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region). 
 
Not having had the good fortune to continue her studies, she quickly and at a young age became interested in money-earning activities that she worked at together with her mother. After having tried several of these, she finally decided, 12 years ago,  to buy and sell various items, especially fabric, shoes, costume jewelry, incense and lengths of African print cloth. This activity brings in income, as she receives lots of orders every month.  

In order to grow her business, Mariam came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After three solidarity (group) loans, all repaid correctly, she is now on her third individual loan. The other two individual loans were also correctly reimbursed. 
 
With this loan she intends to buy 30 lengths of different sorts of African print cloth in Bamako (capital of Mali). She does her selling by walking around the town of Koutiala, to a mixed clientele, retail, for cash or credit. 

She is counting on a profit of 70,000 F CFA per month which she will use to reimburse the loan as it falls due and contribute to covering the small expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy lengths of African print cloth.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im is a 51-year-old widow who lives with two lovely children whom she supports in Kompong Speu Province; it’s a zone where agribusiness is common. The majority of the region's inhabitants are in the cattle and rice business. 

Currently, she is a rice cultivator who works hard to cover her family’s needs. It is a skill that she had learned from her parents. She has been operating this business since 1979. What she wants to see is providing her family live in better quality of life. From this business, she is able to earn an average of $2 for each day for supporting her family's daily expenses. 

To upgrade their living Im would like to purchase a motorbike, but she is lacking some capital, so she wishes to request some funding through HKL, one of Kiva’s partners. 

She is hoping that generous lenders will provide a loan to her. She is very committed to pay back to donors punctually. She say that she is a conscientious, straightforward person. She is very grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it provides her. She is shown with her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in the Mombasa area of Coastal province in Kenya. He is married and has four children. The eldest, age 21, is to join college. The second is in high school. The third is in class seven and the last, in class four. 

Samuel is a trained carpenter and has been in the carpentry business for the last 15 years, although the current business is three years old.  He also buys old furniture that he refurbishes and then sells. 
 
He joined Milango in March, 2011, after being invited by his friends. A loan of KES 40,000 will help Samuel buy the materials for a construction job at the medical services department at the provincial hospital.

Samuel owns three rental houses and looks forward to building more houses and to improving his current business in the near future.

He faces the challenge of high cost of timber; the wood is sourced from Tanzania and Democratic Republic of Congo. This greatly raises the cost of business operations. 

The income from this business will enable Samuel educate his children and provide services to other needy Kenyans. He advises our partners to continue lending to Milango as this has improved their lifestyle through access to credit.

loans.use: to buy materials for a construction job at the hospital.

loans.name: Jhon Alexander

texts.es:
A sus 18 años de edad Jhon sueña con poder generar mayores ingresos para poder estudiar en la universidad y tener un mejor futuro, y así más adelante poder pensar en tener su propio hogar.

Actualmente se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, café, aguacates, frutas y minutos de celular en un pequeño puesto de venta ambulante. Con el crédito quiere comprar un carrito que le permita mejorar su venta al publico.
texts.en:
Jhon is only 18 years old, but he has big dreams.  He wants to make enough money to go to college, establish a career and one day have a home of his own.  

Jhon works as a street vendor, selling coffee, avocados, fruits and cell-phone minutes, from a small cart that he owns.  He will use this loan to buy a larger cart so that he can sell more.

loans.use: to buy a larger food cart for his retail business.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en: Hani is a 35-year-old married man from Gaza. He owns a cell phone store and hopes that with this loan he will be able to increase the size of his store. He also hopes that once he does, this will bring in more customers and increase his income. Once his income is higher, he anticipates that he, his wife, and seven children will live a better life.

loans.use: to increase the size of his store.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 30-year-old a married woman with three children between the ages of 3 and 11, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling maize grains in Kator, South Sudan, for five years.

Eva requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase maize. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase maize grains for sale.
